loans.name: Nieves

texts.es: Nieves D. 63 años resiD. en la localidad D. Palcamayo. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su hija menor Liz D. 26 años, quien es el motivo D. todos sus esfuerzos. DesD. muy pequeña aprendió a trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo que se tiene que hacer, para lograr un buen cultivo. Ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Ella siembra arveja, espinaca y zanahoria, las cuales lleva a vender al mercado mayorista D. Tarma. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que su arduo trabajo esta dando sus frutos. Lleva 40 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos D. las plagas D. insectos que pueden afectarlos. Con la fortaleza que la caracteriza trabaja sola en sus terrenos agrícolas, pues aprendió D. la vida a salir adelante por si misma. Pero en campañas agrícolas contrata peones para que le puedan ayudar en la cosecha. Además D. tener el apoyo D. su hija quien tiene un camión con el que trasporta su producción a la capital del país, “yo tengo todo”, menciona doña Nieves, “canastas, costales y demás materiales para trasportar”. Con el tiempo espera, comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar su producción. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen María” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donD. espera D. su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Nieves D. obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. 2 bolsas D. semilla D. arveja y varios sacos D. abono orgánico para comenzar con su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Nieves is 63 years old. She lives in the town of Palcamayo. She is described as being a cheerful and hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with her youngest daughter, Liz, who is 26 and the reason for all her hard work. When she was very young she learned to work in the fields with her parents, who taught her what has to be done to have a good crop. Now she has her own land which she plants and takes care of with much love and patience. She plants peas, spinach and carrots which she sells in the wholesale market of Tarma. What she liks the most about her job is harvesting her crops, since she feels that her hard work is producing. She has spent 40 years doing this activity and she thinks that the hardest thing is protecting her crops from insects that can affect them. With the strenghth that characterizes her, she works alone in her fields, and she learned how to get ahead on her own. She does hire workers to help her with the harvest. Besides having the support of her daughter, who has a truck with which she transports her product to the country's capital. “I have everything"  Nieves says,  “baskets, bushels and everything else for transportation”. In time, she hopes to buy more land to increase production. She belongs to the “Virgen María” community bank and this is her sixth loan with MFP, where she hopes to have cooperation to cement her plans. On the other hand, she is committed once more to making her payments, as with the previous loans she had. She also likes being a part of her community bank because all of the members are responisble and supportive.  Upon getting your support, Nieves will invest the money in buying 2 bags of pea seed and various bags of organic fertilizer with her next planting.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seed and various bags of organic ferilizer.

loans.name: Santos Valentin

texts.es: Santos, un productor 47 años, de la zona de San Antonio comarca del munipicio de Pueblo Nuevo - Estelí, de origen muy humilde, casado y con cinco hijos, dedicado a la agricultura desde muy corta edad, entre otras actividades se dedica también a la siembra de tabaco, lo cual solicitó su crédito para poder pagar el alquiler de las tierras donde tiene sembrado el tabaco, él nos cuenta que tiene un contrato con una importante empresa la cual es la que le compra el producto y le genera buenas ganancias. Manifiesta que no ha sido fácil conseguir sus objetivos ya que tuvo que dejar sus estudios en el tercer año de secundaria para poder trabajar la tierra y sufragar los gastos de su hogar. En un futuro desea comprar una motocicleta, una pequeña casa para su familia y seguir trabajando en la siembra de tabaco y porque no comprar un terreno donde pueda sembrar su tabaco sin incurrir en gastos de alquiler de terreno.
texts.en:
Santos, a 47 year old tobacco producer, lives in the San Antonio zone, a region in the Pueblo Nuevo – Estelí municipality.  He comes from very humble beginnings.  He is married and has five children.

He has been a farmer from a very early age.  Among other business activities, he also devotes himself to growing tobacco.  

He requested a loan in order to pay the rent on some land where he grows tobacco.  He tells us that he has a contract with an important company.  This company buys his product, which generates good income for him.  He states that it has not been easy to reach his objectives.  He had to leave his studies in the third year of high school in order to be able to work the land and pay for the household expenses.

In the future he wishes to buy a motorcycle, to buy a small house for his family, to continue working at growing tobacco, and, why not, buy land where he can plant tobacco without incurring the cost of renting the land.

loans.use: to rent land to grow tobacco.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia nació en la ciudad de Lima (Perú) y tiene 54 años de edad. Actualmente, Patricia vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su único hijo.  Patricia se dedica a la venta de artesanía (Tejidos Planos) en el mercado de Chinchero desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como por ejemplo lana, hilos y otras cosas más. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Inti Quilla” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: Patricia was born in the city of Lima (Perú) and she is 54 years old. At present, Patricia lives in the city of Cuzco with her only son. Patricia sells artisanal crafts (tejidos planos) in the market of Chinchero from 8 in the morning until 7 at night. She has been in this business for several years, and it is going very well for her thanks to the dedication she brings to her work. At this time, she needs the loan to buy more materials, such as wool, thread and other things. She is a responsible and hardworking person and because of these qualities the other members invited her to join the community bank called “Inti Quilla” of the Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy more materials.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad de 53 años, reside en la localidad de Palcamayo. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy trabajadora y sincera, vive en su casa propia junto a su hijo menor Alan de 24 años, quien siempre la ayuda en el trabajo. Todas las mañanas, desde muy temprano. Soledad tiene que distribuir su tiempo en varias actividades. Durante todo el día se dedica en la venta de leña y es muy solicitada por sus clientes. Con 30 años en este negocio desea para el futuro, incrementar la cantidad de leña que tiene y así tener plata para pagar los estudios superiores de su hijo, a quien cuida con mucho amor y siempre se ha preocupado por que no le falte nada. Hace poco sufrió una operación del apéndice, por lo que está en cama. Pero esta dificultad no la amilana, a contrario le ida fuerzas para salir adelante. En sus tiempos libres se dedica a la agricultura, con la siembra de lechuga, espinaca y arveja; los cuales después de cuidarlos y fertilizarlos constantemente los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Ella disfruta de conversar con sus clientes y siempre suelta una broma para llevarse mejor con ellos, ya que su principal estrategia en la vida es la alegría que le pone a todo lo que hace. Por ello está segura que podrá ser una de las mejores agricultoras y comerciante de la zona. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen María” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Soledad de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 4 bolsas de semilla de arveja que oscila entre los S/. 375 soles cada uno y el resto comprará abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre sus sembríos de espinaca.
texts.en:
Soledad, 53, lives in Palcamayo.  She is notable for being a hard working, sincere woman.  She lives in her own house with her youngest son, Alan, 24, who always helps her with her work.  Every morning, starting very early, Soledad has to divide her time among several activities.  She sells firewood, that’s in quite high demand from her customers, all day.  With 30 years in this business she wants for the future to increase the amount of firewood she has in order to have money to pay for her son’s higher education; she cares for him with much love and has always seen to it that he’s had everything he needs.

She recently had surgery on her appendix so is bedridden.  But this difficulty doesn’t discourage her; on the contrary it’s given her strength to continue forward.  During her free time she farms lettuce, spinach and peas which, after caring for and fertilizing them constantly, she sells in Tarma’s wholesale market.  She enjoys chatting with her customers and jokes around with them to get along with them better since her main strategy in life is to put joy into everything she does.  Because of this she’s sure that she can become one of the best farmers and merchants in the zone.

She belongs to the “Virgen María” (Virgin Mary) communal bank and this is the 9th loan with MFP where she hopes to have your collaboration to continue toward her goals.  On the other hand, she commits to making her payments like she’s done with previous loans.  Besides, she enjoys being part of the communal bank because all the members are responsible, mutually supportive people.  

If Soledad were to receive the support of the requested loan, she’d use it to buy four sacks of pea seeds which cost around 375 soles each and would use the rest to buy organic manure to spread among her spinach crops.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of pea seeds and sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Yulbe

texts.es: Yulbe, es un hombre alegre y trabajador de 36 años. Reside en la comunidad nativa Pumpuriani (selva central peruana), ahí formó su familia junto a Jarid de 25 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos menores, Yens de 6 y Zian de un año a los que cuidan y educan en su casa propia. A sus cortos 19 años comenzó su camino por la agricultura, con el tiempo fue adquiriendo mucha experiencia, sobre todo en las técnicas de cultivo. En sus sembríos de café, plátanos, maíz híbrido y yuca, aplica todo lo aprendido; ahora está poniendo en práctica unos viveros de café; con ello podrá renovar sus plantaciones de manera rápida con el objetivo de obtener sembríos de mayor calidad. Ahora es uno de los mejores productores de café en su localidad, es reconocido por su trabajo y constantemente los compradores mayoristas visitan sus terrenos agrícolas para poder negociar sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es pasar la mayor parte de su tiempo en el campo. En adelante él está pensando comprar más terrenos de cultivo, con los que podrá ampliar sus sembríos y producir a gran escala. Por ello está agradecido con el trabajo de su asociación, ya que sin su apoyo no podría sembrar en mayor cantidad y calidad; afirma. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Hormiguitas de pumpuriani” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde espera un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Yulbe, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos de plátanos que hace poco sembró.
texts.en:
Yulbe is a cheerful and hard-working 36 year-old man.  He lives in the indigenous community of Pumpuriani (in the central Peruvian rainforest).  This is where he formed his family, together with 25 year-old Jarid.  The couple have two dependent children: 6 year-old Yens and 1 year-old Zian, who they care for and educate in their own home.

At just 19 years of age, Yulbe started working in agriculture.  He acquired a lot of experience over the years, above all in growing techniques.  He applies all the knowledge he has gained to his coffee, banana, hybrid corn and cassava crops.  Right now, he is establishing some coffee nurseries.  This will enable him to renovate his plantations quickly with the goal of obtaining better-quality crops.  Yulbe is one of the best coffee producers in his town.  He is well known for his work and wholesale purchasers are always visiting his land in order to negotiate for his produce.

What Yulbe most enjoys about his work is spending most of his time out in the fields.  In the future, he is thinking of buying more land so that he can expand his crop growing and produce on a larger scale.  He is grateful for the work of his community bank because, without their support, he would not be able to grow a larger quantity of better-quality crops.  He belongs to the "Hormiguitas de Pumpuriani" (Little Ants of Pumpuriani) community bank and this is his sixth loan from MFP.  He hopes to receive a small loan so that he can reach his goals.  For his part, he pledges once again to make his repayments on time as he has done with his previous loans.

Yulbe enjoys being a member of his community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  With your support, Yulbe will invest the money he has requested in buying several sacks of organic manure to spread amongst his banana crops that he planted recently.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Severiano Jose

texts.es: Severiano de 42 años, habita en Chacaraseca una pequeña comunidad ubicada en León, es padre de tres hijos, el es agricultor, con estudios básicos solo termino el cuarto grado de primaria. Empezó a los 27 años de edad, su primer negocio fue la agricultura, sembrando ajonjolí, maíz y yuca el conto con  la ayuda de un tío quien le dio herramientas necesarias para cultivar, después el continuo solo por su cuenta, y cembro  yuca así fue surgiendo poco a poco. También se dedica a la ganadería como otro ingreso que el posee. Requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abono para sembrar yuca (vegetal). Con esta inversión piensa sacar una producción de calidad. Su meta próxima es sembrar 2 manzanas de  hortalizas tales como ayote, pepino.
texts.en:
Severiano is 42 years old and lives in Chacaraseca, a small community in León.  He has three children and works as a farmer.  He received a basic education.  He only finished his fourth year of elementary school.

Severiano started out at 27 years of age.  His first business was farming, growing sesame, corn and cassava.  He had the help of an uncle who gave him the tools he needed to farm.  He then continued working on his own, growing cassava, gradually making progress.

Severiano also raises livestock and this makes him additional income.  He needs this loan to buy supplies, fertilizers and manure for growing cassava (vegetable).  With this investment, he plans to obtain a good-quality production.  His next goal is to sow two 'manzanas' (one 'manzana' = 1.68 acres) of land with vegetables such as squash and cucumber.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers and manure for growing cassava

loans.name: Marixza Lorena

texts.es: Marixza Lorena tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad y reside en el Municipio de Patuca. Para subsistir ella inició vendiendo nacatamales y luego de un tiempo y de algunos ahorr, decidió darle un giro nuevo a su forma de ganarse la vida y actualmente se dedica a la siembra, cosecha y venta de Yuca. Tiene dos manzanas de Yuca sembradas y en estas fechas el clima es lluvioso por lo que trabaja diariamente de 6:00 am a 4:00 pm. Con el prestamo solicitado comprará formula 18-46-0, urea, abono y pagará mano de obra.
texts.en: Marixza Lorena is 36 years old, married and has a five-year-old son; she lives in the town of Patuca.  To subsist she started out selling Nacatamales (Nicaraguan style tamales) and after a time and with some savings she decided to change her way of earning a living and now farms manioc to sell.  She has two manzanas (Central American land measure) planted with manioc and because this is the rainy season she works every day from 6am until 4pm.  She will use the requested loan to buy Formula 18-36-0, urea and manure and to pay labor costs.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Nelson de 30 años, reside en la comunidad nativa Pumpuriani (selva central peruana). Ahí conformó su familia junto a Jovana de 30 años, su esposa. Ambos tienen 4 hijos menores de edad a los que cuida con mucho amor y cariño en su casa propia. Siempre responsable y trabajador, Nelson se dedica hace 6 años a la agricultura; donde siembra café, plátanos, maíz y achiote, en sus terrenos propios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la compañía de su esposa quien le ayuda junto a los peones que contrata eventualmente. Todos trabajan en el plantado, mantenimiento y cosecha de sus tierras. Además confiesa emocionado que la agricultura le gusta mucho. Porque es lo que aprendió desde pequeño, asimismo asegura que su actividad es rentable porque le ha permitido construir su casa, comprar algunos muebles pero sobretodo cubrir la educación de sus hijos y los gastos domésticos sin problema. Por eso para más adelante se proyecta a trabajar con ahínco para construir la otra parte de su casa dividiéndolos en habitaciones individuales, así como también acondicionará un cuarto para acopiar productos oriundos de la zona y convertirse en un gran mayorista de frutos, además continuará con su proyecto del vivero. Reconoce que los integrantes de su asociación son bastante unidos, ahí aprende a trabajar con ellos en busca de un futuro mejor para cada uno y para toda su comunidad. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Hormiguitas de pumpuriani” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Nelson, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para distribuirlos en sus cultivos de café que hace poco sembró y que está seguro podrá brindarle una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Nelson, 30, lives in the native community of Pumpuriani (Peruvian central jungle).  He formed a family there with Jovana, 30, his wife.  They have four minor children that they care for with much love and affection in his own house.  Always responsible and hard working, Nelson has been farming for the last six years.  He grows coffee, bananas, corn and annatto on his own lands.  

What he most enjoys about his work is his wife’s company who helps him, alongside day laborers he occasionally hires, with his chores.  They all work planting, caring for and harvesting the crops.  In addition, he confesses with feeling that he likes farming very much because he learned it while still a little boy and he assures that it’s a profitable business because it’s allowed him to build his house, to buy some furniture and, above all, to cover his children’s education and domestic expenses with no problem.  Because of this, for later on, he’s planning to work with much dedication to build the rest of his house dividing it into individual rooms and also to equip a room in which to gather crops from surrounding areas and become a fruit wholesaler; he will also continue with his nursery project.

He admits that his group members are quite united.  He learns how to work together with them there seeking a better future for each one of them and for all of their community.  He’s a member of the “Hormiguitas de Pumpuriani” (Pumpuriani’s Little Ants) communal bank and this is the 6th loan with MFP where he hopes to have collaboration to continue toward his goals.  On the other hand, he commits once again to make his installment payments like he’s done in previous loans.  He also is grateful for being part of a communal bank because all the members are responsible and very mutually supportive.

If Nelson were to receive the requested support, he will use the money to buy several sacks of organic manure to spread among his coffee plants which he recently planted and that he’s sure will produce a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es: Narciso de 54 años reside en la localidad de Palcamayo. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su madre Manuela de 95 años, a quien cuida y desea brindar una mejor vida. El trabajo al que se dedica Narciso es la cerrajería, su negocio es muy concurrido ya que es de los pocos que se dedica a esta actividad en su pueblo, todos los días desde muy temprano empieza a atender a sus clientes, quienes conociendo la buena calidad de sus trabajos, no dudan en encomendarle el arreglo de sus cerrojos, planchas metálicas, tubos para puertas y estufas metálicas. Según afirma lo que le genera mayor rentabilidad es la estufa que vende a un promedio de S/. 500 nuevos soles cada una. Hay momentos en los que le llega mucho trabajo, y para entregar sin demora contrata a personas quienes le ayudan en su labor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ayudar a sus clientes cuando pierden sus llaves, ya que ven en él a su salvador, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que esperar clientes todo el día en su tienda. En adelante, espera seguir trabajando con las mismas fuerzas, con el único fin de sobresalir en la vida. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen María” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está contento de saber que tendrá el apoyo financiero que tanto necesita. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Narciso de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales para la construcción de objetos metálicos.
texts.en:
Narciso is 54 years old and lives in the town of Palcamayo.  He is noted for being a simple and hardworking man.  He lives in a rented house with his 95 year old mother, Manuela, who he cares for and wants to give a better life.  

Narciso works as a locksmith. His business is very busy because it is one of the few that does this work in his town.  Every day, starting very early, he serves his customers.  His customers know the quality of his work, so they don't hesitate to have him repair their bolts, metal plates, tubes for doors, and metal stoves.  

According to Narciso, the item that generates the most income is the stove that sells for an average of 500 nuevos soles each.  There are times when he has a lot of work and in order to deliver promptly, he hires people to help with his work.  The thing he likes best about his work is helping customers when they lose their keys because they see him as their savior.  He has done this work for 20 years and he thinks the most difficult thing is to have to wait for customers all day in his store.  In the future, he wants to continue working with the same effort with the goal of succeeding in life.

He is a member of the community bank Virgen María and this is his second loan with MFP.  He is happy to know that he will have the financial support that he needs.  On the other hand, he promises once again to make his payments on time, as he has done with his past loans.  He is thankful to be part of his community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.  

When Narcisco receives your support, he will invest the loan in the purchase of materials to construct metal objects.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his metal shop.

loans.name: Elvin

texts.es: Elvin de 45 años, es un hombre honesto y dedicado a su familia, él está separado de Marcelia, con la que tuvo 5 hijos,  pero como buen padre su vida se centra en cuidarlos y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida, ya que todos son menores de edad. Él vive en su casa propia ubicada en la  comunidad nativa de Pumpuriani (selva central peruana). Desde muy niño se dedicó a la agricultura, cuando ya adquirió su familia, hace ya 22 años, comenzó a sembrar en sus propios terrenos agrícolas; comenzó con el plátano y el café, productos bandera en la selva peruana; pero sus años de experiencia y dedicación le enseñaron a sembrar “achiote”, cuyo procedimiento es muy complejo y muy pocas personas se dedican a su cultivo; lo que hace de Elvin uno de los pocos productores de la localidad; sus ventas le generan buena rentabilidad y por ende buenos ingresos; “los mismos comercializadores viene personalmente a comprar mis productos”, afirma. Además de tener más de una cosecha en el año, lo que le hace generar mayores ingresos económicos. Más adelante quiere comprar su propio terreno agrícola, ya que los que siembra son terrenos de la comunidad; con ello piensa consolidar su producción y poder pagar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos. Sabe que con la oportunidad que le brinda su asociación, podrá salir adelante, ya que sin ellos no podría “obtener algo más”, culmina con mucha alegría. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Hormiguitas de pumpuriani” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP,  donde esta contento de saber que tendrá el apoyo financiero que tanto necesita. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Elvin, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de bolsas de abono orgánico (abono natural), y en la contrata de peones para que le ayuden a abonar y limpiar la maleza de sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Elvin, 45, is an honest man who is dedicated to his family.  He is separated from Marcelia, with whom he had 5 children, but as a good father, his life revolves around caring for them and offering them a better quality of life since they are all still minors.  He lives in his own house located in the native community of Pumpuriana (central Peruvian jungle).  From the time he was very young he worked in agriculture and when he started his family, more than 22 years ago, he began to farm his own fields.  He started with plantains and coffee, foremost products of the Peruvian jungle.  But with his years of experience and dedication, he learned to grow “achiote” (annnato) which is a more difficult crop and very few people work with it.  That makes Elvin one of  the few producers in his area.  His sales are profitable and thus he gets a good income “the same buyers personally come to purchase his products” he says.  Besides, he has more than one crop per year and this generates more income.  In the future he wants to buy his own land since what he works on now are communal fields. With this he plans to consolidate his production and be able to pay university studies of his children.  

He knows that the opportunity offered him by the association will help him get ahead, because without them he knows can’t achieve more.  This will work out very happily for him.  He belongs to the Hormiguitas de Pumpuriani communal bank and this is his sixth loan with MFP, where he is happy to know that he will have the financial support that he needs.  He promises again to make all his payments on time as he did with previous loans.  He appreciates being part of the communal bank because all of the members are responsible and united.  Elvin will use the requested money  to buy bags of organic fertilizer (natural fertilizer) and he will hire some field hands to help him fertilize and clean out the weeds in his crops.

loans.use: To buy sakcs of organic fertilizer and to hire field hands

loans.name: Yulver

texts.es: Yulver, de 36 años reside en la localidad de Palcamayo. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Roselin de 30 años y sus dos queridos hijos, a quienes quiere mucho. Los extensos campos de sembrado que posee Yulver, son el fruto de una vida de arduo trabajo y una firme convicción de sobresalir en la vida, sus productos son muy solicitados en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que su fama de cosechar cultivos de calidad le ayuda a vender sus productos a muy buenos precios. Entre sus principales sembríos se encuentra la arveja, espinaca y flor de gladiolo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden aquejarlos, lleva 24 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los sacos de papa y arveja, ya que son muy pesados y le cansan mucho. Ahora está pensando sembrar espinaca y gladiolo después de su cosecha de flores para esta festividad de fiestas patrias. Es por eso que en adelante, espera comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda hacer más fácil el traslado de sus productos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen María” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Yulver de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Yulver, 36, lives in Palcamayo.  He is noted for being a very unassuming, hard working man.  He lives in his own house with his wife, Roselin, 30, and their two beloved children that he loves very much.  The extensive fields Yulver has planted are fruit of a lifetime of hard work and a firm conviction to get ahead in life.  His products are highly sought after in Tarma’s wholesale market because of his reputation for producing high quality crops; this helps him sell his products at very good prices.  Among his main crops are peas, spinach and gladioli.  

What he most enjoys about his work is insuring that his crops stay free of plant pests that can affect them.  He’s been in this line of work for 24 years and considers the most difficult part of it having to transport the sacks of potatoes and peas because they are very heavy and they tire him out quite a bit.  

He’s currently planning to plant spinach and gladioli after the flower harvest for the recent national feast days.  He plans to buy a car later on to make transportation of his products a little easier.

He belongs to the “Virgen María” (Virgin Mary) communal bank and this is the fourth loan with MFP where he hopes to get a small loan to meet his objectives.  On the other hand, he commits once more to make his installment payments like he’s done with past loans.  

He enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are responsible and very mutually supportive people.  If Yulver were to obtain your support, he will invest the requested money in the purchase of two sacks of pea seeds for his next planting.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of pea seeds.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
La señora Santos es casada, tiene 46 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. asistir a la escuela, tiene 6 hijos 3 D. los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también a la artesanía  a la elaboración D. canasta D. plástico, inició este negocio gracia a un poco D. capital que tenia y hasta el momento lleva 5 años D. experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

DeciD. organizar un grupo para poder solicitar  un préstamo que le servirá  para la compra D. cintas y venas D. plástico que es materia prima para la elaboración D. canastas ya que en el futuro desea ver su negocio mejor y más granD.. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio, a la producción agrícola y a la artesanía.
texts.en:
Santos is married.  She’s 46 years old and never had the opportunity to go to school.  She has six children three of which are in school.  She is a housewife but also a craftswoman.  She makes plastic baskets.  She started the business thanks to a bit of capital she had and, to date, has five years experience.  She has support from her husband, who is a merchant.

She decided to organize a group to request a loan that she can use to buy plastic strips which is the raw material used to make the baskets because she’d like to see her business be larger and better in the future.  The other group members are in commerce, farming and crafts.

loans.use: to buy plastic strips.

loans.name: Rosa Noelia

texts.es: Rosa Noelia se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio. Es una persona muy trabajadora, dedicada a su familia y muy orgullosa de sus raíces. Tiene su familia, por lo que siempre esta preocupándose por brindarle lo necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de bolsos, calzado, cosméticos, tratamientos, sabanas, toallas y ropa en general.  Desea poder seguir adelante con su medio de vida que es lo más importante.
texts.en: Rosa Noelia sells general merchandise.  She’s been in business for over four years.  She is a very hard working person who is devoted to her family and very proud of her roots.  She has her family so she is always focused on providing what they need.  The financing she’s requesting is to buy purses, footwear, cosmetics, treatments, sheets, towels and clothing in general.  She wants to be able to continue moving forward with her means of support which is what’s most important.

loans.use: to buy purses, footwear, cosmetics, treatments, sheets, towels and clothing.

loans.name: Francisco Marcelino

texts.es: El señor Francisco es soltero no tiene hijos, de dedica a manejar un taxi el cual es alquilado eligió este tipo de trabajo por que le generaba un buen ingreso viene realizando esta labor desde el 2008, los desafíos que enfrenta el señor francisco es la competencia que hay en la zona, pero el los enfrenta saliendo a trabajar mas temprano para así ganar un poco mas de dinero, el dinero que esta solicitado el señor francisco es para comprar unas herramientas de mecánica,como llaves, juego dados, gata alicate, desarmadores entre otros, ademas de hacer algunos arreglos a su casa, francisco tiene muchos sueños uno de ellos es tener su propio vehículo, para que le genere mayores ingresosy asi tener una mejor calidad de vida, francisco esta muy agradecido con el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Francisco is single and doesn't have any children.  He drives a rented taxi.  He chose this type of work because it made him a good income.  He has been in this line of work since 2008.  The challenge that Francisco faces is the competition that exists in his area.  However, he meets this challenge by going out to work earlier each day so that he can make a little more money.

Francisco is requesting this loan to buy some tools for his car such as wrenches, a socket set, a jack, pliers, screwdrivers, etc.  He would also like to make some repairs to his home.  Francisco has many dreams.  One of them is to own his own vehicle so that he can make more income and thereby enjoy a better quality of life.  He is very grateful for the support he has received.

loans.use: to buy tools for his car such as wrenches, a socket set, pliers, a jack, etc.

loans.name: Juana Mirtala

texts.es: La señora Juana de 56 años de edad, es viudas, tiene un hijo, vive en la ciudad de León . De oficio comerciante ella se dedica a la venta de ropa , tiene una tienda en el mercado central de león en donde vende desde hace mas de 18 años, antes se dedicaba a vender ropa ambulante en los barrios de la ciudad de león pero con la ayuda de su fallecido esposo y prestamos que hizo logro poner su tienda en el mercado , además viajo a honduras para poder comprar ropa y vender en Nicaragua , con el paso del tiempo su negocio fue prosperando y puso una pequeña pulpería y ha venido componiendo su casa . Con el firme propósito de seguir prosperando solicito el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería tales como ropa para niños, ropa interior para mujer, varón, camisetas. Al comprar la mercadería por cantidad mayor le sale mas barato y puede sacar mejor ganancia. Sus próximas metas son la graduación de su hijo que esta en la universidad., hacer crecer su pequeña pulpería y acondicionar mejor su local y vivienda.
texts.en:
Juana is 56 years old.  She is a widow, has one son, and lives in the city of León.  She is a saleswoman who sells clothes.  She has a store in León central market where she has been selling her products for more than 18 years.  She used to sell clothes as an itinerant vendor in the neighborhoods of the city of León.  However, with the help of her deceased husband and loans that she took out, she managed to set up her store in the market.  She also traveled to Honduras so that she could buy clothes to sell in Nicaragua.

Over time, Juana's business prospered.  She set up a small grocery store and has been making repairs to her home.  With the firm goal of continuing to prosper, she requested a loan to invest in buying merchandise such as children's clothes, women's and men's underwear, and t-shirts.  Buying her merchandise in bulk works out cheaper for her and she is able to make better profits that way.  Her future goals are to see her son, who is at university, graduate; to grow her small grocery store business; and to make improvements to her business premises and her home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as children's clothes, women's and men's underwear, and t-shirts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Lea Mercedes

texts.es: Lea, de 41 años de edad, es originaria de la comunidad el Jicarito localizada en león, esta casada, ella es agricultura se dedica a la siembra de maíz y también a la crianza de ganado. Desde pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la agricultura, su primer negocio fue a los 22 años  de edad , sembró su primeros cultivos con la ayuda de su esposo y hermano de esta actividad ha venido sobreviviendo,despues se dedico a criar ganado para vender  . Solicito el préstamo para comprar de terneros. Pues la venta y compra de ganado tiene mucha demanda y genera buenos ingresos que le permitirá comprar más tierra para cultivar y tener una buena crianza de ganado de raza. En sus planes esta dedicarse a la compra y venta de ganado en desarrollo.
texts.en: Lea is 41 years old and from the community of Jicarito in León.  She is married and works in agriculture farming corn and raising cattle.  Since she was young, her parents taught her to work in agriculture and she had her first business when she was 22 years old.  She planted her first crops with the help of her husband and brother and has been living by these means ever since.  Later on she decided to raise cattle to sell.  She is asking for a loan to buy calves as there is a lot of demand in this business and it generates good money that will allow her to buy more land to farm and help with raising the cattle.  She plans to continue buying, raising, and reselling cattle.

loans.use: buy calves

loans.name: Felix Benancio

texts.es: El señor Felix es soltero no tiene hijos, felix es maestro constructor viene realizando esta labor hace mas de 10 años, eligió este tipo de trabajo por que le genera buenos ingresos los desafíos que enfrenta durante su trabajo son la competencia que hay en dicha actividad, pero felix los enfrenta brindando un servicio de mejor calidad para sus clientes, el crédito que esta solicitando es para comprar algunas herramientas para su trabajo, tales como maderas, puntales martillos entre otros, felix tiene muchos sueños uno de ellos es tener su propia ferretería , para con ello generar otros ingresos y mejorar así su calidad de vida, feliz esta muy contento con la confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Felix is single and doesn't have any children.  He is a master builder and has been in this line of work for more than 10 years.  He chose this type of work because it makes him good income.  The challenge that he faces is the competition that exists in his line of work.  However, Felix faces this challenge by providing a better-quality service to his customers.

Felix is requesting this loan to buy some work tools such as wood, supports, hammers, etc.  Felix has many dreams.  One of them is to own his own hardware store.  This would make him more income and enable him to improve his quality of life.  He is very happy with the trust that has been placed in him.

loans.use: to buy work tools such as wood, supports, etc.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor Jose luis tiene 28 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos uno de ellos esta en edad escolar, jose luis  trabaja en su propio vehículo de transporte desde hace mas de 3 años, cubriendo la ruta Ica- Santiago, el vive en casa propia,el crédito que esta solicitando es para darle mantenimiento a su unidad de transporte tales como cambio de llantas y algunas reparaciones al motor, el sueño que tiene jose luis es con el tiempo adquirir otra unidad de transporta para darlo en alquiler y así generar mas ingresos para su familia, jose luis esta muy agradecido con el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
José Luis is 28 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is of school age.

José Luis has been working with his own vehicle for more than three years.  He works the Icá - Santiago route.

José Luis lives in his own home and is requesting this loan to have maintenance work carried out on his vehicle.  He will have his tires changed and have some repairs made to his engine.  José Luis' dream is to acquire another vehicle so that he can rent it out and thereby make more income for his family.  He is grateful for the support he has received.

loans.use: to have his maintenance work carried out on his vehicle, to buy tires and to have his vehicle's engine repaired

loans.name: Febbie Ann

texts.en:
Febbie Ann is 38 years old and married with six children. With five children in school, Febbie Ann works very hard to provide for them. 

Febbie Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000-Philippine-peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell to customers. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as rice, curls, and other groceries. 

In the future, Febbie Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie works hard to support her family. Julie is married and sells agricultural and veterinary products in the Philippines. Julie explains that she has been in this business for 2 years now.

Julie is requesting a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stocks of agricultural and veterinary products for her business. In the future, Julie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional agricultural and veterinary products

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Janice works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from fishing.

Janice is seeking to borrow 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business. Janice explains that she has been sustaining her business activities through 4 prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts so that she can repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a 46-year-old, married woman with 5 children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Milagros has a fishing/fish-vending business in the Philippines. Milagros has been in this business for 30 years. Milagros is requesting a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing materials. In the future, Milagros would like to save money to expand her business and to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 32 years old and lives in Plaridel. She is married and has no children.

Cheryl has a store where she sells dried fish. She has been operating this business for 2 years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to purchase more dried fish to sell. Cheryl became a member of PMPC this year.

loans.use: To purchase additional dried fish for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a 70-year-old, married woman with 6 children. Nenita works very hard to provide for her family.

Nenita runs a variety store in the Philippines. Nenita has been in this business for 15 years, and she explains that she sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, bread, and other groceries. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell. In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nillian

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Nillian works hard to support her family.

She has a ready-to-wear clothing and personal products business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income raising pigs. Nillian is seeking to borrow 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more clothing and products to sell for her ready-to-wear clothing and personal products business.

Nillian has been sustaining her business activities through 4 prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing and products to sell

loans.name: Sokheang

texts.en:
Sokheang is a 42-year-old kindergarten teacher. Her husband is a chief of construction workers. Their income is approximately $5.50 per day. They have 5 children, 3 of whom are studying, while the other two work as construction workers. Every month, she spends roughly $100 on food, $30 on school fees, and $22 on other expenses.

She would like to request a loan in the amount of $800 to repair her kitchen and build a toilet so that their family can live more comfortably. She explains that she has worked as a kindergarten teacher for about 10 years and that she never wants to change jobs or start a new career; besides, she hopes to earn more money just by working hard so that she can support the rest of her children with their studies until they secure good jobs in the future.

loans.use: To repair their kitchen and to build a toilet

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 35-year-old, married woman with 3 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Grace has been raising pigs for 4 years, and she also earns additional income from a motorcycle transport business. Grace is seeking to borrow 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She explains that she is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Sreypov is a 31-year-old house wife. Her husband is a carpenter, and his income is approximately $18 per day. They have 2 children, both of whom stay at home because they are still too young to attend school. Every month, she spends roughly $50 on food and $30 on electricity.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy wood and equipment for her husband's career so that her husband can have enough equipment to make and sell his products faster. She would like to go to work in a factory when her children are old enough to go to school because she wants to help her husband earn income to support their children's educational needs.

loans.use: To purchase wood and equipment for her husband's carpentry business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 56 years old and lives in Plaridel. She is married with no children.

Rose has a shop where she sells ready-to-wear clothing. She has had this business for 3 years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 6,000 PHP to purchase more inventory for her ready-to-wear clothing business.

Rose explains that she has been a member of PMPC for 9 years. In the future, Rose hopes to better meet her family's daily living expenses.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her ready-to-wear clothing business

loans.name: Sarouen

texts.en:
Fifty-year-old Sarouen and her husband fish for a living, earning a combined income of $4.6 per day. They have three children, one a factory worker earning $3 per day and the other two students. Every month, Sarouen has to spend $80 on food, $15 on electricity, and $10 on school fees. If she can save more money, she expects to buy a new boat to replace their old one.

Sarouen is now requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for her daughter's commute to work and for other family use as well. She has a strong commitment to send her other two children to university to study.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her daughter's commute to work.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 32 years old and married. She has one child.

Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines. She has been running the variety store for two years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of items like soft-drinks, biscuits and candies to sell in her variety store. Arlene has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Arlene aspires to save enough money so she can send her child to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of items like soft-drinks, biscuits, and candies to sell in her variety store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yean

texts.en:
Yean, 57 years old, is farmer who also raises animals. Her husband is a rice seller and a fisherman. Their income is $9 per day. They have four children. Two are working in the factory and can make $8 per day for their income. 

Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, and $15 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a stock of rice for her husband to sell. Her husband has two careers, some time he go fishing but he sell rice is more often. His business is very successful as he is a good and honest man, so he can get a lot of costumers to buy his rice. Her husband has not yet made a plan to extend the business because he needs to survey the economic situation in his village and others. 

She plans to repair her house when she can make more profit.

loans.use: To buy a stock rice for her husband to sell.

loans.name: Andrena

texts.en:
Andrena is 29 years old and lives in Lopez Jaena. She is married and has four children. 

To earn a living, Andrena has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Andrena has requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Andrena has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years, and she earns additional income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fruit to sell in her fruit vending business.

Sally has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional fruit to sell in her fruit stall.

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem, 42 years old, is a motor taxi driver. His wife is working in the garment factory. Their income is $4 per day. They have six children. Five are studying and one is working in the factory with $3 per day for her income. 

Every month, he has to spend $50 on food, $10 on school fees and $10 on electricity. 

He would like to request a loan of $1,000 to help his daughter to open a small grocery shop. For the rest of the children who are studying right now, he will try to support them in school at least through high school. 

He hopes that all of his children will get their own careers in the future.

loans.use: To help his daughter to open a small grocery shop.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 58 years old and a widow with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cecilia has a home products sales business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Cecilia requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of plastic wares to sell.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of plastic wares to sell.

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Vy, 52 years old, is a housewife. She is a single mother with four children. One is working in the factory, and her son is a motor taxi driver. They can make $11 per day for their income. 

Every month, she has to spend $100 on food, $20 on transportation, $15 on electricity and $20 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for another son who is also a motor taxi driver. 

In the future she would like to have a tailoring shop at her house if her children can help with the expense, because every expense in the family is dependent on three of her children.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son.

loans.name: Daylin

texts.en:
Daylin is 41 years old and lives in Plaridel. She is married and has two children.

To earn a living, Daylin has a business catching and selling fish. She earns about PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Daylin has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to purchase materials for their fish cage.

Daylin has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase materials for their fish cage.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Myra has been in this business for 10 years now, and she also earns additional income from food vending.

Myra requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

In the future, Myra would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment.She

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is 36 years old, married and has one child.

Rona works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines. She has been running the store for nine years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. 

She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her variety store. Rona has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Rona aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Bebina

texts.en: Bebina is 47 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries  to sell in her store. Bebina has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 25 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Bebina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sri store

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Vana, 36 years old, is a garment-factory worker. Her husband is a basket seller and their income is $10 per day. They have three children, two studying and one working at Malaysia. Every day, she has to spend $50 on food, $6 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy more kinds of baskets to sell and buy a cow to breed. If her husband can make a good profit then she would like to extend her husband's business to get more income for her children studying in the university.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of baskets to sell and buy a cow to feed

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen is a married parent of six children who works hard to support her family. She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store. Carmen is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell. She has sustained her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Thol

texts.en: Carmen, 46 years old, is a cake seller. She is a single mother with two children, both of them married. Her income is $8 per day, and her children can make $10 per day. There are 9 people in her family including her four grandchildren. Every month, she has to spend $65 on food, and $15 on transportation. Carmen would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy farmland to farm. She also wants to make more cakes to sell wholesale as well as retail.

loans.use: To buy farmland for farming

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita, a 54-year-old married mother of three children, resides in Lopez Jaena where she has a shop that sells a variety of products such as shampoo, toothpaste and soap. In this business for four years and a member of PMPC for eight years, Anita is requesting a loan of 10,000 to purchase more stocks of products for her general store.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of products for her general store.

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.en:
Cayetana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy things like a cooler and fishing net for her fishing business. 

Cayetana has been in this business for four years. Cayetana earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Cayetana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy material for fishing like a cooler, fishing net, etc.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny, 60, is a farmer. She is a single mother with six children; two are studying, three are working, and the last is a hairdresser; she has her own shop. This family can make $15 for their income per day. 

Every month, she has to spend $99 on food, $10 on electricity, $30 on school fee, and $20 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $1000 for supporting her daughter who has a hairdressing shop to buy some stuffs and equipments for using in her shop because only this career can make good benefit to support the family. In the future, she would like to extend her daughter's shop more bigger so that she can make more benefit.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing equipment for her daughter's shop

loans.name: Rotha

texts.en:
Rotha, 30, is a housewife. Her husband is a cattle seller; his income is $15 per day. They have two children who are seven and three years old. 

Every month, she has to spend $24 on food, $6 on school fees, and $14 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $950 to buy some farmland. When she is able to buy this land she will plant vegetables and more to get crops to sell. 

In the future, she hopes to have some money to buy groceries to sell at her house, and to be able to save enough money to repair her house. For her children, she plans to send them to school until they finish university.

loans.use: To buy farmland for growing crops

loans.name: Bukhchuluun

texts.en:
Mr. Bukhchuluun, 34, is a welder and lives with his wife, also 34, and daughter, 12, in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been working as a welder in a metallurgical factory for the last seven years. His wife is a construction engineer, but is currently unemployed. His daughter goes to a secondary school in Darkhan city. 

This family likes the location of their house, near the highway, and are running a food kiosk there. Bukhchuluun is planning to expand their business by building a grocery store instead of their kiosk beside the home. He and his wife both expect that it is a good way to increase their family's income. 

The loan Bukhchuluun is taking will be used to build a grocery store. He expresses his great appreciation to all Kiva team members and lenders.

loans.use: To build a grocery store to increase his family's income.

loans.name: Yean

texts.en:
Yean, 47, is a tailor, and can make $2 per day. Her husband stays at home. They have three children, one is studying and two are working in the garment factory. 

Every month, Yean has to spend $20 on food, $10 on school fees, and $14 on other expenses. She would like a loan of $1200 to buy land for her husband to farm. She will keep going on her career and extend it more if it does well.

She plans to send her children to study at least through high school.

loans.use: To buy farmland for her husband to work

loans.name: Soklis

texts.en:
Soklis, 31 years old, is a grocery seller. Her husband is a worker making hand grinding products. Their income is $9 per day. They have 4 children, 2 are studying and the other two are staying with their aunt in Phnom Penh. 

Each month, Soklis spends $40 on food, $10 on school fees and $8 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy grocery items and pigs to feed. Her family is depending on her income the most. She needs to make more income to support the children, who are studying.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and pigs to feed.

loans.name: Savat

texts.en:
Savat, 64 years old, is a farmer with her husband. Their income is $2 per day. They have 4 children who are all working and have their own careers. They each make around $5 per day for their income. 

Every month, Savat spends $60 food and $10 on other expenses in the family. She would like to request a loan of $600 to help her son’s career. She will buy items as he needs. For her career as a farmer, she never wants to change because now she and her husband getting older. So, she and her husband will just keep doing farming when they have energy. Her children are responsible for all of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to help her son's career.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Chin, 64 years old, is a farmer and sells hand grinding product. Her husband is a blacksmith. Their income is $15 per day. Every month, she spends $40 on food, $10 on transportation and $5 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy hand grinding product to sell. She does not want to have another career beside what she has now. This couple is getting older now, so they do not care to extend their business or repair the house anymore. They just want to have enough income to support their family's costs of living.

loans.use: to buy hand grinding product to sell.

loans.name: Champa

texts.en:
Champa, 43 years old, is a house wife. She is a single mother with 3 children: 26, 21 and 19 years old. Two of her children are working in a restaurant in Phnom Penh. This family can make $6.5 per day for their income. Every month, she spends $60 on food and $6 on electricity. 

Champa would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike for her son to operate a motor taxi. With this loan, her family will be able to live in better conditions because they can earn more income. Champa wants to repair her house if she can save some money.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son's motor taxi business.

loans.name: Vannakk

texts.en:
Vannakk (in the photo) is a weaver, while her husband sells kitchenware and electrical goods. He hopes to expand his business by buying additional kitchenware and electrical goods to sell. Hence, Vannak is asking for a loan of $1,000 to help increase her husband’s business capital. 

This couple has been married since 2008 and have two young children: one son and one daughter. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to help increase business capital for her husband to purchase additional kitchenware and electrical goods to sell.

loans.name: Naim

texts.en:
Naim, 59 years old, is a farmer. She is a single mother with 3 children and she makes about $10 per day for her income. One of her children is studying, the other one is a hairdresser. Another of her children is working in Korea. 

Naim spends $38 on food, $13 on school fees, $7 on transportation and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy corn seed and to hire workers to clear the grass on her plantation. Her career can make a good income that’s why she has never wanted to change it at all. For her future, she plans to grow cashew nuts instead of corn because it is easy for her when she gets older.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds for her plantation.

loans.name: Polo

texts.en:
Polo and his wife, Srong, live along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1992 and have three sons and one daughter. 

Polo and his wife are vegetable farmers. He is asking for his second loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

Photo: Polo and his wife.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Nang

texts.en:
Nang, 42 years old, is a cake seller. Her husband is doing plantation. Their income is $10 per day. They have 4 children, one is studying and 2 are working in the factory. Their daughter has her own hairdresser shop. 

Every month, Nang spends $40 on food, $10 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy equipment for her daughter's shop. She plan to help her daughter to run her shop well, and will extend the shop when it develops. For her child who is studying, she will always support him if he wants to continue university.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her daughter's hairdressing shop.

loans.name: Sam At

texts.en:
Sam At (shown in the photo) is 39 years old and her husband, Sopheap, is 42 years old. They live in a village along National Road number five, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1989 and have four sons. Two are garment workers and the other two are in school.  

Sam At is a garment worker, while her husband is a school principal. She is in the process of building new house, but she lacks some money to pay for building fees. That’s why she has decided to ask for a loan.

loans.use: to pay for her house building fees.

loans.name: Vutha

texts.en:
Vutha (pictured above) is 29 years old and her husband, Chanroeun, is 27 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about twenty kilometers away. They have been married since 2006 and have two young sons. 

Vutha is a garment factory worker, while her husband is a motorcycle repairman. He hopes to buy additional motorbike spare parts to better respond to his customer’s needs. So, Vutha is asking for her first loan in the amount of $600 to assist her husband with the purchases.

loans.use: to purchase motorbike spare parts for her husband’s motorcycle repairing business.

loans.name: Han

texts.en: Han is a driver. When he is free, he also assists his wife in her farming business. They have been married since 1990, and they have five daughters. They live along National Road Number One, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Han is asking for his second loan of $1,000 to dig a well and build a restroom for family use.

loans.use: To dig a well and build a restroom for family use.

loans.name: Shon

texts.en:
Shon is 58 years old, and his wife, Sheam is 53.  They live along National Road Number Six, outside Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1980 and they have three sons and three daughters. 

Shon drives a Tuk Tuk taxi, and his wife is a lemon grass farmer. Shon is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to buy a new motorbike. His current motorbike is old and breaks often, which costs him a lot of money in repairs.

loans.use: To buy new motorbike.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina sells coffee and tea. He buys the coffee and tea from Vietnam and sells it in other provinces. His wife Net sells food at home. They have been married for over twelve years, and they live in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

This is Lina's second Kiva loan. This loan request is for $1,000 to put an addition on his house.

loans.use: To put an addition on his house.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom (in the photo) is 33 years old. She runs a grocery store at home. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. They live in a village along national road number one, about seventeen kilometers from the city. They have two children: one son and one daughter. One is in school and the other one is still young.  

Sokhom is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase more grocery items for her inventory.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for her inventory.

loans.name: Sam Oeurn

texts.en:
Sam Oeurn (pictured with her loom) has been a weaver for more than twelve years. Her husband is a barber. He assists his wife to weave when he is free because he also knows how to weave. Sam Oeurn hopes to continue her weaving business because it is a traditional profession business. So, she is asking for another loan of $500 USD to purchase weaving materials.
 
The couple has been married since 2004 and has one son and one daughter. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea (in the photo) has been a weaver for more than twenty-eight years. She also buys finished fabrics from other weavers in her village and sells them in other provinces, away from her house. She is applying for another loan of $100 to continue her weaving business by purchasing weaving materials.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im, 63 years old, is staying home. She is a single mother with 3 children. They are 25, 23, and 19 years old. No one is in school now, all of them are working in the factory as garment workers. Their income is $4 per day, for each of them. 

Every month, she spends about $33 on expenses for the family and would like to request a loan $1000 to buy a motorbike for her children traveling to work. Her children are responsible in paying back this loan. She plans to buy a stock of rice to keep and sell at a good price.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children traveling to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for his career.

loans.name: Brayan

texts.en:
Brayan is 25 years old and lives in Plaridel. He is married and has 2 children. 

Brayan works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. He has been doing this for 20 years. He has requested a loan for 10,000. Brayan has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 43 years old and lives in Lopez Jaena. She is married and has 5 children. 

Evangeline works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan for 5000 to purchase more fish to sell. Evangeline has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 35 years old, married and has five children.  To earn a living, Peter sells kerosene and he has employed one person.  He works hard in his business to provide education for his children. Through Faulu Kenya, he has expanded his business.  Peter is determined to succeed in his business.  He dreams of opening several outlets of his business in five years.

Peter has requested for 70, 000 Kenyan shillings to buy kerosene.

loans.use: to buy kerosene.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is 48 years old and lives in Lopez Jaena. She is married and has 3 children. 

Caridad works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 25 years. She has requested a loan for PHP15,000 to purchase more fish to sell. 

Caridad has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Kelly

texts.en:
Kelly is a 26-year-old, married woman with a three-year-old child. She operates a food stall to earn a living. She has been operating the business for only one year. She previously sold clothes. Kelly also depends on her husband, who is employed, for financial support.  

She hopes to grow her business in the future. She has requested for 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy potatoes and cooking fat for preparing chips.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat and potatoes for preparing chips.

loans.name: Jackline Amanclu

texts.en:
She Want more income for her business expansion,and paying children to school.
she have 6 children 4 are schooling she is a widow

loans.use: Fish purshes & Sale.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is 26 years old, married and has two school-going children. He runs a retail shop so as to earn a living. He has been in the business for 3 years. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Benson has learned how to manage his business and save his money. In five years, he hopes to expand his business into wholesale. He has requested 20,000 KES to buy maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is married with 7 children. She is 66 years old and lives in Plaridel.

To earn a living, Rosita sells a variety of products from her general store. She has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. Rosita has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 39 years old, is married to Mary, who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children, ages 13 and 10 years.  Joel has been a shoe maker for the past 20 years, with the monthly income of KES 11,000 which he uses to support his family members. 

He was introduced to KADET by an existing KADET customer and as applied for his 1st loan.   Joel will use the loan to add stock of shoe making materials to his business.  With the anticipated profit from the business, he will open a retail shop. 

He hopes to open a wholesale shoe shop in future, which will help educate his children and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To add stock of shoe making materials

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is 40 years old and lives in Lopez Jaena. She is married with 5 children.  To earn a living, Paulina has a fish selling business. She earns about PHP 4000 each month doing this type of work. Paulina has a requested a loan for 20,000 to purchase housing materials.  Paulina has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josephine is 25 years old, single, with no children. She has been running a salon for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 8000.


She is applying for her first loan with KADET, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. She will use the loan to expand her business and add a stock of wigs, gel and braids. With the anticipated profit from the business she will pay for her education and study further.  Her hope is to expand her business, which will support her education fees.

loans.use: To buy wigs, gel, and  braids for her salon

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
This is Anita, 51, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Fernando, a vendor. They don’t have any children, but they support a nephew. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Anita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages catering to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Anita earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling retail. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of Php 49,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Anita hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: pay for grocery and other inventory for sale in her variety store.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
This is Ma. Ligaya, 41, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rosendo, a contractor, and is the mother of four children.
