This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to pay for his education.

loans.name: Ayesh

texts.en:
Ayesh is a 22-year-old man from the Jabalia refugee camp in the Gaza Strip. He lives with his parents. Ayesh wants a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase his own bedroom furniture. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee in the Jabalia Refugee camp; while his salary isn't enough to buy the furniture outright, paying back FATEN on a monthly basis will be doable.

Ayesh is pictured in FATEN's office in the Jabalia Refugee camp.

loans.use: to purchase a new bedroom furniture.

loans.name: Gulzat's Group

texts.en:
Gulzat, 22, is the treasurer of this group. She resides in the town of Isfana, which is on the border between Kyrgyzstan and Uzbekystan. She is single and doesn’t have any financial dependents. Last year Gulzat started up a barber shop of her own. This decision came during her trip to Russia, where a good friend of hers shared tips on operating a beauty salon which offers various types of services.  After coming back home, she found a perfect place to rent and soon the barber shop was open. Nowadays, Gulzat has customers on a regular basis. “I’m especially good at wedding hairdos”, she says.  Most of the initial capital was spent on beauty tools, kits and electronic appliances. Her monthly income is 2,500 soms. 

The purpose of the loan is to purchase additional appliances for the salon.  “I need to be stocked well at the start of the busy time, “ says Gulzat.  “I expect the wedding season and the feast of Ramadan to be very busy.”

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
	
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase additional appliances for the salon

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is 31 years old and lives in West Point.  He is married and attends college. His wife is a business woman and they have one child, six years old. For the past six years, Jean has been operating a small shop where he sells sneakers, shoes, and also charged mobile phones. What he likes most is that most of the time he doesn’t run out of money, and the profit he earns is used for upkeep of his home.  He is requesting a loan to purchase more shoes and sneakers. He hopes to have an international business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes and sneakers

loans.name: Marie Agnes

texts.en:
Marie Agnes is 32 years old and is married, with 2 children between 4 and 7 years old. She sells avocados, bananas, vegetables, etc., in her boutique. Her business is well-organized.  Marie Agnes has two years experience in her business and she works from 8.30am until 9pm every day. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase more bananas, avocados, vegetables, etc., for sale.  With any profits, she will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits, such as bananas, avocados, etc., for sale.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha is 30 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and has three children between the ages of 2 and 11.  All of her children attend school. For the past three years, she has been involved in the fixing of hair and the sales of artificial hair, as well.  She learned this business by practicing on a friend's hair.  Her main challenge is price control.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more artificial hair for her business. She hopes to be a big business woman in the near future and send her children to quality schools.

loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair for her business

loans.name: Sedjro 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEDJRO 3 est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui habitent toutes ensemble dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Blandine, est celle qui se trouve au milieu de la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Blandine est âgée de 24 ans et est mariée à un certain Hubert. Le couple n'a pas encore d'enfant. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Blandine prépare de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs accompagné de diverses sauces) qu'elle vend à son domicile. Blandine achète ses produits dans les marchés du Bénin. Blandine exerce cette activité depuis trois ans. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Blandine désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Blandine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SEDJRO 3, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The group SEDJRO 3 is comprised of three persons who are friends all living together in the same area. The official of this group is named Blandine. She is the one in the middle of the photo. This is the third time that this group has requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of boosting their business. 

Blandine is 24 years old and married to a man named Hubert. They have no children yet. To support herself, she makes food (rice or corn mash served with various sauces) that she sells out of her house. Blandine purchases her goods from the markets of Benin. She has been in this business for three years. 

Concerned about responding better to the requirements of her customers, she would like to increase her stock of goods. To do so, Blandine, along with the other members of the group SEDJRO 3, is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and corn and some sauce condiments and vegetable oil

loans.name: Fasokounawolo I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Fasokounawolo I sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans les familles polygames à Koba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le petit mil, le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SATA, qui est présidente du groupe et la première debout à droite, compte acheter les intrants et payer les frais de labour, de sarclage, pour entretenir environs 0,7 hectare petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. SATA compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 70.000FCFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group Fasokounawolo I are married women who average 45 years of age and 2 children. They all live in polygamous families in Koba, a village in the Commune of Massigui, Prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of organizing their work better at the start of the off-season. The crops grown are pearl millet, rice, and peanuts. The group members are on their fifth collaboration with the institution. 

With this new loan, SATA, who is the group's president and the first one standing at the right (in the photo), intends to buy farm inputs and to pay for plowing and weeding in order to maintain about 0.7 hectare of pearl millet and peanuts.

After the harvests, the produce is sold in the city of Massigui to a customer base composed of women and men. SATA plans on making an average profit of about 70,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, manure, herbicide, and weeding

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years old and lives in West Point. She had an education to sixth grade and has three children between the ages of 9 and 15.  All of them attend school. 

Grace has been operating an entertainment center, where she sells drinks (soda, beer and energy drinks) and other provisions. One of her main challenges is keeping up with the demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more drinks (soda, beer and energy drinks) and other provisions for her business.  In the future, she hopes to sell her drinks at wholesale and to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks (soda, beer and energy drinks) and other provisions for her business

loans.name: Fasokounawolo Ii Group

texts.fr:
Fasokounawolo II est constitué de  10 femmes toutes mariées ayant en moyenne 35 ans, en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Koba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le petit mil, le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, KOURANI, qui est la première debout à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,7 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40.000FCFA environs en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
Fasokounawolo II is made up of 10 women, all of whom are married, are on average 35 years old, have on average two children, and live mostly in polygamous families in Koba, one of the villages in the Massigui commune, in the prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region, the second administrative region of Mali.

They are collaborating with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal to better organize their businesses for the start of winter. They grow, among other things, millet, rice, and peanuts. They are on their fifth loan with the institution.

With this new loan, Kourani, who is the first one standing on the right, plans to buy the ingredients and small tools and pay for labor to maintain .7 hectares of millet and peanuts. The crops are sold in the city of Massigui after harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. She foresees making a profit of about 40,000 FCFA at the end of the year.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seed, fertilizer, herbicide, and small tools

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 29 years old. She is married and has one child. For more income, she wants to expand her business .

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Fasokounawolo Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Fasokounawolo III sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Koba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont, le petit mil, le niébé, le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt,  MAMINE, la deuxième debout à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour (sarclage) pour entretenir environs 0,8 hectare  de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 70.000FCFA environs en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Fasokounawolo III group are all married women with an average age of 31 and an average of 2 children each. Most of them live in polygamous families in Koba, a village in the commune of Massigui, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, 2nd administrative region of Mali. They are working with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activity at the beginning of the rainy season. They grow pearl millet, black-eyed peas, rice and groundnuts. The women are on their 5th loan with Soro Yiriwaso. 

With this new loan, Mamine, standing, 2nd from right, plans to buy farm inputs, small equipment and to pay for plowing (hoeing) costs on around 0.8 hectares of pearl millet and groundnuts. Crops are sold in Massigui after the harvest to customers who are both men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 70,000 CFA francs at the end of the season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, weedkiller, hoeing and small equipment.

loans.name: Fasokounawolo Iv Group

texts.fr:
Fasokounawolo IV est constitué de six femmes toutes mariées. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivent  dans des familles polygames à Koba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres, le mil, le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MAMOU, qui est debout à droite, compte acheter les intrants et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,8 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75.000FCFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
Fasokounawolo IV is composed of six married women. They average 30 years of age and three children each, and they live in polygamous families in Koba, a village located in the commune of Massigui, in the Dioïla Prefecture, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali).

They have partnered with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in an attempt to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. They grow millet, rice and groundnuts. This is their fifth loan cycle with the MFI. 

Mamou, seen standing at the right in the photo, will use her loan to purchase inputs and pay for the plowing and weeding of about 0.8 hectares of millet and groundnuts.

After the harvest, the crops are sold in the city of Massigui to a clientele composed of both men and women. Mamou expects to earn an average profit of approximately 75,000 FCFA by end of season.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides, and to pay for plowing and weeding

loans.name: Fasokounawolo V Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Fasokounawolo V sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles polygames à Koba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le petit mil, le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, AWA, assise tout de bleu vêtue, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40.000FCFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Fasokounawolo group are married women who average 39 years of age and three children each. They all live in polygamous families in Koba, a village located in the commune of Massigui in the prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali).

They have partnered with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in an attempt to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. They grow millet, rice and groundnuts, and this is their fifth loan cycle with the MFI. 

Awa, sitting and dressed in blue in the photo, will use her loan to purchase inputs and small farming equipment, and to pay for the plowing of about 0.5 hectares of millet and groundnuts.

After the harvest, the crops are sold in the city of Massigui to a clientele composed of both men and women. Awa expects to earn an average profit of approximately 40,000 FCFA by end of season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and small farming equipment

loans.name: Anjilino

texts.en: Anjilino is 37 years old. She is a widow. She has 5 children, 3 of them are in school. To expand her business, she needs money.

loans.use: with her small business

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.en:
Mamadou is 50 years old and lives in Logan Town.  He is married and has an education to fourth grade. He has three children between the ages of 10 and 24.   Two of them attend school.  For the past thirty-two years, he has been operating a general store where he sells toothpaste, tissues, batteries, bath soap, etc.  One of the main challenges he faces is his limited capital.

He is requesting a loan to purchase more provisions (toothpaste, tissues, and batteries, bath soap) to expand his business.  He plans to build a house and send his children to good schools in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions (toothpaste, tissues, and batteries, bath soap)

loans.name: Mackellas

texts.en:
Mackellas is 39 years old. He is a hardworking and diligent businessman. He is married and blessed with three children, ages 6, 3 and 10 months.  He has been selling sugarcane for the last 11 years.  Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to learn how to save and expand his business.  He supplements this income by cultivating traditional vegetables and selling them. Previously, he worked as a casual laborer. 

He hopes to have a well-established business selling clothes in the future. He has requested  20,000 Kenyan shillings to start a business selling clothes.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothes

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 35 years old. She is married and has 6 children. She produces and sells food. For more income and for her children educational costs, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Klubo

texts.en:
Klubo is 34 and lives in Paynesville. She's married and her husband is a builder; they have four children between the ages of 12-20, all of whom live at home and attend school. 

Klubo sells a wide range of dried goods from her home including rice, red oil, salt, fish, meat, spices, and charcoal amongst others. She enjoys selling to customers as it enables her to help her children. Her main challenge is running the business whilst looking after the children. 

She's requesting a loan to purchase more foodstuffs and dried goods. She would like to own her own shop one day.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs and dried goods

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: She is 42 Years old.A widow She has 7 children. 4 is in school. For more income ,she want the loan for business expansion, and paying school fees.

loans.use: Expand Same Business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs and dried goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: She is 25 Years Old. A Married woman, She will use the loan for Expanding her business and earning  more income for paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: to expand the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and sell more goods.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more drugs to resell.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 40 years old and is married. She has five children. She sells goods such as water, biscuits and toilet paper in her small boutique. She has three years of experience and she employs one person to help her. She works from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day except on the weekend. 

Seraphine has requested her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more goods such as water, biscuits and toilet paper for resale. With any profits, Seraphine will reinvest in her business and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more goods such as water, biscuits and toilet paper for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes, sugar, maize flour, salt, cooking fat and sweets.

loans.name: Katrina

texts.en: This borrower is 40 years old, married, and has four children. Three of the children are going to school. Her husband is a businessman. She needs more money for school fees. She wants to start a small business for more income.

loans.use: with a small seals business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: This borrower is 35 years old, married and has eight children. She has a bakery. For good profit, she want to purses machine. 6 children are schooling, and she will use this loan for paying fees,expanding the business.

loans.use: paste

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various products for a small general store.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: This borrower is 40 years old and married. Her husband is a businessman. She is now selling fruits and vegetables on the street. She wants to rent a shop and expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 30 years old and is married with two children aged between three and four years old. She takes care of two relatives aged between 12 and 14 years old. Her business is well organized and she sells items such as notebooks, pens, and paper. 

Jacqueline has four years of experience. She is working from 7:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. every day except Saturday and she currently employs one person to help her.

Jacqueline has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to increase her supplies of stationery goods (pencils, ink, grand computer screen filters, and so on). With any profits, Jacqueline will reinvest in her business and save for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To increase her business by buying grand computer screen filters, pencils, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel has been farming for five years in Eldoret, North Rift, Kenya. He is age 33 and married with three children, two of whom are already in school. His farm has been producing milk and maize which he sells at the local market. However, Joel is disappointed with low market prices for farm produce and common animal diseases.

Joel has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase poultry birds. He says the venture has high turnover and will provide his family with basic needs, especially education, and act as a supplement for their normal needs.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a resident and farmer in Eldoret, North Rift Kenya. He is 34 years old and married with four children between the ages of 3 and 10 years old. He has been in farming for over 14 years producing and selling maize, beans, wheat and milk.

Jacob has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Kiva's partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the additional dairy cow will improve his milk production and in turn improve his family's living standards. Jacob has pointed to poor market prices as the major challenge in the farming business, especially for dairy.

loans.use: To pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 49 years old and married with four children. She works in dairy farming to earn a living and she has been in this business for over three years.  Agnes has improved her business through Faulu Kenya. She hopes to continue growing her business and generating more income. She has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Marie Josee

texts.en:
Marie  is 48 years old and married with three children between 11 and 29 years old. She takes care of one child who is seven years old.  Her business is well organized. She sells cows and has seven years experience in this business. She currently employs three people to help her. Marie operates her business from 5 am to 6 pm every day.

Marie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company (S.a) to purchase more cows for resale. With the profits, she will reinvest in her business and hopes to renovate her own house.

loans.use: To buy more cows to sell

loans.name: Napisa

texts.en: Napisa is 17 years old. She is married and her husband is a business man. Napisa sells clothing to earn a living. She is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en: Zachary is 34 years old. He is a hard working and honest business man. For the last 8 years he has been selling and repairing cell phones. He supplements the income from this venture by running a beauty shop. Previously, he was in farming. Zachary is married and blessed with a two-year-old child. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to open up a business for photocopying.

loans.use: To open up a photocopying business

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline has been practicing mixed farming in her hometown of Eldoret, North Rift Kenya. She is married with 5 children between the ages of 5 and 16 years old, all of whom are in school. Her farm produces maize, beans, vegetables and milk with the help of one other farmer. Her farm's produce is all sold to the local market. She also does tailoring to supplement her farming income.

Pauline has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Kiva's partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the dairy business will help her pay for her children's education. She intends to expand her tailoring business and improve the quality of her dairy cows. 

Pauline concurs with other farmers that the drought is their biggest challenge.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer and to cover some personal expenses

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 50 years old and married with two children. To earn a living, she works in tailoring. She has been operating this business for over ten years. She has sustained her business because of the financial support from Kiva's partner, Faulu Kenya.  Besides this, she also does farming to earn extra income.  She was previously selling cereals. Lucy hopes to expand her business in five years and employ many people. She has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more fabric.

loans.use: To buy more fabric

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is currently in the business of selling clothing. She is requesting a loan to expand her business. Charity is 29 years old and married to a business man. She has 4 children who all go to school. With the extra profits from this loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is a resident of Eldoret, North Rift Kenya where he has been doing his farming with the help of one other farmer. He has been in farming for 3 years producing maize, beans and milk. He also gets additional income from his formal employment. 

Wilfred has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Kiva's partner, Juhudi KiL., to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the dairy business will generate more income to enable him to build a strong foundation for his family. He is focusing on buying better quality breeds and expanding his farm acreage. However he mentions poor market prices as the biggest challenge facing the farming business.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela, D. 60 años resiD. en la localidad D. Palcamayo. Se caracteriza por ser una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Fortunato D. 64 años y sus 3 queridos hijos a quienes quiere mucho. Ella se siente orgullosa y satisfecha, pues trabajando arduamente ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos. Todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus plantas D.  papa, espinaca y arvejas, los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad D. Tarma, ya que es ahí donD. obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Además D. criar animales como ovejas, vacas, cerdos y demás. Los cuales después D. cuidarlos y ensebarlos los comercializa a un mayor precio ganando un dinero neto D. S/. 80 soles por cada uno. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es que pueD. disfrutar D. la libertad D. laborar en sus campos. Lleva 37 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra. Con el tiempo, espera obtener más cabezas D. animales para poder dedicar la mayor parte D. su tiempo en la ganadería, ya que le genera mayores ingresos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen María” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donD. espera D. su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Marcela D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. varias cabezas D. reses para su negocio. Asimismo en el arreglo y colocación D. la puerta D. su casa.
texts.en:
Marcela is 60 years old and resides near Palcamayo.  She is a very loving  and hard-working mother, who lives in her own house with her husband Fortunato, who is 64 years old, and their 3 children who are very dear to them.

Marcela feels very proud and satisfied. Working arduously, she has been able to advance her crops.  She gets  up very early every morning to irrigate and care for each of her potato, spinach, and pea plants. She will sell the harvest in the city of Tarma, since there she receives the best prices for her produce.

Marcela also raises sheep, cows, pigs, and other livestock. After raising and fattening them, she sells them for the best price, earning a net of 80 new sols for each one.

What Marcela likes best about her work is that she can work in the fields. She has been doing this for 37 years. What she finds most difficult is to plow the land. In time, she hopes to obtain more animals, to be able to dedicate most of her time to livestock raising, since it generates more income.

Marcela belongs to  the “Virgen Maria” (Virgin Mary) Communal Bank and this is her 2nd loan through MFP. She hopes to continue her collaboration so she can pursue her objectives. She is committed once again to making her payments, as she has with previous loans.  Also, she enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible persons with much solidarity.

With her new loan, Marcela will buy various head of cattle for her business, plus she will relocate and repair the door to her house.

loans.use: to buy cattle to raise and sell, and a new door for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate his business' parking lot and add tables and chairs to his restaurant.

loans.name: Lilias

texts.en: Lilias is currently in the business of selling fruits such as tomato, mango and pineapple. She is requesting a loan to expand her business. Lilias is 32 years old and married to a business man. She has 3 children, 1 of whom goes to school. With the extra profits generated from this loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to expand her fruit business

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: La señora Pilar, de 61 años de edad, esta casada, es madre de 7 hijos, es originaria de la ciudad de León, de oficio comerciante, tiene una pulpería en su casa la cual atiende ella misma. A la edad de 14 años inicio en el mundo del comercio con su madre, ella vendía frutas y verduras en el mercado central y doña Pilar ayudaba a su madre vender con el paso del tiempo se independizo y puso su propio negocio de pulpería, el cual tiene 10 años de tener la venta y de esas manera fue que preparo a sus hijos y además sus otros hijos le mandan remesas que ella recibe e invierte en el negocio. Requiere el préstamo para compra de mercadería tales como arroz, azúcar, aceite, huevos frijoles, maíz, trigo y sodas. Su es objetivo es mantener su pulpería surtida para atraer mas clientes, aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos, pues uno de sus planes es ampliar su negocio y hacerles mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Mrs. Pilar is 61 years old, married, and the mother of seven children.  She is from the city of León and works as a saleswoman.  She has a grocery store in her home where she works.  At the age of 14 she began working in sales with her mother.  She sold fruits and vegetables in the central market and helped her mother sell.  As time went on, she became independent and started her own grocery store business.  This business has been around for 10 years.  It has helped support her children and her other children send her money that she invests in the business.  She needs the loan to buy merchandise like sugar, oil, eggs, beans, corn, wheat, and soft drinks.  Her goal is to have a well-stocked store to attract more customers, increase sales, and improve earnings in order to expand her business and make improvements to her home.

loans.use: buy merchandise like rice, sugar, oil, eggs, beans, corn, wheat, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando tiene 42 años, reside en la localidad de Palcamayo. Ahí vive en compañía de Norma, su esposa desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos en una casa alquilada. Su vida es ejemplo de progreso; cuando era muy joven comenzó su camino en la agricultura trabajando como peón en diferentes terrenos de cultivo, ahí juntó el dinero necesario para comenzar a sembrar, ahora trabaja sobre terrenos agrícolas arrendados. Sabe que le falta mucho para poder comprar uno propio, pero eso no lo desanima, pero no deja de sembrar sobre 5 hectáreas de tierra donde esparce semilla de espinaca, zanahoria y demás hortalizas. Ya  tiene 10 años de experiencia en este rubro y lo que más le gusta es ver como sus cultivos crecen día a día. Pero según menciona en tiempos de gran cosecha, contrata peones para que le puedan ayudar a terminar la cosecha y así viajar a la ciudad de Lima, donde vende su producción. Le va muy bien en la agricultura, ya que posee terrenos cerca del río, por lo que puede sembrar en cualquier estación del año. Por eso está planeando comprar un auto para poder trasportar su cosecha. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen María” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Rolando de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 3 bolsas de semilla de arveja para su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Rolando is 42 years old and lives in the town of Palcamayo. He lives together with Norma, who has been his wife for 20 years. Together they have 5 children, but they live with only 3 of them in a rented house. His life is an example of progress; when he was very young, he started his path in agriculture working as a laborer on various farms. In this way, he saved up the money he needed to begin planting, and now he works on rented agricultural lands. He knows that he still has a long way to go to buy his own farm, but this does not discourage him. He continuously plants 5 hectares of land, where he sows seeds for spinach, carrots and other vegetables. He has 10 years of experience in this field, and what he enjoys most is seeing how his crops grow day by day. He also mentions that in the heaviest harvest times, he contracts laborers so that they can help him finish the harvest, and then he travels to the city of Lima where he sells his produce. Farming is going very well for him, since he has lands near the river, so that he can plant in any season of the year. For this reason, he is planning to buy a car so that he can transport his harvest. He belongs to the “Virgen María” communal bank, and this is his first loan with MFP. He is looking forward to this collaboration so that he can continue working toward his objectives. Upon receiving this support, Rolando will invest the funds he is requesting in buying 3 bags of pea seeds for the next planting.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of pea seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories and a computer.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.en:
Gloria is 29 years old and lives near the city of Ibarra, Ecuador. She is married and lives with her husband and their children. They have four children age 13, 11, 6 and 2 months. 

She is a respectful, responsible and hardworking woman. She works in agriculture, growing beans and producing a local crop called “morocho,” which is a form of ground corn. She has been working in agriculture cultivating plants since she was a child alongside her parents. 

Gloria currently works alongside her husband, their children, and their relatives. She is seeking this loan to buy fertilizer. Gloria has been investing in her crops with loans for the past four years. She reports that she has been able to make more profits with the help of her loans. In the future, she hopes to improve her vehicle so that she can bring her crops to the market more directly.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mangoes, bananas and groundnuts for sale at the local market.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es: Isidora, de 45 años, reside en la localidad de Palcamayo. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, es madre soltera por lo que  vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus 4 queridos hijos. Como buena mujer del campo, desde niña aprendió a cuidar y producir la tierra. Desde entonces  con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas. Ella cultiva papa, zanahoria, espinaca y arveja, las cuales luego de brindarles el cuidado necesario lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde el campo a la ciudad. Además de dedicarse en la venta de carne por mayor en el mercado modelo de la ciudad de Tarma, también se dedica en la crianza de cerdos y ovejas a los que enseba para luego vender su carne cada dos a tres veces por semana.  Ahora ella se está preparando para la cosecha de espinaca y arveja, donde está segura podré obtener buenos ingresos. Por ello en adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar su producción. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen María” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Isidora de recibir su apoyo; invertirá en la compra de cerdos cuyo precio oscila entre S/. 400 soles cada uno; y si el dinero le alcanza invertirá en la compra de semilla de espinaca para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Isidora is 45 years old and lives in the town of Palcamayo.  She is known as a simple and hard-working woman.  She is a single mother and lives in a rented house with her four beloved children.  As a good country woman, she learned as a child to care for and tend the land.  Since then, with a lot of effort, she has worked her land and made it very productive.  She grows potatoes, carrots, spinach, and peas.  After she gives them the necessary care, she sells her crops in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.  

Her crops have given her the income necessary to provide for her family, so she wants to put all of her effort into improving her business.  The thing she likes best about her work is caring for her crops.  She has been doing this work for 20 years and she thinks the most difficult part is transporting her crops from the countryside to the city.  In addition to selling meat at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma, she also raises pigs and sheep, which she fattens to later sell her meat two or three times a week.  

Now she is preparing for the spinach and pea harvest, where she is sure to earn a good profit.  In the future, she wants to purchase new land to expand her production.  

She is a member of the Virgen María community bank, and this is her ninth loan with MFP.  She hopes that a small loan will allow her to meet her goals.  She promises once again to make her payments on time, as she has done with her past loans.  She is thankful to be a part of her community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.  Isidora will invest her loan in the purchase of pigs, whose price is about 400 soles each, and if she has money left, she will purchase spinach seeds for her next crop.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and spinach seeds.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos nació en la ciudad de Calca (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 44 años de edad. Actualmente, Carlos vive en la misma hermosa ciudad donde nació junto con sus dos hijos.  Carlos es docente de profesión y trabaja en el colegio Institución Educativa Carmen de la ciudad de Calca. Ya son siete años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Carlos requiere el préstamo para pagar cursos de capacitación y otra parte para la construcción de su casa. 

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Virgen del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Carlos was born in the city of Calca (Cusco, Perú), and is 44 years old.  Currently, Carlos lives in the same beautiful city where he was born with his two children.  Carlos is a teacher by profession and works at the Institución Educativa Carmen high school in the city of Calca.  He has done this work for seven years and it is going very well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work.  Carlos needs this loan to pay for training classes and also to do construction on his home.

He is a responsible and hard-working person, and because of these qualities, his coworkers invited him to participate in the Virgen del Carmen community bank with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to pay for training classes and to do construction on his house.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
La dame Fatou agée de 44 ans parraissant plus jeune que son âge est très active et exerce ce métier depuis plus de 6ans.Elle a eu à bénéficier de 4 crédits à l’IMCEC  payés avec succès.En plus de son expérience avéré dans le commerce, Fatou est aussi mère de 8 enfants  dont l’aîné à 28 ans.
Elle vend des lègumes provenant du champ de ses proches, ce qui réduit son coût d’achat.
Elle cherche le crédit pour renforcer son stock de carotte,choux,poivron,aubergine ….
Etant veuve et soutien de famille elle a besoin d’augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire pour pouvoir faire fasse aux dépenses alimentaires de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs Fatou, aged 44 but looking younger, is a very active woman. She has been in her trade for more than six years. In the past she benefited from four loans granted by the microfinance institution U-IMCEC, which she has repaid successfully. In addition to being an experienced businesswoman, Fatou is the mother of eight children, the eldest being 28.

Fatou sells vegetables harvested on the fields of her next of kin, which reduces her purchase price. She seeks this loan to increase her supply of carrots, cabbages, peppers, eggplants, etc. Since she is a widow and the breadwinner of the family, she needs a higher profit margin to be able to provide her family with food.

loans.use: to buy vegetables (cabbages, carrots, eggplants, peppers) for sale at the market.

loans.name: Oscar Jaime

texts.es:
El  señor Oscar Jaime vive en la cuidad de Managua
Es padre  de familia de tres  menores, es soltero, labora como distribuidor de factura,el señor Oscar Jaime  visito nuestras instalación para solicitar un crédito  ya que necesitaba el crédito para invertir en una mejoras para su vivienda.
La inversión del crédito los va a utilizar para la compra de cemento, arena, bloque, y pago de mano de obra.
El señor Oscar Jaime  agradece a ceprodel por el crédito que le dieron por que gracias al dinero financiado va a poder mejorar su hogar.
texts.en: Oscar Jaime lives in the city of Managua.  He’s the father of three minor children.  He’s single and works as an invoice distributor.  He visited our installation to request a loan because he needed the loan to invest in home improvements.  He will use the loan to buy cement, sand, concrete blocks and to pay labor costs.  Oscar Jaime thanks Ceprodel for the loan he was granted because thanks to the funds financed he will be able to improve his home.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Silvia Lorena

texts.en:
Silvia is 33 years old and lives near the city of Ibarra in northern Ecuador. She is divorced and lives with her four children ages 16, 13, 11, and 2 years. Silvia  is intelligent and focuses on her children. 

Silvia is a hardworking woman. She raises chickens for a living. She began her business with a few chickens and has since been able to grow her business to include about 300 chickens. Silvia reports that her business is going well. She has a fixed market for her chickens and delivers them regularly to nearby shops and restaurants. 

Silvia is seeking this loan in order to increase her business so that she can fill larger orders for her chickens. She has been investing in her business with loans from FODEMI since 2004 and has increased her profits and has been able to cover the costs for necessities for her children and her business. 

In the future, Silvia hopes to keep more than 10,000 chickens and have her own distribution business. For her children, she plans to support them in continuing their studies.

loans.use: to raise more chickens and fill larger orders for her customers.

loans.name: Frida

texts.es: Frida es una mujer honesta, tiene 37 años, reside en la comunidad nativa Pumpuriani (selva central peruana). Ahí vive con Néstor de 37 años, con quien tiene 4 hijos, pero solo viven con dos de ellos; Kevin de 11 y Joel de 3 años; juntos viven con mucho amor y cariño en su casa que es propia. Como jefa de la comunidad, Frida es una mujer decidida y trabajadora. Ella se encarga de las contrataciones de los terrenos de cultivo para los miembros de la comunidad, ya que la principal actividad de sus pobladores es la siembra de plátano y café. Hace ya 13 años que viene sembrando maíz híbrido, plátano y café; y para mantener el buen estado de sus productos ella los cuida constantemente, pues asegura, que si no corta la maleza de sus plantaciones no podrán crecer fuertes y nutritivos. Sus cuidados han hecho que sus cultivos sean de calidad, y hasta los mismos comercializadores visitan sus terrenos agrícolas para comprar lo que ha cosechado. Pero no solo a eso se dedica Frida, ya que instaló una pequeña bodega de comestibles donde vende productos de primera necesidad, así como también bebidas heladas, el fuerte calor y la lejanía del lugar, hacen que adquiera mayores ganancias. Por ello más adelante desea ahorrar más dinero para mejorar y surtir su tienda con mejores bebidas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Hormiguitas de pumpuriani” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP. Donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Frida, de obtener su apoyo tiene pensado invertir el dinero en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de plátanos que sembró hace poco; donde está segura obtendrá frutos de calidad.
texts.en:
Frida is an honest, 37-year-old woman living in the native community of Pumpuriani (Peruvian Central Jungle) with Néstor, 37.  They had four children but only two still live with them: Kevin, 11 and Joel, 3. They live together with much love and affection in their own house.  As a leader of the community, Frida is a determined, hard working woman.  She is in charge of contracting farmland for the community members since the main occupation of the residents is cultivating bananas and coffee.  She’s been growing hybrid corn, bananas and coffee for 13 years now and to maintain the good quality of her products she cares for them constantly because she assures that if she does not weed her plantings they will not grow to be strong and nutritious.  Her care has led to her crops being high quality and the merchants even visit her fields to buy what she’s harvested.  

However, Frida doesn’t just do this.  She also set up a small grocery store where she sells basic need items as well as cold beverages.  The intense heat and the remoteness of the place lead to her earning higher profits.  Because of this, she’d like to later on save money to improve her store and stock it with better beverages.

She is a member of the “Hormiguitas de Pumpuriani” (Pumpuriani’s Little Ants) communal bank and this is the sixth loan with MFP where she hopes for your collaboration to continue toward her goals.  On the other hand, she commits to once again make her payments like she’s done with previous loans.  Also, she enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and very mutually supportive people.  If Frida were to obtain the requested loan she plans to invest the money in the purchase of several sacks of organic manure to spread among the banana plants that she planted a short time ago and where she’s sure she’ll obtain quality fruit.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 31 years old and married. He has one child.  

To earn a living, he runs a pharmacy. He also owns a retail shop that he operates with his wife's assistance.  

Through Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business and he earns more profit.

He hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future. He has requested 50,000 KES to buy a microscope and medicine.

loans.use: To buy a microscope and medicine.

loans.name: Yonocente

texts.es: Ynocente de 47 años, reside en la localidad de Palcamayo. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Mila de 45 años y su único hijo Renzo de 16 años, a quien quiere mucho. La siembra de papa, espinaca y arveja es la actividad a la que se dedica Ynocente, todas las mañanas trabaja sus tierras para que sean más fértiles y productivas. Junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro, pues saben que cuidando con mucho esmero sus sembríos obtendrán mayores ingresos y así pagarán la educación de su hijo, ya que les demanda muchos gastos. Lo que más le gusta de su labor es cuidar sus cultivos de las plaga de insectos que pueden aquejarlos. Lleva 32 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de Tarma, que es donde vende sus cultivos. Dentro de unos días  espera cosechar espinaca y venderlo a buen precio en el mercado. La ambición de Ynocente, es poder obtener un negocio propio para que su esposa se quede en casa cuidando de su hijo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen María” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Ynocente de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 3 bolsas de semilla de arveja.
texts.en:
Ynocente, 47, lives in Palcamayo.  He is noted for being a very unassuming, hard working man.  He lives in his own house with his wife, Mila, 45, and his only son, Renzo, 16, who he loves very much.  Ynocente is a potato, spinach and pea farmer.  He heads out to his fields every morning to work the land to insure that it’s fertile and productive.  He and his wife work very hard together because they know that caring for their crops with much dedication will lead to higher income and they will be able to pay for their son’s education which entails quite a few expenses.

What he most enjoys about his work is keeping his crops free of insect infestations that can affect them.  He’s been in this line of work for 32 years and considers the most difficult part having to transport his products all the way to the Tarma market which is where he sells his crops.  He plans to harvest spinach in a few days and sell it for a good market price.  Ynocente’s ambition is to own a business of his own so that his wife can stay home and care for the children.

He’s a member of the “Virgen María” (Virgin Mary) communal bank and this is the 6th loan with MFP where he hopes to get a small loan to help him meet his objectives.  On the other hand, he commits once again to make his installment payments as he’s done with his previous loans.  Also, he enjoys being part of his communal bank because all the members are responsible and very mutually supportive people.  If Ynocente were to receive your support, he’ll invest the requested money in the purchase of three sacks of pea seeds.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of pea seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pharmaceuticals and natural medicines.

loans.name: Mykola

texts.en:
Mykola is married and has three children: two sons and a daughter. 

He worked as a taxi driver for eight years, but a year ago, he decided to redirect his business activity and started a pig farm. He breeds pigs in his home town of Ivano-Frankivsk. Mykola raises pigs and butchers them to sell meat wholesale to local market vendors. He makes about 13,000 UAH of income every month. 

Mykola is requesting a 20,000 UAH loan to purchase 13 additional pigs for the farm. He is hoping to grow pigs and generate additional income by selling meat in bulk. Mykola has two hired butchers who are helping at the farm and another employee who helps with transportation services. 

Mykola has recently purchased a two-room apartment for his family. He is planning to invest his profit in further refurbishment of his housing.

loans.use: to purchase 13 pigs.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is married. She is a market vendor from Berdyansk. Tamara sells women’s clothing and footwear in a local marketplace called "Privoz." She started her vending business 17 years ago. Currently, she has 55,000 UAH in turnover capital. Her income amounts to 17,000 UAH a month. 

Tamara is seeking a loan of 20,000 UAH to increase her inventory and purchase assorted clothing and summer footwear items for her female customers. She believes that offering quality products in combination with the best customer service is a wining strategy for both her customers and herself as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase assorted clothing and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Juan Sergio

texts.es:
El  señor Juan Sergio  vive en la ciudad de Managua
Es padre  de familia trabaja en una empresa ubicada en la ciudad de Managua laborando como  promotor desde dos año
 Don Juan Sergio  visito nuestra instalación para solicitar un crédito  ya que necesitaba el crédito para invertir en una mejora para su vivienda y así darle a su familia una condición segura.
La inversión del crédito los va a utilizar para la compra de cemento, arena, bloque, y pago de mano de obra. Ya que con ese material va a poder hacer un anexo a la  vivienda.
texts.en: Juan Sergio lives in the city of Managua.  He’s a father and has worked as a Salesman in a private firm for the last two years.  Juan Sergio visited our installation to request a loan because he needed the loan to invest in home improvements to provide his family with safe conditions.  He will use the loan to buy cement, sand, concrete block and to pay labor costs because he’s going to use this material to add on to his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 45 años, reside en la localidad de Palcamayo. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Pedro de 50 años y sus 3 queridos hijos. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, Nelly sale a trabajar sus campos, para ella no existen los días de descanso, ya que tiene que trabajar continuamente su chacra, para tener una buena producción. Sus principales productos de siembra son; la papa, espinaca y arveja, los cuales vende al por mayor en la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene, ya que puede disfrutar libremente de sus verdes campos, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas de insectos que afectan sus sembríos. Por otro lado acaba de iniciar el negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad, en un pequeño espacio de su casa, donde instaló una tienda. En todo este tiempo le fue muy difícil dividir sus actividades, pero eso no la desanima, ya que está obteniendo buenas ganancias. Ahora esta preparándose para la cosecha de espinaca en la próxima semana. Por ello para el futuro, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen María” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde está contenta de saber que tendrá el apoyo financiero que tanto necesita. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Nelly de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 10 kilos de semilla de espinaca, como también varios sacos de abono orgánico para comenzar sin ningún inconveniente su siembra.
texts.en:
Nelly, 45, lives in the community of Palcamayo.  She is notable for being a very unassuming, hard working woman living in her own house with her husband, Pedro, 50, and their three beloved children.  Every day starting very early in the morning, Nelly goes out to work her fields.  For her, there are no days of rest because she has to work her field continuously in order to have good production.  The main crops she grows are potatoes, spinach and peas, which she sells at wholesale in the city of Tarma.

What she most enjoys about her work is the freedom she has because she can freely enjoy the green fields.  She’s been in this business 30 years and considers the most difficult part having to protect her crops from the insect infestations that affect them.  In addition, she’s just started to sell groceries in a small space at home where she set up a store.  During all this time it’s been difficult for her to divide herself to both activities but this hasn’t discouraged her because she’s earning good profits.  She is now preparing to plant spinach next week.  In the futures she’d like to buy new lands to increase production.

She belongs to the “Virgen María” (Virgin Mary) communal bank and this is the 8th loan with MFP where she’s happy to know that she’ll have the financial support she so needs.  On the other hand, she commits to once again make her payments like she did with the previous loans she had.  Also, she enjoys being part of her communal bank because its members are responsible and very mutually supportive people.

If Nelly were to receive your help, she will use the requested money to buy ten kilos of spinach seeds as well as several sacks of organic manure to start planting without any inconvenience.

loans.use: to buy ten kilos of spinach seeds as well as several sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando tiene 38 años de edad, es padre soltero de 3 hijos y junto a ellos reside en el Barrio El Centro en el municipio de Patuca. El se dedica a la carpinteria, su oficio lo aprendió trabajando como ayudante de su hermano mayor. Doce años atrás inició elaborando sus trabajos solamente con herramientas manuales y luego de un tiempo pudo ahorrar algo de dinero y comenzó a adquirir algunas herramientas electricas para asi agilizar mas su trabajo. Su taller de carpinteria funciona en el patio trasero de su vivienda, y lo atiende él y un familiar, su horario de atencion al cliente comienza desde las 7:30 am y finaliza a las 4:30 pm. El prestamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de madera de caoba. Con el apoyo del prestamo podrá terminar algunos de los trabajos que ya tiene encargados y eso le permitirá seguir teniendo un ingreso para sostener a su familia. Su sueño es llegar a ser el propietario de una muebleria y se esforzara para conseguirlo, tambien seguirá apoyando a sus hijos con el estudio para que sean profesionales y tengan mayores oportunidades de desarrollarse y ganarse la vida. Este es el segundo prestamo de Orlando en Fama y espera cumplir con sus pagos de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Orlando, 38, is a single father of three children and he lives with them in the neighborhood known as El Centro in the town of Patuca.  He is a carpenter by trade and learned the business working alongside his elder brother as an assistant.  He began twelve years ago working only with hand tools and once he had enough money saved he began acquiring electrical equipment to facilitate his work.  His workshop is set up on the patio behind his house and he and another relative work there together.  His is open for business from 7:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.  

He plans to use the loan to buy mahogany wood.  With the help of the loan he will be able to finish some of the jobs he has on order and this will give him income for household expenses.  His dream is to be the owner of a large furniture business and he is making every effort to accomplish this.  He also wants to continue supporting his children so they can get an education and become professionals with more opportunities to get ahead in life.  This is Orlando's second loan through Fama and he is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wood.

loans.name: Arame

texts.fr:
Arame a 32 ans ;elle habite dans un village situé à quelques encablures de la ville principale.Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont le plus jeune a 4 ans et l’aîné 11 ans.
L’activité de Arame conciste à l’ achat et à la revente de l’ huile d’ arachide et de mangues .Arame possède une expérience de 10 ans.Elle a démarré très jeune en accompagnant sa maman.Elle adore ce métier et en fait sa principale occupation.
Avec ce crédit elle veut profiter de la période des mangues pour augmenter la vente de ces dernière par rapport à la vente de l’ huile d’arachide qui se fait rare actuellement mais sera plus important vers les mois à venir.
Avec les revenus de la vente Arame compte appuyer son époux dans les dépenses de la maison.
texts.en:
Arame is 32 years old. She lives in a village located a short distance from the main town. She is married and the mother of 5 children, aged between 5 and 11. 

Arame buys and sells peanut oil and mangoes. She has been doing this for 10 years, having begun by accompanying her mother when she was very young. She loves this work and it is her main occupation. With the loan, she wants to take advantage of the mango season to increase her mango sales in relation to sales of peanut oil, which is slow at the moment but will become stronger in the months to come. With income from sales, Arame plans to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy peanut oil and mangoes, for resale at the market.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene tiene 38 años reside en la localidad de Huaylahuicha. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora, vive en casa de su madre, quien le ayuda a cuidar de sus 2 queridos hijos, Joselin de 15 y Víctor de 12 años, a quienes quiere mucho. Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, ahí trabaja arduamente, para que sus cultivos de lechuga, arveja, espinaca, cebollita china y papa, sean los más solicitados de su poblado. Todas las mañanas como hace 5 años; sin importar las condiciones del clima, sale a trabajar hacía sus chacras, ya que sabe que de ello dependen los ingresos que obtendrán por la venta de sus productos, que según cuenta tardan un promedio de 5 meses en madurar. Tiempo en que traslada su producción al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, para ser comercializado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, más le dificulta transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de la ciudad. Pero eso no la desanima, ya que traslada sus sembríos de espinaca a la capital donde obtiene mayores ganancias. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción y así obtener una camioneta con las ganancias que obtendrá. Todo esto pensando en el futuro de sus hijos, a quienes desea pagarles la carrera universitaria. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Victoria” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de la colaboración de todos ustedes para lograr sus objetivos. Con el compromiso de pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, por otro lado se siente feliz de pertenecer a una asociación que le ayude a crecer. Marlene de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de semilla de arveja y varios sacos de abono orgánico para comenzar con la siembra.
texts.en:
Marlene, 38, lives in the town of Huaylahuicha.  She is a hard-working woman and lives with her mother who helps care for her two lovely children, Joselin, 15, and Víctor, 12, whom she loves very much.  Her main business is agriculture, and she works hard to grow lettuce, peas, spinach, Chinese onions and potatoes, which are in most demand in her town.  Every morning, as she has been doing for five years no matter what the weather conditions were, she goes out to work on her land because she knows her income depends on sales of her produce, which takes an average five months to grow.  She then takes it to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma to be sold.  

What she likes most about her job is working the lands.  The most difficult part is getting her produce to market.  But she does not let this get her down, and she takes her spinach crop to the capital city where she can earn more money.  In the future she would like to buy more land to increase production and buy a truck with her earnings.  Everything is all based on her children's future, as she would like to put them through college.  She belongs to the communal bank "Victoria" and this is her second loan through MFP, where she counts on your support to help her grow.  Marlene plans to use the loan to buy pea seeds and several sacks of organic fertilizer to begin planting.

loans.use: To buy pea seeds and several sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda tiene 50 años, resiD. en la localidad D. Huaylahuichan. Ahí formó su familia desD. hace 32 años, junto a su esposo Juan, quien ahora está en el país D. Argentina. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 D. ellos en una casa alquilada. La bodega D. Olinda es la primera en abrirse en su Pueblo, desD. las 6 D. la mañana sus puertas ya están listas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo D. la variedad D. la mercadería que tiene no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad D. que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse D. las cosas que suceden en su Pueblo, lleva 3 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro D. su tienda, sin poder salir. Pero sabe que su mayor distracción es la agricultura. Ya que en los 3 terrenos agrícolas heredados por parte D. su esposo, siembra 2 veces al año; maíz y arveja y gracias a sus cuidados logra obtener una buena cosecha. Con el tiempo, anhela hacer crecer su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Victoria”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donD. está contenta D. recibir el apoyo financiero que tanto necesita. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Olinda D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en surtir su tienda D. comestibles, comprando los productos más solicitados en este mes.
texts.en:
Olinda, 50, lives in the town of Huaylahuichan, where 32 years ago she formed a family with her husband, Juan, who is now in Argentina.  They have five children, but only two are living with them in their rental house.  The store that Olinda established was the first in her town.  It opens at 6 in the morning to receive the first early shoppers, who know there is always a variety of merchandise to buy and they will find what they are looking for.  

What she likes most about her work is talking to the customers and learning about what goes on in her town.  She has been in this business for three years and feels that the most difficult part of her job is staying in the store all day without being able to leave.  But she knows that her greatest pastime is agriculture.  She has three patches of farmland that she inherited through her husband.  She grows corn and peas two times a years and obtains a good crop because of her hard work.  

In the future she would like to grow her business and give her customers better service.  She belongs to the communal bank "Victoria" and this is her second loan through MFP.  She is grateful for the financial support she needs and is committed to paying it back on time, as she did with the other one.  Being part of the communal bank is important to her because all the members are responsible and supportive.  Olinda plans to use the loan to buy more goods for her store, especially the ones in more demand this month.

loans.use: To buy products for her store.

loans.name: Teresa De Los Angeles

texts.es: Teresa, de35 años de edad, esta casada, madre de hijos de 18 y 12 años de edad respectivamente, ella es originaria de León, ella es comerciante, se dedica a hacer recargas de minutos a teléfonos celulares, llamadas nacionales e internacionales lleva 4 años en este negocio. Lo que la motivo a ella a poner su negocio fue el deseo de tener algo propio y no depender de nadie, además de que la situación económica es muy difícil y la falta de empleo son factores determinantes que la impulsaron a reaccionar rápido para encontrar un medio de subsistencia para ella y su familia inicio con un capital de $150 dólares fue la primera en su barrio en abrir negocios de llamadas internacionales y recargas de minutos a celulares, su clientela fue creciendo poco a poco. Su esposo aporta en el hogar con lo que gana como despachador de gasolina. Solicito el préstamo para invertir en recargas de teléfono y comprar mercadería para instalar una mini pulpería en su casa. Pues desea hacer  crecer su negocio con esta inversión, mejorar sus ganancias y diversificarse como comerciante. Sus planes futuros son instalar cabinas telefónicas para dar más privacidad a sus clientes y tener una pulpería bien surtida como otros ingresos, enfocada en mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa, 35, is married and has two children who are 18 and 12 years of age respectively.  She is from León and is a merchant.  She sells cell phone recharge minutes and places national and international phone calls.  She’s been in business four years.  What motivated her to open a business of her own was her wish to have something of her own and not be dependent on anyone else.  Besides, the economic situation is very difficult and lack of employment was a determining factor that pushed her into reacting quickly to find some way to support herself and her family.

She started out with an investment of $150 dollars.  She was the first one in her neighborhood to set up an international phone calling service and cell phone minutes charges.  Her clientele grew gradually.  Her husband contributes to household expenses with the salary he earns as a gas station attendant.

She requested the loan to buy cell phone recharges and to buy merchandise to set up a small grocery store in her house because she wants to use this investment to make her business grow and diversify as a merchant.  Her future plans are to install phone booths to provide her customers with more privacy and to have a well-stocked grocery store as a source of additional income focused on improving her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cel phone recharge minutes and to buy merchandise to set up a minimart.

loans.name: José Martin

texts.es:
El  señor José Martin vive en la ciudad de Managua, se dedica a labor de agente de seguridad desde hace tres año, para brindarle una mejor condición de vida a su familia

El señor José Martin visito nuestra instalación para solicitar un crédito  ya que necesitaba el crédito para invertir en unas mejoras para su vivienda.
La inversión del crédito los va a utilizar para la compra de  zinc  ya que la llegada del invierno tiene que mejorar el techo de su vivienda y  agradece a ceprodel por el crédito que le dieron por que gracias al dinero financiado va a poder mejorar su hogar.
texts.en:
Mr. José Martin lives in the city of Managua where he has been a security agent for three years in order to provide a better lifestyle for his family.

José Martin visited our offices to request a loan since he wants to make some home improvements.  He plans to buy zinc so he can fix the roof on his house before winter arrives.  He is grateful to Ceprodel for the loan which will help him make his home more comfortable.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Ouleye

texts.fr:
Madame Oulèye agée de 44 ans ,loge dans un petit village situé à 90 km de Dakar.Elle a 8 enfants dont la moyenne d’âge est 10 ans.Elle vit avec son mari avec qui elle partage son activité.
Ils font du maraîchage ; activité qu’ils ont hérité de leurs ancêtres.Elle aimerais acquérir d’autres techniques maraîchères  pour pouvoir  maximiser  la rentabilité de son activité
Comme c’est la période des pluies Oulèye veut utiliser le crédit pour acheter des semences et des engrais pour bien préparer  l’hivernage.
Les bénéfices contribueront à faire fasse aux charges alimentaires de la maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Oulèye, 44 years old, lives in a small village about 90 km from Dakar.  She has eight children with a median age of 10, and lives with her husband.  Together they are farmers, a trade inherited from their ancestors.  She would like to acquire more farming techniques to increase her business profitability.

Because it is the rainy season Oulèye wants to use her loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to prepare well for the season.  The profits will help pay the family’s food expenses.

loans.use: to buy cabbage seeds and fertilizer before the rainy season

loans.name: Renaldy Antonio

texts.es:
El  señor Renaldy Antonio  vive en la ciudad de Managua, es casado, se dedica arduamente a laborar como analista de acreditaciones dedicándose a esta labor desde hace veinte años.
Es padre  de familia trabaja en la ciudad de Managua el señor Renaldy  visito nuestras instalación para solicitar un crédito  ya que necesitaba el crédito para invertir en una mejoras para su vivienda.
El  crédito los va a utilizar para la compra de materiales de construcción como: perlines y zinc 
y  agradece a ceprodel por el crédito 
Por que gracias a eso va a poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Renaldy Antonio lives in the city of Managua.  He is married and works hard as an accreditation analyst, which he has been doing for the last 20 years. 

He visited our offices to request a loan for home improvement.  He plans to use the loan to buy profiles and zinc.  He is grateful to Ceprodel for the loan since he will be able to make his home more comfortable.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Siraji

texts.en:
Siraji is a 29-year-old hardworking man with two children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda.
