He has been doing boda-boda (bicycle or motorcycle transport) business for five years. He started with two bicycles and now has a motorcycle. 

His hardships are scarcity of money for fuel and accidents, and his vision is to own at least three motorcycles, build a house and educate his children.

Siraji needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Sidney's Communal Bank Group

texts.en:
Sidney, 39, is the president of this communal bank located in the city of San Lorenzo in northwest Ecuador. He lives with his wife and three children. His oldest child is 11, the middle one is 9, and the youngest is 4. Sidney is a good person who is responsible in both his family and his business. He likes to share what he has with others. 

Sidney’s business is a clothing store and he is seeking this loan to buy more merchandise to stock his store. He began his business by selling perfume and footwear. After six months, he began selling clothing as well. He has been able to hire one person named Jairo who helps Sidney every day. 

This is his first time soliciting a loan and he hopes that it will help improve his clothing orders and help him cover the costs of his children’s education. His dream is to see his business grow and be able to compete with the larger clothing stores in San Lorenzo. He also dreams of more education for himself as well as for his children.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing to expand his clothing store's offerings.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a Ugandan male, age 32 years. He is the father of six children whose mother is a housewife. He lives in a semi-permanent house with eight people that he takes care of.

He has operated a retail shop for four years. He acquired his initial capital from selling bananas, which he got from his plantation. 

He needs a loan to purchase sugar, soap, cooking oil and maize flour for resale in the retail shop. He dreams of acquiring land on which to build a permanent house.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, soap, cooking oil and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: Aurora tiene 22 años, vive en la localidad de Huaylahuichan. Ahí formó su familia desde hace 6 meses con Roel, quien cuida de sus 2 hijos: Briceyda de 6 y Sebastian de 1 año, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida en su casa propia. Trabajando arduamente Aurora ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Todo esto gracias al apoyo de su esposo quien divide las actividades de la familia para poder salir adelante; mientras que Aurora se dedica al cuidado de sus sembríos; donde hace tan solo un año comenzó a sembrar espinaca, lechuga y arveja. Es así que todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus cultivos. Sus productos los llevan a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde son rápidamente comprados, ya que la conocen como una gran comerciante de cuyes, animales que cría en su casa. Por otro lado su esposo se dedica al trasporte público cubriendo las rutas Tarma-Palca, donde obtiene un dinero extra, aportando así en los gastos de la  familia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus campos. Con el tiempo, espera poder desarrollarse al máximo en sus actividades. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Victoria” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. De recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 20 cuyes, pues desea intensificarse en la crianza de éstos animales.
texts.en:
Aurora, 22, lives in the town of Huaylahuichan.  There she formed a family six months ago with Roel, who cares for their two children: Briceyda, 6, and Sebastian, 1, for whom they want to provide the best lifestyle in their own home.  Aurora works hard for her family to get ahead.  This is all thanks to the support of her husband who divides his time between work and family activities.  Aurora tends to their crops, which only a year ago she planted: spinach, lettuce and peas.  Every morning she gets up early to water and care for the crops.  She takes them to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma where they are quickly sold.  She is also known as a guinea pig merchant, and raises them in her house.  Her husband is a public transportation driver and covers the route between Tarma and Palca, earning extra income for the household expenses.  

What Aurora likes most about her work is the freedom to work in her fields. In the future she would like to fully develop her activities.  She is a member of the communal bank "Victoria" and this is her second loan through MFP, where she is counting on you for support so she can continue with her goals.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time, as with the previous one.  She enjoys being part of the bank because all the members are responsible and supportive.  She plans to use the loan to buy 20 guinea pigs so she can intensify her work raising these animals.

loans.use: To buy 20 guinea pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the balance on his newly acquired taxi van.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, cooking oil and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Aquelina

texts.es: Aquelina, D. 58 años vive en la localidad D. Cayan. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer que siempre ha luchado por sobresalir en la vida. En compañía D. Epifanio, su esposo desD. hace 40 años, cuida D. sus 7 hijos. D. los cuales solo educan y crían al menor D. ellos, Gilmer. La perseverancia es su principal virtud. Hace algunos meses sufrió una enfermedad en el ovario, por lo que tuvo que viajar a la capital para tratar su enfermedad. La fortaleza y preocupación por trabajar le ayudaron a tener la energía para recuperarse. Ahora ella continúa cuidando sus campos D. cultivo como hace 25 años, regando y fertilizando sus cultivos D. papa D. toda variedad. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es la temporada D. siembra, ya que al ser solo 2 veces al año le permite dedicarse a otras actividades como la ganadería. Según comenta tiene 15 vacas D. raza brown swiss, a las que cuida en Chucchay, un caserío amplio y con mucha vegetación que queda a 2 horas D. su casa; allá Aquelina construyó su estancia. La leche que le proporcionan sus vacas le ayudan para elaborar 4 moldes D. queso al día; los cuales venden a los comerciantes que la visitan constantemente; así obtiene un dinero extra. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es que pueD. disfrutar D. la libertad D. laborar en sus campos. Ahora está juntando dinero suficiente para comprar una movilidad, ya que solo se trasporta con su pequeño burrito. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón D. Jesús” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donD. espera la ayuda D. todos ustedes para poder continuar con sus objetivos. Razón por la que se compromete en pagar puntualmente con sus cuotas. Aquelina D. obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra D. semilla D. papa en la variedad yungay y única. Además D. varios sacos D. abono orgánico para comenzar con éxito la siembra.
texts.en:
Aquelina, 58, lives in the town of Cayan.  She has always been a woman who has struggled to get ahead and has lived with her husband, Epifanio, for 40 years, and cared for her seven children.  They now only educate and raise the youngest of them, Gilmer.  Her main virtue is perseverence.  A few months ago she suffered from an ovarian illness and had to travel to the capital for treatment.  Her strength and concern for work helped her recover her energy.  Now she continues tending to her crop fields like she did 25 years ago, watering and fertilizing her potato crops.  

What she likes most about her work is the planting season which is only twice a year, thus allowing her to dedicate time to other activities like livestock farming.  She has 15 Brown Swiss cows which she raises in Chucchay, a large rural village with a lot of vegetation about two hours from her home, and where Aquelina built a stable.  The milk she gets from her cows allows her to produce four cheese wheels per day which she sells to the merchants visiting constantly.  This way she earns a little extra money.  What she enjoys most about her work is the freedom working in her fields.  Now she is saving up to buy a vehicle, since she uses a donkey for transportation.  She belongs to the communal bank "Corazón D. Jesús" and this is her second loan through MFP, where she hopes to receive your support to reach her goals.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  Aquelina plans to use the loan to buy potato seeds in the varieties "yungay" and "única".  She also plans to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer for a successful planting season.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and several sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: Emilio tiene 41 años, vive en el caserío de Cayan. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre sencillo, vive en su casa propia junto a Marlene, su esposa desde hace 2 años. Pero convivió durante 12 años para dar el gran paso de unir sus vidas. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Luis y Maycol a los que cuidan mucho. Las tierras del caserío de Cayan, se caracterizan por producir toda variedad de papa. Ahí Emilio comenzó desde hace 8 años a sembrar papa y poner en práctica todo lo enseñado por sus padres. En sus terrenos agrícolas siembra 2 veces al año. La primera en “tierras temporales”, llamadas así por aprovechar las temporadas de lluvia, donde los frutos crecen solos sin tener que ser regados, la segunda en “tierras de regadillo”, que pueden ser sembrados durante cualquier tiempo, ya que tiene agua a disposición. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar con mucho esmero de sus productos, ya que ve concretizado su trabajo en cada cosecha donde vende al mercado mayorista de la ciudad. Además de tener 2 toros “novillos” (de 3 años de edad), con los que labra la tierra, para si mismo y para otros que le pagan un dinero extra, según cuenta S/. 60 soles al día. Ahora se está preparando para la cosecha de papa de la variedad “andina”, por lo que está seguro podrá obtener buenos resultados. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de Jesús” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus proyectos. Por ello se compromete en cumplir puntualmente con sus cuotas. Emilio de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico y fertilizantes naturales para comenzar con la siembra de papa “yungay”.
texts.en:
Emilio, 41, lives in the rural village of Cayan.  He is a simple man and lives in his own house with his wife, Marlene.  They have been married for two years but had lived together for 12 years before tying the knot.  They have two children, Luis and Maycol, who they care for lovingly.  The Cayan farm lands are known for their different variety of potatoes.  There Emilio began growing potatoes eight years ago and puts into practice everthing he learned from his parents.  He plants twice a year.  The first during the rainy season when crops grow without having to be watered, and the second in the watering season when they grow any time but with irrigation.

What he enjoys most about his work is taking care of his produce because he feels like he has done a good job each harvest time when he goes to the wholesale market in town.  He also has two young oxen (3 years old) that he uses to plow the fields.  He plows for himself and for others who pay him extras money, around S/.60 per day.  He is now preparing to plant the "andina" variety and is sure he will get good results.  He belongs to the communal bank "Corazón de Jesús" and this is his second loan through MFP, where he counts on your help for his projects.  He is committed to paying back the loan on time.  The loan will be used to buy various sacks of organic fertilizer to begin planting his "yungay" potato.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert, aged 28, is a father of one child two years old with whom he lives together with the child’s mother. He hails from Kyenjojo district.

Robert has been a farmer for the past two years. His main problem is that of changes in the weather.

Robert is requesting a loan to plow his land for the next growing season. In the future he wants to start up a produce business and be a leading food supplier in the region.

loans.use: to plow his land for the next growing season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more barbering equipment for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Andrea Del Carmen

texts.es:
Andrea tiene la edad de 42 años, con su pequeño negocio la venta de comida y sopa, vendiento desde hace quince años, el cual era el negocio de su mama y que ella sigue. Su esposo es comerciante en la venta de chatarra y ambos han cuidado de su familia.
Doña Andrea tiene su propia casa que con mucho esfuerzo han hecho, en donde desea hacer divisiones de cuarto, logrando privacidad para su familia, a si como mejor higiene. El cual le sera posible mediante el financiamiento que Afodenic dara.
Comprara materiales de construccion en la compra de bloques, bolsa de cemento, arena, piedrin, hiero para comenzar la obra.
Sus objetivo es aumentar la produccion de variedad de comida, lo que con esta inversion le sara viable ya que son prestamo a plazos en donde se equilibran mejor su capital.
texts.en:
Andrea is 42 years old.  She has a small business selling food and soup.  She has been selling for 15 years.  The business used to belong to her mom and now she is following her.  Andrea's husband sells scrap metal and they both care for their family.

Andrea has built her own home with a lot of effort.  She would like to put up dividing walls to make a room in order to give her family some privacy and also better hygiene.  This will be possible with the loan that Afodenic gives her.

Andrea will buy building supplies (blocks, bags of cement, sand, gravel and iron) in order to start the work.

Andrea's goal is to produce a larger amount and variety of food.  This investment will make that possible since the loan is paid in instalments so she will be able to better balance her capital.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand and iron so that she can start building the dividing walls for a room

loans.name: Seleverio

texts.en:
Seleverio, 30, is married with four children. He rents a house in Kasese, Uganda.

Seleverio has been a shopkeeper for twelve years. This has facilitated him in providing for the family since the responsibility rests solely on him.

Seleverio’s vision is to run a wholesale business, educate his children, and to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Clovice

texts.en: Clovice is a 59-year-old married man with ten children. He lives in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Clovice grows bananas on a large scale and this has enabled him to pay school fees for his children. His major hardship is price fluctuations during harvest time. He wants to enlarge his plantation as it has been very profitable. Clovice needs this loan to buy manure and pesticides for the farm.

loans.use: to buy manure and pesticides.

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es: Jhon tiene 20 años, vive en el caserío de Cayan. Ahí vive en compañía de su papá y sus 2 hermanos menores, que a pesar de ser la nueva esposa de su padre. Los quiero mucho. Desde muy niño aprendió a luchar por si solo, ya que su mamá murió cuando el tenía 12 años de edad. Desde entonces ayudó a su padre incondicionalmente en los gastos económicos de su casa; él le enseñó todo lo necesario para poder emprender su camino en la agricultura. Hace 3 años que comenzó a sembrar por si mismo; en su terreno agrícola esparce las semillas de papa de todas las variedades. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder cuidar sus cultivos de las constantes plagas que azotan el lugar. En todo este tiempo logró comprar con el dinero ahorrado, 4 vacas y 3 toros. Estos últimos le sirven para poder dedicarse al arado de la tierra, donde hace el servicio a terceras personas ganando un promedio de S/. 65 soles al día. El trabajo constante es su lema, por eso en sus tiempos libres también trabaja en construcción, realizando casas. Ahora las aspiraciones de este joven hombre son mayores; ya que desea ahorrar lo necesario para la creación de una tienda comercial en la ciudad de Tarma. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de Jesús” y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde está contento de tener el apoyo financiero que tanto necesita. Además se siente contenta de pertenecer a un grupo de personas responsables y solidarias. Jhon de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Jhon is 20 years old.  He lives in the small village of Cayan together with his dad and his two younger siblings who, although they are the children of his father's new wife, he loves very much.

Jhon learned to fend for himself at a very young age as his mom died when he was 12 years old.  Since then he has helped his father unconditionally in covering their household expenses.  His father taught him all he needed to know to start working in farming.  He started sowing his own crops three years ago.  On his farmland he sows different varieties of potato seeds.  What he most enjoys about his work is being able to care for his crops against the constant pests that attack the place.  Over the years, he has managed to save up and buy four cows and three bulls.  He uses the bulls to plow land; he offers his services to third parties and earns, on average, 65 Peruvian soles a day.

"Constant work" is Jhon's motto.  In his spare time, he also works in construction, building houses.  This young man has high aspirations.  He would like to save up enough money to set up a store in the city of Tarma.  He belongs to the "Corazón de Jesús" community bank and this is his first loan from MFP.  He is happy to have the financial support that he so needs.  He also feels happy to belong to a group of responsible and supportive people.  With your support, Jhon will invest the money he has requested in buying several sacks of organic fertilizer to spread over his potato crops.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: America

texts.es: America tiene 38 años, vive en compañía de Cesar, su esposo desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Cayan. El trabajo arduo es su lema, pues America trabaja con mucho ahínco en sus terrenos agrícolas. Hace 10 años que comenzó con la siembra de papa, arveja y olluco; en sus propios terrenos. Los cuales después de fertilizarlos los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Según cuenta, considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Ella siembra 2 veces al año y lo que más le gusta es cosechar, ya que los mismos compradores van a sus propios terrenos, y así evita el tener que trasladar su producción al mercado.  Al mismo tiempo se dedica a la crianza de vacas Holstein que son lecheras; las cuales producen la leche con lo que hace queso. Cada fin de semana recibe ganancias, ya que vende 4 moldes de queso a una comerciante de productos lácteos. Además de tener 3 cerdos a los que cría para poder vender su carne. Ahora está pensando sembrar 20 sacos de papa en esta temporada. Su sueño en el futuro es comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus plantaciones. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de Jesús” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde espera el apoyo de ustedes para continuar con su trabajo. America de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono para comenzar con éxito la siembra de papa de la variedad “yungay”.
texts.en: America is 38 years old. She has lived with  Cesar, her husband, for 20 years. They both have 4 children. but they only live with 3 of them in their house located in the community of Cayan. Hard work is her motto, and America puts a lot of effort into her farmland. For 10 years she has planted potatoes, peas and olluco on her own land. After fertilizing, she sells them in the wholesale market of the city of Tarma. According to her, what she thinks is the most difficult thing is transporting her product, since the sacks are very heavy and they tire her out a lot. She plants twice a year and what she likes the most is harvesting, since the buyers themselves go to her land, and thus she avoids having to transport to the market. She also raises Holstein cows, which are dairy cows. She makes cheese with the milk they produce. Every weekend she receives earnings, since she sells 4 cheese molds to a dairy product merchant. She also has 3 pig that she is raising to sell for meat. Now she is planning on planting 20 sacks of potatoes for this season. Her dream for the future is to buy new land to increase her crops. She belongs to the “Corazón de Jesús” community bank and this is her ninth loan with MFP, where she hopes that your support for her work will continue. With your support, America will invest the money she has asked for in buying several bags of fertilizer to successfully begin planting the "Yungay" variety of potatoes.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Orbelina

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y tres hijos D. 28, 14 y 6 años D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. comida, frutas y refrescos, inicio hace 20 años, su madre le enseño el negocio y hoy en día lo realiza diariamente D. 8:00am a 3:00pm, ya que depenD. D. las ganancias del negocio para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en mercadería para el negocio, comprara aceite, carnes, condimentos, chicharrón, verduras y frutas, con esta compra surtirá el negocio y tendrá mayor disponibilidad para preparar los alimentos.
Su objetivo es darle estabilidad al negocio, cubriendo mayor las necesidades D. los clientes, D. esta manera estará creciendo como comerciante y generando mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and three children aged 28, 14 and 6.  Her business is selling food, fruit and drinks.  She started out 20 years ago when her mother taught her the business.  Now she works from 8.00am to 3.00pm every day since she depends on the profits from her business to cover her household expenses.

María is currently requesting a loan to invest in merchandise for her business.  She will buy oil, meat, condiments, fried pork rinds, fruit and vegetables.  With this purchase, she will stock her business and have more ingredients available for preparing her food.  Her goal is to stabilize her business and better meet her customers' needs.  In this way, she will grow as a saleswoman and make more profits.

loans.use: to buy oil, meat, condiments, fried pork rinds, fruit and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna tiene 27 años, vive en el caserío de Cayan. Ahí formó su familia con Amalio, su esposo desde hace 8 años. Ambos tienen un hijo, Brandon, de 6 años a quien aman y cuidan en su casa propia. El trabajo al que se dedica esta abnegada mujer es la agricultura. Es así que hace 12 años viene sembrando una variedad de tubérculos como: papa, oca y olluco. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas. Tanto así que sus cosecha los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde recibe buenas ganancias. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es mantener sus sembríos limpios con la ayuda de su esposo, quien esta con ella incondicionalmente. En todo este tiempo logró obtener sus propios terrenos agrícolas, eso le ayuda a obtener mayores ganancias, los cuales piensa invertir en los estudios de sus hijos. Ahora comenzará a sembrar papa de variedad “yungay” y “andina”, donde esta segura obtendrá buenos resultados. Ella desea para su futuro mejorar su casa. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de Jesús” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos. Por eso se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Reyna de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico y fertilizantes naturales para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de papa que piensa sembrar.
texts.en:
Reyna is 27 years old and lives in the small village of Cayan.  There she has formed a family with Amalio, her husband of 8 years.  The couple have a son, 6 year-old Brandon, who they love and care for in their own home.  

This self-sacrificing woman works as a farmer.  For twelve years, she has been growing a variety of tubers such as potatoes, 'oca' and 'olluco' (both native tubers).  With a lot of effort, she has managed to work her land and make it very productive; so much so that she sells her harvests in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma and makes good profits.

What Reyna most enjoys about her work is keeping her crops clear of weeds with the help of her husband who is with her unconditionally.  Over the years, she managed to obtain her own farmland.  This helps her to make more profits which she plans to invest in her children's education.

Reyna is starting to sow 'yungay' and 'andina' potato varieties and she is sure that she will obtain good results.  In the future, she would like to improve her home.

Reyna is a member of the 'Corazón de Jesús' (Heart of Jesus) community bank and this is her seventh loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive a small loan so that she can continue reaching for her goals.  For this reason, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  With your support, Reyna will invest the money she has requested in buying several sacks of organic manure and natural fertilizers to spread over the potatoes that she plans to sow.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of organic manure and natural fertilizers

loans.name: Santos Delfina

texts.es:
Santos, vive con su familia, su esposo y tres hijos D. 14, 12 y 10 años D. edad, ella se dedica a atender un negocio en su casa donD. ofrece artículos D. primera necesidad, trabaja junto a su esposo y sus hijos atendiendo a los clientes desD. las 7:00am a 6:00pm.
Actualmente necesita invertir en su negocio, surtiéndolo D. mercadería como arroz, azúcar, condimentos, boquitas y bebidas, para realizar dicha inversión solicita un préstamo que le cubra el gasto y contribuya a crecer en el comercio.
Su objetivo es crecer en el negocio, manteniendo D. todo lo necesario para los clientes, ya que al satisfacerles sus demandas lograra una mayor afluencia y mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Santos lives with her family, her husband and their three children, aged 14, 12, and 10. She manages a business from her house, offering essential products. She works together with her husband and children in attending their clients, from 7am to 6pm.

She needs to invest in her business by supplying it with products, such as rice, sugar, condiments, snacks, and drinks. In order to make such an investment she requests a loan. It will cover the expenses and it will contribute to the business' growth.

Her objective s to increase her business, adding anything their clients need. Satisfying their demands will increase their affluence and their sales.

loans.use: to purchase products such as rice, sugar, condiments, snacks, and drinks for her business.

loans.name: Bernardina Santos

texts.es:
Bernardina, se dedica al comercio de frutas, vive con su esposo y un hijo, ella realiza sus ventas de frutas de manera ambulante, por algunas calles de la ciudad, también en las afueras de las escuelas, este negocio le ayuda para contar con ingresos y cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar mangos, papaya, sandia, para salir a vender, con estas frutas tendrá la posibilidad de continuar en su negocio, realizando las ventas a los clientes y generando más ganancias.
Su propósito es aumentar el negocio, crecer en su clientela, tener un lugar fijo donde instalarse a vender y ayudar a su familia en lo necesario.
texts.en:
Bernardina is a fruit merchant. She lives with her husband and one child. She makes her fruit sales itinerantly, traveling along some of the streets in the city but also selling outside schools. With this business she is able to have an income to cover the needs of the home. She requests a loan to purchase mangoes, papayas, and watermelons to go out and sell. With these fruits she will be able to continue on with her business, making sales to her clients and generating more earnings.

Her goal is to increase her business, to increase her clientele, to have a store where to set herself up to make her sales, and to help her family in whatever they need.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes, papayas, and watermelons to go out to sell.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en: Cissy is a 40-year-old single mother of two children living in a semi permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her dream is to build a permanent house and diversify her business. Cissy deals in a cattle trade business. She got her initial capital of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from farming two years ago. Her major challenge is lack of enough capital to buy cattle, and her dream is to own a ranch. Cissy needs this loan to buy more cattle for resale.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for resale.

loans.name: Jose Salvador

texts.es:
José, es agricultor y ganadero, vive con su familia conformada por su esposa y dos hijos de 14 y 7 años de edad, ellos son dependientes. José inicio la agricultura y ganadería por influencia de su padre, actualmente trabaja en lo propio y solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en materiales para la agricultura.
Él se dispone a sembrar maíz por lo que comprara fertilizantes y abono, este préstamo le ayudara para realizar la siembra y dar los cuidados necesarios para que produzca abundantemente.
Su objetivo es tener una buena producción, abundante y sana, proveyendo para su familia la alimentación necesaria y velando por sus hijos para que tengan acceso al estudio y se superen.
texts.en:
Jose is an agriculturist and a livestock farmer. He lives with his family, which is composed of his wife, and their two children, aged 14 and 7. They are dependents. Jose started out in agriculture and farming following the influence of his father. He works by his own accord and he requests a loan to invest in agricultural materials.

She cultivates corn so he will purchase fertilizers and manure. This loan will help him establish his plantation and to provide the necessary maintenance to have an abundant production. His objective is to have a good yield that is abundant and of good quality. It will help him provide his family with the food they need and to provide his children with an education to press forward.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and manure for his corn plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Hada Luz

texts.es:
Hada, es comerciante de ropa, vive sola, inicio el negocio por influencia de una amiga, trabaja de forma ambulante en los alrededores del mercado municipal, por el momento necesita dinero para invertirlo en ropa para el negocio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar blusas, ropa interior, camisas, la compra le permitirá aumentar la mercadería para ofrecer a los clientes.
Su propósito es fortalecer el negocio, atender bien a los clientes y mantenerse de sus ganancias cubriendo sus gastos más importantes.
texts.en:
Hada is a clothing merchant and she lives along. She started out her business following an influence by a friend. She works itinerantly in the surrounding areas of the municipal market. She currently needs money to invest in clothing for her business.

She requests a loan to purchase blouses, undergarments, and shirts. It will help her increase the merchandise she can offer her clients. 

Her goal is to strengthen her business, to provide her clients with a good level of service, and to support herself with her profits, covering her most important expenses.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, undergarments, and shirts for her business.

loans.name: Erick Tomas Antonio

texts.es:
Erick, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, ellos estudian solamente Erick trabaja en la familia, dedicándose a la agricultura y ganadería, inicio cuando era muy joven al lado de su padre quien siempre fue agricultor, en la actualidad este oficio es el que le da lo necesario para alimentar y vestir a su familia, no tiene un horario fijo pero si posee mucha experiencia.
Él solicita un préstamo para adquirir insumos agrícolas para la siembra de maíz, como fertilizantes y abono que son muy necesarios para el sano desarrollo y fortalecimiento del cultivo.
Tiene el objetivo de cuidar bien la siembra, con la esperanza de tener cosechas abundantes y al mismo tiempo quiere que su familia se logre superar.
texts.en:
Erick lives with his wife and their three children. They are in school and Erick is the only one in the family who works. He is an agriculturist and a livestock farmer. He started out when he was very young alongside his father, a life-long agriculturist. Today this business is what provides him with what he needs to feed and dress his family. He doesn't have a fixed schedule but he has a great deal of experience.

He requests a loan to acquire agricultural materials to cultivate corn, such as fertilizers and manure. These products are very necessary for the healthy development and strengthening of his cultivation.

His objective is to properly care for his plantation with the hopes of having an abundant harvest and at the same time he also wants his family to press forward.

loans.use: to purchase fertillizers and manure for his corn cultivation.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther es natural de Chupaca, en la actualidad vive con sus hijos en su propia casa. Trabaja duramente año tras año en las tareas del campo, esta tradición de trabajo la lleva desde su niñez porque sus padres la instruyeron con la mentalidad de esforzarse para conseguir las metas que se le presenten en su vida, por lo que no fue obstáculo para ella desarrollar esta actividad a pesar de no contar con el apoyo de familiares para contratar peones y poder realizar los trabajos pesados. Los productos que cultiva son el maíz, que con ayuda de sus hijos los seca en el patio de su casa y desgrana para venderlo por kilos a un mejor precio y así obtener mayores ganancias. Uno de sus metas es mejorar su producción y con el tiempo tener un establo ganadero donde tenga vacas lecheras. Pero, mientras esta en camino a concretar este proyecto, seguirá esforzándose para conseguir las ganancias necesarias. Son varias oportunidades que ha trabajado con MFP en créditos de manera grupal de las cuales se retiro por un tiempo pero en la actualidad retoma el trabajo grupal de manera solidaria porque considera que es positivo trabajar con personas que son de su confianza. Con el dinero comprará sacos de abono para seguir sembrando.
texts.en:
Esther is from Chupaca.  She currently lives with her children in her own home.  She works hard, year after year, farming.  She has had this work ethic since she was a child because her parents instilled in her the mentality to work hard in order reach the goals that present themselves in life.  For this reason, she managed to carry out her work in spite of the fact that she didn't have the support of family members to hire farm workers to help carry out the heavy labor.  

Esther grows corn which, with the help of her children, she dries in a patio area outside her home and removes the kernels.  She then sells these by the kilo for a better price and makes more profits.  One of her goals is to improve her production and, over time, own a stable where she will keep dairy cows.  Whilst she is working on establishing that project, she continues working hard to make the profits she needs.

Esther has worked with MFP on several occasions, taking group loans.  She stopped doing that for a time but is currently going back to working as part of a community bank because she believes it to be a positive experience working with people she trusts.  She will use this money to buy sacks of manure so that she can continue growing her crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es:
Patricio forma parte del banco comunal “Brisas Marinas”, perteneciente a la comuna de Calbuco, ciudad de Puerto Montt.
El se dedica al rubro del comercio, vendiendo ropa nueva exclusivamente para niños y niñas. La temporada de más alta demanda en su negocio es durante el mes de abril hasta el mes de septiembre. Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago una vez al mes. Patricio ofrece sus productos por internet, a través de las conocidas páginas sociales. Sus clientes frecuentes son aproximadamente 20 a 30 personas, ellos solicitan y compran sus productos en su mismo domicilio.
Con el crédito comprará poleras manga larga y polerones para niños.
Su meta es instalar su negocio en un local establecido, además de ser reconocido en el rubro y poder brindarles a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos.
Patricio vive junto a su esposa, su hija de 6 años de edad y sus suegros. 
Las motivaciones de continuar con su negocio son para brindarle a su familia una calidad de vida más confortable.
Patricio está muy agradecido del apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza, además comenta que el grupo del banco comunal al cual pertenece es muy unido y solidario. 
Calbuco, es una comuna ubicada al sur de Chile, en la región de Los Lagos. Su  origen etimológico es del mapudungun (lengua mapuche) y significa "aguas azules". Es un archipiélago conformado por 12  islas. Su economía está basada fundamentalmente en la extracción de los productos del mar. En la actualidad existen numerosas fábricas de conservas, centros de cultivos de salmones, ostras, choros etc.
texts.en:
Patricio is a member of the "Brisas Marinas" (Sea Breezes) community bank which is located in Calbuco, in the city of Puerto Montt.

Patricio is a salesman who sells new clothes for boys and girls.  The peak season for his business is from the month of April through the month of September.  He buys his merchandise in the city of Santiago once a month.  He sells his products through the Internet, through well-known social pages.  He has approximately 20 to 30 regular customers who request and buy his products from their own home.

Patricio will use his loan to buy children's long sleeve t-shirts and hoodies.  His goals are to set up his business in established premises, to become well known in his field and to be able to provide his customers with a better range of products.

Patricio lives together with his wife, his 6 year-old daughter, and his in-laws.  His motivation to keep working in his business is the desire to provide his family with a more comfortable quality of life.

Patricio is very grateful for the support he has been offered by Fondo Esperanza.  He comments that the community bank he belongs to is very united and supportive.

Calbuco is a town which is located in the south of Chile, in the Los Lagos region.  The etymological origin of the name comes from Mapudungan (the langugage of the Mapuche).  It means 'blue waters'.  This is an archipelago which is made up of 12 islands.  Its economy is mainly based on extracting products from the sea.  There are currently many canning factories and also salmon, oyster and mussel farms.

loans.use: to buy children's long sleeve t-shirts and hoodies

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix tiene 58 años, vive en compañía de su esposa en su casa que es propia. Desde que nació Félix ha vivido en la provincia de Chupaca, ahí se dedica a trabajar la tierra que le fue heredado por sus progenitores. Ha vivido más de 40 años viviendo y cuidando de su campo y cuando decidió formar su familia se convirtió en ser el sostén de 9 hijos y que hoy son personas de bien. Trabaja con toda la energía en compañía de su esposa, en épocas de siembra  trabajan con la ayuda de  2 toros que posee para arar la tierra, de esta manera logra tener una buena cosecha y del que luego son vendidas en el mercado de su zona. Ahora lo que más desea Félix es ser un buen agricultor. Considera que es de suma importancia trabajar con MFP porque piensa que es necesario tener capital para invertir en cada campaña de siembra y de cosecha las cuales ha asumido con gran éxito durante estos años. Con el dinero comprará más sacos de abono orgánico para preparar sus terrenos de cultivo para la siembra.
texts.en:
Félix is 58 years old and lives with his wife in their own home.  He has lived in Chupaca province since he was born and works the land he inherited from his parents.  For more than 40 years, he has been caring for and living off his land and, when he decided to start a family, it became a source of support for nine children who are all now upstanding citizens. 

Félix works with all his energy, alongside his wife.  During sowing seasons, they plow their land with the help of two bulls that they own. In this way, Félix manages to obtain a good harvest which he then sells in the market in his area.  What Félix wants most of all is to be a good farmer.  He believes it is incredibly important to work with MFP because it is necessary to have capital to invest in each sowing and harvest season.  He has managed each of these seasons with great success over the years.  Félix will use the money he has requested to buy more sacks of organic manure so that he can prepare his farmland for sowing.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia forma parte del banco comunal “Brisas Marinas” perteneciente a la comuna de Calbuco, ciudad de Puerto Montt.
Ella se dedica a vender mariscos envasados, específicamente centollas, choritos, erizos, pulpos y locos. Claudia ha llegado a vender 100 kilos cada semana. Ella cuenta con una pesa y una congeladora para mantener en buen estado sus productos. 
Claudia trabaja junto a su hermana y cuñado, como un negocio familiar, compran los mariscos todos los días directamente a lanchas. En su hogar se dedica a desconchar los mariscos, para esto utiliza fuentes de acero inoxidable y guantes. Sus productos los vende directamente desde su casa y también los ofrece en ferias libres.
Ella se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 3 años.
Con el crédito comprará tachos de acero inoxidable para cocer la centolla, fuentes de acero inoxidable, potes de plástico de ½ kilo y 1 kilo y una pesa.
Sus metas en su negocio son tener una cocina industrial y poder instalar su negocio en un local establecido con el permiso correspondiente de salubridad, ya que éste le permitirá vender sus productos a diferentes restaurantes en la ciudad de Santiago.
Claudia vive junto a sus hijos de 8 años y 2 años de edad, su hermana, su cuñado y su sobrino. Su sueño es que sus hijos reciban una buena calidad en su educación algún día sus hijos sean profesionales.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito recibido por Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha sido más accesible. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo del banco comunal al cual pertenece, ya que disfruta de las reuniones y organiza las actividades realizadas puesto que es presidenta del grupo. Respecto a las capacitaciones ha aprendido a registrar sus gastos e ingresos, por lo que su negocio también está más organizado. 
Calbuco, es una comuna ubicada al sur de Chile, en la región de Los Lagos. Su  origen etimológico es del mapudungun (lengua mapuche) y significa "aguas azules". Es un archipiélago conformado por 12  islas. Su economía está basada fundamentalmente en la extracción de los productos del mar. En la actualidad existen numerosas fábricas de conservas, centros de cultivos de salmones, ostras, choros etc.
texts.en:
Claudia is a member of the communal bank "Brisas Marinas", meaning "Ocean Breezes". It belongs to the community of Calbuco in the city of Puerto Montt.

She sells canned seafood, especially crabs, mussels, sea urchins, octopus, and clams. Claudia has come to sell 100 kilograms every week. She has a scale and a freezer to keep her products fresh. 

Claudia works with her sister and her brother-in-law in a family-style business. They purchase the seafood every day directly from the fishermen. She sells the seafood in her house and to work she uses stainless steel tanks and gloves. She sells her products directly from her house and she also sells them at open fairs.

She has been in business for the past 3 years.

With the loan she will purchase stainless steel pots to cook the crabs, stainless steel tanks, plastic containers of 1/2 kilogram and 1 kilogram volume, and a scale.

Her goals for her business are to have an industrial stove and to install her business in a store space if her health permits. This will help her sell her products to various restaurants in the city of Santiago.

Claudia lives with her children, aged 8 and 2, with her sister, brother-in-law, and with a nephew. Her dream is to give her children a quality education so that they will have a career one day. 

She is very happy and thankful for the loan received by Fondo Esperanza (Kiva Field Partner), especially because it is more accessible. She also feels very comfortable with her communal bank group. She enjoys the meetings and she organizes their activities. She is the president of the group. With respect to the training, she has learned to register her expenses and her profits, helping her business to be better organized.

Calbuco is a community located in Chile's south, in the region of Los Lagos. Its etiological origin is Mapudungun (Mapuche language) and it means "blue waters". it is an archipelago made up of 12 islands. The economy is fundamentally based on the seafood industry. There are many canning companies in existence, and fish farms of salmon, oysters, and mussels, etc.

loans.use: to purchase stainless steel pots to cook the crabs, stainless steel tanks, plastic containers of 1/2 kilogram and 1 kilogram volume, and a scale.

loans.name: Unidos Para Vencer 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Zoraida is the coordinator of her group, Unidos para Vencer 2 & 3 (Unite to Win Group). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and two children. She enjoys doing beauty work, and that why she operates a nail center. After she studied and learned how to work with nails and specially artificial ones, to do manicures, pedicures, put on artificial nails, paint them into different designs, etc., she was moved to have her own business.

Zoraida is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She started her business after she finished studying, and with the products she bought to learn on, she started her business, about a year ago. She had to stop and will start again with this loan. She will invest the loan to buy  acrylic nails, brushes and enamels. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business, because she wants to improve it and recover the time she lost, when she stopped it. She is dreaming of having a successful beauty salon, and she will start buying the equipment, as soon as she can get more incoming funds. She says that her most important challenge is to raise her children and her favorite thing to do is the housework.

Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water. None of the water is potable.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her  artificial nail center.

loans.name: Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
“LAS HORMIGUITAS”  es un grupo nuevo que esta conformado  07 socias  todas viven en Ventanilla Callao  la Sra. Ofelia es la presidenta del grupo  y como tal espera desempeñar una buena labor, el negocio al cual ella se dedica es la venta D. ropa  como polos medias  y zapatillas, su trabajo lo maneja desD. su casa ofreciendo sus productos a sus vecinos, amigos ella trabaja a pedido y les ofrece facilidades D. pago a sus clientas con el producto D. su trabajo ha podido mejorar su casa la que quiere terminar muy pronto por que tiene en mente poner algunos cuartos  en alquiler  el  préstamo que EDAPROSPO le facilitara,  lo utilizara para comprar ropa D. invierno  que tiene mucha demanda en esta época D. invierno.

  * La Sra ofelia esta con polo naranja
texts.en:
"Las Hormiguitas", meaning "The Little Ants" is a new group and it is maD. up of 7 members, all of whom live in the city of Callao. Ofelia is the president of the group and as such she endeavors to do a good job. Her business is clothing sales, including polo shirts, tights, and ladies' shoes. She manages her business from her house, offering products to her neighbors and friends. She works by taking orders and she offers payment options to her clients. As a product of her work she has been able to improve her house. She wants to finish building it very soon because her plan is to rent out a few rooms. The loan from Edaprospo (Kiva Field Partner) will help her do that. She will use it to purchase winter clothing, especially because it is in high demand during this winter season.

** Ofelia is photographed wearing the orange shirt.

loans.use: to finish construction of rental rooms in her house.

loans.name: Katherine

texts.es:
Katherine forma parte del banco comunal “Brisas Marinas” perteneciente a la comuna de Calbuco, ciudad de Puerto Montt.
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de librería, servicios de fotocopiadora, artículos para computadores, artículos de aseo y juguetes, en un local que arrienda en el centro de la comuna. Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras en la cual venden productos de librería al por mayor. Realiza ventas durante todo el año, sin embargo durante el mes de junio las ventas son un poco más lentas, pero igual vende ya que sus clientes son frecuentes.
Con el crédito comprará mercadería para su negocio, específicamente artículos de aseo, útiles escolares y juguetes.
Sus metas en su negocio son comprar un vehículo para trasladar su mercadería, ya que cuando la compra traslada su mercadería en buses interurbanos.
Katherine vive junto a sus dos hijas de 11 y 5 años de edad. Sus sueños son brindarles una mejor situación socioeconómica y que tengan acceso a una buena calidad en su educación.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza, además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo del banco comunal al cual asiste, ya que ha compartido experiencias de trabajo por parte de los demás socios. 
Katherine ya había realizado cursos de capacitación en contabilidad básica y alfabetización, por lo cual ya contaba con ciertos conocimientos a favor de la organización de su negocio. 
Calbuco, es una comuna ubicada al sur de Chile, en la región de Los Lagos. Su  origen etimológico es del mapudungun (lengua mapuche) y significa "aguas azules". Es un archipiélago conformado por 12  islas. Su economía está basada fundamentalmente en la extracción de los productos del mar. En la actualidad existen numerosas fábricas de conservas, centros de cultivos de salmones, ostras, choros etc.
texts.en:
Katherine is a member of the communal bank "Brisas Marinas", meaning "Ocean Breezes". It belongs to the community of Calbuco in the city of Puerto Montt.

She sells office, computer, and cleaning supplies, and offers photocopy services. She also sells toys. she has a store that she rents in the centre of her community. She acquires her merchandise from distributors that sell office supplies in wholesale.

She makes sales throughout the entire year, although during the month of June the sales are a bit slower. But she still sells and she has frequent visits from her clients. with the loan she will purchase merchandise for her business, especially cleaning supplies, school supplies and toys.

Her goal for her business is to purchase car to transport her merchandise. Currently she makes her purchases she transports her merchandise using city busses.

Katherine lives with her two daughters, aged 11 and 5. Her dream is to provide them with a better socioeconomic situation and to have access to a good quality education. She is very happy and thankful for the support provided by Fondo Esperanza (Kiva Field Partner). She also feels very comfortable with her communal bank in which she participates, especially because she has been able to share work experiences with the other members.

Katherine already had taken a basic accounting and literacy course so she had certain knowledge which favored her business' organization.

Calbuco is a community located in Chile's south, in the region of Los Lagos. Its etiological origin is Mapudungun (Mapuche language) and it means "blue waters". it is an archipelago made up of 12 islands. The economy is fundamentally based on the seafood industry. There are many canning companies in existence, and fish farms of salmon, oysters, and mussels, etc.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store, specifically cleaning supplies, school supplies, and toys.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Héctor de 45 años, es un padre de familia que vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa que es propia. Trabaja desde hace varios años en la venta de leña que el mismo se encarga de trozar y repartirlo a sus clientes. Le toma casi todo el día en trozar la leña y lo hace con ayuda de su hijo mayor que siempre lo acompaña, de esta manera logra tener ingresos para su familia que le permite disfrutar a lado de ellos. Por otro lado posee un vehículo en donde lo alquila para así generarse más dinero. Para él son importantes estos trabajos ya que en años anteriores se vio obligado a trabajar lejos de su hogar para tener dinero y con el tiempo logró ahorrar lo necesario para tener estos negocios. Ahora su meta es mejorar sus ingresos aumentando su capital de trabajo. Son varias oportunidades de crédito de las que ha disfrutado y le ha servido para crecer en su capital de trabajo, por lo que trabajar con MFP le ha dado la oportunidad de hacerlo. Para esta ocasión el dinero le servirá para comprar más troncos y tener más leña para vender.
texts.en: Hector is 45 years old, the father of a family and he lives with his wife and two children in a house that is their own. He has been selling firewood for many years and he himself is in charge of cutting up the wood and distributing to his clients. He takes almost the entire day to chop the wood and he works with his oldest son, always by his side. This is how he earns an income for his family and it lets him enjoy life with them by his side. Concurrently, he also has a car that he rents to generate more income. For him these businesses are important. In previous years he was forced to work far from his home to earn an income but in time he managed to save enough to have these businesses. Now his goal is to improve his earnings and to increase his working capital. He has enjoyed various loan opportunities and it has helped him to increase his working capital and by working with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) has achieved his goal. This time, the funds will be used to purchase logs and to have more wood for sale.

loans.use: to purchase logs.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia es natural de Hualahoyo, siempre ha vivido allí y en la actualidad vive con sus 3 hijos y su anciana madre en la casa que heredó. Desde su niñez se ha criando en una familia agricultora y ganadera de las cuales aprendió todo lo necesario para cultivar sus terrenos donde siembra maíz, papa, arveja, habas entre otros y criar a sus animales en su establo. Tras la separación de su esposo, esta ha sido su forma de vida, permitiéndole tener los ingresos necesarios. Ella vive de la venta de leche que producen sus vacas así como la venta de papa y maíz en el mercado local de su ciudad. Sus hijos la ayudan en estas tareas agrícolas y gracias a esa unión es que hoy tiene como recompensa sus ganancias. Ahora sus planes es la de  incrementar la cantidad de animales y adquirir vacas de buena raza para que produzcan más litros de leche al día. Tiene muchos años  que viene trabajando con MFP de manera  grupal, de las cuales es una de las socias más activas y puntuales de su banco comunal que siempre  demuestra su compromiso ante su grupo. El dinero lo invertirá  en la compra de sacos de abono y semilla para su próxima campaña de siembra en donde cultivará maíz y papa.
texts.en: Antonia is originally from the city of Hualahoyo. She has always lived there and she lives with her 3 children and her elderly mother in a house which she inherited. Since she was a girl she grew up in an agricultural and farming family. She learned all that she needs to cultivate her fields where she plants corn, potatoes, peas, fava beans, and other products. She raises her livestock in a stable. Following the separation from her husband, this has been her way of life and it has given her all the income that she needs. She lives from the sales of the milk produced by her dairy cows and from the sale of potatoes and corn in the city's local market. Her children help her in the agricultural work and it is thanks to this team effort that she is awarded with her income. Today her plans are to increase the quantity of livestock and to acquire a good breed of cattle to produce more milk per day. She has been with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) for many years in a group setting. She is one of the most active and punctual members in her communal bank. She demonstrates her commitment to her group. The funds will be invested in the purchase of sacks of manure and seeds for her next sowing campaign. She will cultivate corn and potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase manure, and potato and corn seeds.

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es: Clorinda es una mujer muy trabajadora que siempre a impulsado el desarrollo de su familia, a sus 37 años vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa que es propia. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las labores agrícolas, en la actualidad esta es su principal fuente de ingreso, donde toda su familia vela cada día por los terrenos de cultivo que fertiliza. Aunque las labores del campo signifiquen un trabajo duro y arduo afirma que le gusta mucho esta labor porque le permite tener siempre disponible el alimento para su familia, aun así en tiempos difíciles el cultivo de hortalizas es lo más rentable que le genera, aunque también cultiva papa. Es por esta razón que  intensifica sus cultivos en producir mayor cantidad de  estos productos porque le ofrecen un buen precio por estos productos en el mercado de su localidad. En adelante desea adquirir más extensiones de terreno donde pueda seguir produciendo más papa y hortalizas. Es su octava vez que tiene un crédito con MFP de las cuales considera que fueron años de trabajo eficiente con su grupo solidario a pesar de las dificultades que atravesaron como equipo y le sirvió para fortalecerse y seguir trabajando de manera solidaria. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de guano de ave de corral para fertilizar la siembra de papa.
texts.en: Clorinda is a hardworking woman who has always driven the family's development. At her 37 years of age, she lives with her husband and their 3 children in a house of their own. Since her childhood she has worked in agriculture, and today it is her primary source of income. Her entire family works daily on the fertilizing their cultivation fields. Although agricultural work is hard and arduous work she says that she very much enjoys it because it helps her to always have food for her family, although there are still some difficult times. The harvesting of vegetables is the most profitable although she also cultivates potatoes. For this reason she intensifies her efforts to produce a greater yield of these products. She earns a good profit with these products in her community market. In the future she wants to acquire further extensions to her land where she will continue to produce potatoes and vegetables. It is the eighth time that she has a loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she considers that the years with her communal bank were efficiently invested despite the difficulties they faced as a group. It helped her to gain strength and to keep working in a unified manner. With the funds that she requests she will invest in the purchase of poultry manure to fertilizer her potato cultivation.

loans.use: to purchase poultry manure.

loans.name: Jovenes Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
"Jovenes Emprendedores" es un grupo nuevo que esta conformado  07 socias  todas viven en Ventanilla Callao  la Sra. Ofelia es la presidenta del grupo  y como tal espera desempeñar una buena labor, el negocio al cual ella se dedica es la venta de ropa  como polos medias  y zapatillas, su trabajo lo maneja desde su casa ofreciendo sus productos a sus vecinos, amigos ella trabaja a pedido y les ofrece facilidades de pago a sus clientas con el producto de su trabajo ha podido mejorar su casa la que quiere terminar muy pronto por que tiene en mente poner algunos cuartos  en alquiler,  el  préstamo que EDAPROSPO le facilitara lo utilizara para comprar ropa de invierno como chompas,casacas y panatlones, estas prendas tienen mucha demanda en esta epoca.  

   * Frank es el joven de la izquierda.
texts.en:
"Jovenes Emprendedores" is a new group and it is made up of 7 members, all of whom live in the city of Callao. Ofelia is the president of the group and as such she endeavors to do a good job. Her business is clothing sales, including polo shirts, tights, and ladies' shoes. She manages her business from her house, offering products to her neighbors and friends. She works by taking orders and she offers payment options to her clients. As a product of her work she has been able to improve her house. She wants to finish building it very soon because her plan is to rent out a few rooms. The loan from Edaprospo (Kiva Field Partner) will help to purchase winter clothing, especially because it is in high demand during this season.

** Frank is the young man in the left.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase general grocery store merchandise

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es: A sus 34 años Rosalinda trabaja duramente al lado de su esposo. Tiene 3 hijos y juntos viven en su casa que es propia. Tiene su fabrica de ladrillos y tejas desde hace 6 años, actividad que realiza en  terrenos que alquila. Asegurándose de obtener tierra arcillosa, que es la materia  prima básica  en la fabricación de ladrillos, asimismo se abastece de materiales indispensables para la elaboración de las mismas como es el caso de la arena y aserrín. Es así que  siempre trabaja   todo el día para aumentar su producción, las mejores épocas de rentabilidad es cuando es verano y en cambio en invierno no. Toda su familia participa en este trabajo y  también contratan mano de obra para seguir fortaleciendo la producción en este negocio familiar. Considera que su actividad es rentable y le agrada a pesar de que es muy trabajoso porque le genera rentas  suficientes para mejorar su economía.  Tiene planes de incrementar la extensión de su fábrica  para tener mayor producción. Tiene varios años trabajando con MFP de manera grupal y recuerda el momento en que fue invitada por una de sus vecinas para trabajar de manera solidaria en crédito grupales. En la actualidad su grupo ha reducido la cantidad de miembros pero a su vez es un grupo sólido y confiable. Con el dinero lo invertirá en la compra de insumos necesarios para la fabricación como ramadas de madera, arena  y aserrín.
texts.en: At her 34 years of age, Rosalinda works hard alongside her husband. She has 3 children and together they live in their own home. She has had a brick and shingle factory for the past 6 years. It is a business that she has on rented land. She always makes sure to have clay-rich soil, the basic material used in the making of bricks, and to supply herself with other essential materials, such as sand and sawdust. She always works all day long to increase production. The best and most profitable season is the summer, and winter, on the other hand, is not. All of her family participates in the business and they also hire help to keep strengthening the production of their family business. She considers her business to be profitable and she likes the work, despite it being so labor intensive. It generates enough income to improve her finances. She has plans to increase the size of her factory to increase production. She has been with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) for many years in a group setting. She remembers the moment when she was invited by a neighbor to join the group and participate in the group loan. Their group has diminished in the number of members but the group remains strong and trustworthy. She will invest the funds in the purchase of necessary materials for production, including wooden plants, sand, and sawdust.

loans.use: to purchase wood, sand, and sawdust.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a farmer and grows vegetables such as squash, eggplant and other green and leafy vegetables to earn a living. Juanita is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Juanita has been in her business for one year. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer for her plantation.

Juanita has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Juanita hopes to have good living conditions and a bigger savings deposit for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Felipina

texts.en:
Felipina is married and has two children. She is 65 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Felipina is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 11 years. She has requested a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase more feed for her pigs. 

Felipina has been a member of PMPC for 14 years.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en: Valentina is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. Valentina is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Valentina has been in her business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 25,000 to purchase feed for her pigs. Valentina has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Valentina hopes to save for her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma, 38 years old and a resident of Lopez Jaena, is married and has two children. For the past five years, Alma has been selling snacks to earn a living.  A member of PMPC for three years, she is now requesting a loan of 20000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a farmer and raises cows and a goat to earn a living. She has been doing this for 8 years. Erlinda is married with five children. She is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. Erlinda has requested a loan for 30,000. She has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Erlinda hopes to use the extra income from her business for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her cows and goat.

loans.name: Yort

texts.en:
Yort, 54 years old, is a housewife. She is a single mother with three children: one is a student and the other two are working at a beer factory making $10 each per day. She has to spend $66 on food, $15 on school fees and $6 on other expenses. Since her husband passed away, she has had to take care of the children by herself and support them through school. 

Yort would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a plot of land in Phnom Penh. Certainly, the land in Phnom Penh is very expensive but she already has some money saved. She needs some more money to complete the purchase. Her children are responsible for the payment of this loan. In the future, she expects to get her own career which can support her and the children. She will only send her last child to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land in Phnom Penh.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is married with three children. Elma is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. Elma is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 11 years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase feed for her pigs. 

Elma has been a member of PMPC for 14 years. In the future, Elma hopes to save the money from this business to support the family's future needs.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Sepiphose

texts.en: Sepiphose is 54 years old and sells clothing. Her husband is a chief of construction workers and their income is $7 per day. They have four children. One child is studying and the other three sell food in front of her house in the village. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $18 on school fees, and $14 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy cement and steel for her husband for doing construction because he is a chief of construction workers and he has to buy building materials for his customers before they pay him. Her husband wants to expand his business because he can make a good income from it.

loans.use: To buy cement and steel

loans.name: Odelia

texts.en: Odelia is married with three children. Odelia is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. Odelia is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for    years. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase feed for her pigs. Odelia has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Then

texts.en: Then, 48 years old, is a palm sugar seller with $4 per day for her income. She is a single mother who lives with one mother and one daughter. Her daughter is working in the factory as a garment worker for $4 per day. Every month, she has to spend around $50 on other expenses for the family. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike and buy a stock of rice to sell. She hopes to make more income so that she will be able to help her daughter start a small tailoring shop at home to make more income and be able to pay loan off quickly.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and a stock of rice to sell

loans.name: Ra

texts.en: Ra, 49 years old, is a farmer. Her husband is a fisherman and their income is $4.50 per day. They have six children. Four of the children are studying, one is working in the factory and one helps his farther to fish. Every month, she has to spend $55 on food, $10 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her daughter to travel to work. She plans to buy another bigger boat for her husband when she can save enough money. For the rest of her children who are studying, she will try to support them to finish at least high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her daughter

loans.name: Unurtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Unurtsetseg is 52 years old, widowed and lives with her two sons in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. Her younger son is a truck operator for an ore mine and her other son has graduated the university this year, but he is unemployed now. 

During 1975-2003, she worked in the state's meat-processing plant in her native city. Now, she has been a worker of a meat or gut exporting company since 2003. By the way, she is a responsible worker who has gained much experience from the long duration of her previous employment. Currently, her income is the main living source of this family. Absolutely it’s not enough and it's difficult to raise her children. Therefore, she wants to buy a car for her older son to run a taxi service and then increase the family income. The loan Mrs. Unurtsetseg is taking will be devoted to purchasing a car for a taxi business and then to increasing their family living source with the profits.

loans.use: To purchase a car to start a taxi business

loans.name: Judilyn

texts.en:
Judilyn is 38 years old and married with four school-aged children. She has a general store in the community where she sells a variety of different products. She's been in business for four years, and she is earning a net income of 4,000 PHP monthly.

Judilyn is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase noodles, coffee, sugar, soft drinks and some seasonings to sell from her store.

In the future, Judilyn hopes that her business will expand into a big grocery store with greater profits in order to provide for the needs of her family. She also really wants to put her children through school so that they can find stable jobs someday.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, coffee, sugar, soft drinks and some seasonings to sell from her store.

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.en:
Cayetana is a 57-year-old married woman with three children. She has been raising hogs for four years. She plans to use her loan to buy piglets, feed and vitamins.

Cayetana works hard to improve her business. She said that despite hindrances like her arthritis, she supports her husband in providing for their household needs and sending their children to school.

Cayetana hopes for her family to be healthy and happy always. She also wishes for her children to finish college and be successful.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny, 31 years old, is married and has four children: fourteen, twelve, eight and two years old; three go to school. Every month she spends $80 on food, $40 on school fees and $10 on other expenses.

Ny has a motorbike sticker shop with her husband from which they earn $18 a day. She sells her merchandise from home. Ny is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy motorbike stickers and stamps to decorate customers’ motorbikes.

Ny wants to extend her shop and sell at the local market so that she can get more customers. She wants to send her children at least through high school.

loans.use: to buy motorbike stickers and stamps.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en: Charito is 40 years old, a married woman with five children. The oldest child is 19 years old while the youngest is only 6. They live in the town of Baclayon, Bohol. Charito is into a Buy & Sell business. She buys dried fish from Manga District, which is about 15 kilometers away from her town. She says she has some regular customers already in her town. Charito is also a Natasha (a direct sales company) dealer. She also makes benignet (sweet rice flour balls in coconut milk) that she sells at the elementary school in her town. She said benignet is popular especially during rainy seasons. Charito has requested a loan to buy more dried fish and raw ingredients for making benignet such as flour and sugar. She hopes to prosper in her ventures and be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish and raw ingredients for making benignet such as flour and sugar.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en: Charlyn is a married woman from the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She is 31 years old and has a 7-year-old child. Charlyn runs a tailoring business from home. She makes school uniforms and provides general alterations. She has had her business for 10 years now. She plans to use her loan to buy cloth, thread and other materials she needs for her business. She hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread and other materials.

loans.name: Juvie

texts.en: Juvie, 33 years old and a resident of Lopez Jaenais, is married and has four children. For the past two years Juvie has been selling a variety of products in her general store to earn a living, realizing a PHP 3000 profit each month. A member of PMPC for two years, she has requested a loan of 20000 to purchase more goods for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her general store.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is married and is 49 years old. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of different products in her community. Estrella has had this business for seven years and she earns about 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) monthly. 

Estrella is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional retail items such as soft drinks, instant noodles and canned goods to increase the capacity for sales from her business. In the future, Estrella hopes that her retail business will grow more in order to acquire more customers; thus, gain more income. She also dreams of saving more funds from the income that she will generate to lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as soft drinks, instant noodles and canned goods.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos Alberto de treinta y dos años de edad vive con su compañera de vida. El posee una venta de juguetes, películas y otros artículos; tiene su negocio en un lugar muy concurrido de personas a la orilla de una calle por la zona donde reside. Se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues tiene productos de buena calidad, a un buen precio Carlos es un hombre emprendedor que siempre busca superarse a través del trabajo arduo que realiza esta dispuesto a superar todos los obstáculos que se le presenten por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más productos como juguetes, películas, entre otros artículos varios, con esto lograra satisfacer la necesidad de la clientela y al mismo tiempo podre darle a su familia una vida plena con una seguridad económica en el hogar.
texts.en: Carlos Alberto is thirty-two years old and he lives with his life partner. He has a store from where he sells toys, movies, and other articles. His store is located in a well known location, on the side of the street in the region where he lives. He has earned himself many clients given that he has good quality products and that he gives good prices. Carlos is an enterprising many who is always in search of ways to improve himself through hard work. He is ready to overcome any obstacles that may present themselves. He decided to request a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) which will help him purchase more products, such as toys, movies, and other various articles. Through this he will satisfy the needs of his clients and in turn, he will also be able to provide his family with a full life through a stable household economy.

loans.use: to purchase toys, movies, and other various articles.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 45 years old and lives in Lopez Jaena. She is married with 3 children. 
Lourdes works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan for 25,000 to purchase more fish to sell. 
Lourdes has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
53-year-old Corazon is an entrepreneur from the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She buys fruits and vegetables like pineapples, melons and eggplants in the town of Carmen, about an hour away from her town. She also owns land there where she grows rice crops and fruits. She sells her products at her town's market.
