Corazon has requested a loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. She hopes for her business to grow and to be able to support her parents and her niece's studies.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nuria Elizabeth

texts.es: Nuria Elizabeth de treinta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una tienda que le ayuda a solventar los gastos de su hogar; Nuria es una excelente vendedora y les da buen servicio a las personas que buscan su negocio, últimamente se ha hecho demás clientela pues los productos que vende son de muy buena calidad y a un precio accesible, ella siempre se encuentra adelante de la competencia pues es una mujer muy activa y con ganas de salir adelante, Nuria piensa que el mejor secreto en su trabajo es amar lo que hace sin darse por vencida es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mas mercadería como golosinas, especies, granos básicos, jabón, bebidas, embutidos, entre otros así podrá seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de su clientela. Nuria tiene la confianza de que su esfuerzo le permitirá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Nuria Elizabeth is thirty-seven years old and she lives together with her life partner and their three children, in a house of their own. She has a store and it helps her to cover the household expenses. Nuria is an excellent salesperson and she provides good customer service to individuals who patronize her business. Lately her clientele has grown, given that the products she sells are of very high quality and they are sold at an accessible price. She always finds herself ahead of the competition because she is a very active woman who is eager to get ahead. Nuria thinks that the key to her business is to love what she does without every giving up. She requests a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner). It will help her purchase more merchandise such as snacks, spices, basic grains, soaps, drinks, sausages, and other products to be able to keep satisfying the needs of her clients. Nuria trusts that her efforts will help her provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, spices, basic grains, soaps, drinks, and sausages.

loans.name: Raúl Sifredo

texts.es: Raúl Sifredo de cincuenta y dos años de edad vive con su compañera de vida en una localidad de escasos recursos. El tiene un taller de estructura metálica el cual le ayuda a sostener el hogar; tienen mucha clientela pues el trabajo que realiza es de muy buena calidad y le da precios accesibles a las personas que lo visitan; su último trabajo es la fabricación de unas puertas y necesita material para realizarlas. Raúl es un hombre trabajador con muchas metas a futuro  y quiere algo diferente para su vida es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima Metal para poder terminar su trabajo. Raúl Sifredo tiene la esperanza que de esta forma le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Raul Sifredo is fifty-two years old and he lives with his life partner in a low-income community. He has a metal shop which helps him to support his household. He has many clients especially because the work that he does is very high in quality and his prices are accessible to those who visit him. His last project was to make some doors and he needs materials to complete the project. Raul is a hardworking man who has many goals for the future. He wants something different for his life and it is the reason why he requests a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner). It will help him purchase metals to be able to complete his project. Raul Sifredo hopes that he will be able to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase metal in wholesale.

loans.name: Vilma Yaneth

texts.es: Vilma Yaneth D. treinta y siete años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una tortillería en el lugar donD. resiD., el lugar es muy humilD. pero muy higiénico para el trabajo, se ha hecho D. mucha clientela pues sus tortillas son muy ricas, D. buena calidad. Vilma siempre está adelante D. la competencia siempre tiene lo que el cliente necesita; ella piensa que hay que valorar todo lo que se anhela y se tiene;  quiere ver crecer el negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor para seguir vendiendo el producto. Vilma Yaneth tiene la confianza que su trabajo le ayudara a llevar seguridad económica al hogar y a ofrecerle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en: Vilma Yaneth is thirty-seven years old and she lives with her life partner and their children in a house of their own. She has a tortilla factory in her house. The place is very humble but hygienic for her work. She has earned many clients especially because her tortillas are very delicious and of good quality. Vilma is always ahead of the competitions because she always has what the client needs. She thinks that one must value everything that we long for and everything that we have. She wants to make her business grow and for this reason she requests a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner). It will help her purchase corn in wholesale to be able to keep selling her products. Vilma Yaneth is confident that her work will help her bring financial security to her household and to proviD. a better life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn in wholesale.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita works in the fish industry, selling fish for a living. She has been doing this for 8 years. Lolita is 51 years old and lives in Lopez Jaena. She is married with three children. Lolita has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Sefhora Ester

texts.es: Sefhora Ester D. cuarenta y ocho años D. edad vive junto a su compañero D. vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee un comedor el cual es muy visitado por las personas del lugar pues Sefhora se ha hecho D. mucha fama por sus ricos platillos y por la calidad D. su comida además tienen los mejores precios del lugar y su puesto D. trabajo siempre lo  mantienen muy aseado. Ella es muy trabajadora y quiere ver crecer su negocio y hará lo posible por no desistir D. su sueño es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar material como granos básicos, carnes, embutidos, lácteos, plátanos, bebidas, verduras, entre otros para seguir haciendo los exquisitos platillos. Sefhora tiene fe que con su dedicación en el trabajo podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida mejor para su familia.
texts.en: Sefhora Ester is forty-eight years old and she lives with her life partner and their children in a house of their own. She has a restaurant which is highly visited by people from their community. Sefhora has maD. a name for herself through her delicious recipes and for the quality of her foods. She also offers the best prices in their community and her area is always very clean. She is a very hardworking woman and she wants to see her business grown. She will do what is possible and she will not desist from her dream. She requests a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) and it will permit her to purchase ingredients such as basic grains, meats, sausages, dairy products, bananas, drinks, vegetables, and others to keep making her delicious meals. Sefhora has faith that through her dedication to her work she will be able to proviD. her household with financial security and a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, meats, sausages, dairy products, bananas, drinks, and vegetables.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: Ramón de treinta años de edad vive con su esposa e hijos en casa propia. El posee una Panadería muy conocida en la localidad donde reside, por el rico sabor de los panes y por sus buenos precios; vende de todo tipo de pan dulce: semita, salpores, pastelitos de piña, etc., la clientela siempre está satisfecha porque encuentran lo que necesitan y les dan un servicio excelente. Ramón piensa que la confianza en sí mismo es lo que lo llevara tener un futuro mejor es por   eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima y utensilios, para la elaboración de su rico pan, como: harina, azúcar, levadura, bandejas entre otros. Ramón tiene fe que con su duro trabajo lograra darle a su familia seguridad económica y una vida mejor.
texts.en: Ramon is thirty years old and he lives with his wife and their children in a house of their own. He has a very well-known bakery in the community where he lives. It is known for the delicious breeds and for the good prices. He sells all types of pastries: sweet buns, cookies, pineapple pastries, etc. His clientele is always satisfied because they always find what they need and he gives them excellent customer service. Ramon thinks that by believing in himself he will be able to have a better future. He requests a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) and it will help him to purchase ingredients and utensils to make delicious breads, including: flour, sugar, yeast, pans, and other products. Ramon believes that through his hard work he will be able to give his family with financial security and a better life.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, yeast, and pans.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a farmer and she sells coconut fruit to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. Roselyn is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Roselyn has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos to purchase more coconut for her coconut fruit business.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut fruit for her coconut business.

loans.name: Ema Peregrina

texts.en:
Ema Peregrina is a married woman with six children. She is 54 years old and has had a sari-sari store business for 30 years.

Ema Peregrina sells items like soft drinks and canned goods to the people in her community. She also provides mobile phone prepaid loads. She is also a Personal Collection (a direct sales company) dealer. She sells items like lotion, shampoo and fabric conditioner. She earns about 10,000 PHP per month from the store and selling Personal Collection products.

Ema Peregrina is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy prepaid load credits and more items to sell such as soft drinks, noodles and canned goods. She hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy prepaid load credits, soft drinks, noodles and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny, age 38, has been living in the province of Siem Reap. To make a living, she and her husband both work as firewood sellers in and around their community. They always buy firewood in bulk from their wholesale suppliers at a low price and then they sell the firewood to gain a net income. From this, the couple can earn about $6 per day to support their family expenses. Besides their current job, they have been planting rice crops as an annual activity. Mrs. Ny is requesting a Kiva loan to buy two cows to assist her on the farm, as her old cow doesn’t support her during the plowing process. Mrs. Ny is blessed with four single children. A few of the children help her sell firewood.

loans.use: to buy two cows to use on her farm

loans.name: Carmen De María

texts.es: Carmen D. María D. cuarenta y dos años vive con su compañero D. vida y sus cinco hijos. Ella fabrica y venD. canastos a base D. vara D. bambú, trabaja arduo todos los días desD. muy temprano para elaborar y poder salir a vender también, ya posee mucha clientela pues su producto es D. muy buena calidad y los da a precios accesibles. Carmen tiene un don su trabajo es inigualable y digno D. admirar, está dispuesta a ver crecer su negocio y enfrentara todo los obstáculos es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima por mayor como vara D. bambú para seguir fabricando canastos y satisfacer las necesidades D. sus clientes. Carmen D. María tiene la confianza que su esfuerzo en el trabajo le ayudara a darle a su familia seguridad económica y una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Carmen D. Maria is forty-two years old and she lives with her life partner and their five children. She makes and sells bamboo baskets. She works arduously every day from the very early morning to produce and to sell. She has many customers especially because her products are of very good quality and her prices are accessible. Carmen is gifted in her craft. It is incomparable and worthy of admiration. She is ready to see her business grown and to face any obstacles. She requests a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) and it will help her to purchase materials in wholesale, including bamboo stems, to keep making her baskets and to satisfy the needs of her clients. Carmen D. Maria believes that the efforts she invests in her business will help her proviD. her family with financial security and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo stems.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabric in wholesale.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 47 years old and married with one school-aged child. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products in the community. She has been doing this work for 12 years and she earns approximately PHP 3,000 monthly.

Juliana is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase soap, shampoo, instant noodles and canned goods to sell. She hopes that she can acquire more customers to gain more profit.

In the future, Juliana hopes that her business will expand to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy soap, toothpaste, shampoo, noodles and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Soknim

texts.en: Soknim, 27 year old, is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a construction worker and their income is $7.60 per day. They have one child who is two years old. Every month she has to spend $70 on food and $10 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $350 to buy construction equipment. Her husband needs some equipmens for his career. Otherwise, he cannot find customers because the other construction workers have better equipment. For the future, she hopes her husband's career runs well and he makes a good income so that it leads her family to live in better conditions.

loans.use: To buy construction equipment

loans.name: Keang

texts.en: Keang, 57 years old, is a fish seller. She is a single mother with three children: one is a student, one is worK. in a factory and one more is helping her sell fish at the market. Every month, she has to spend $100 on food, $10 on electricity, $10 on school fees and $30 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy more fish to sell. She hopes to get more income with her career so that she can save money to repair her house and send her youngest child to university.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch, 49 years old, sells food with her husband. Their income is $9 per day. They have 2 children: her daughter works in a factory and her son is a motor taxi driver. Every month, spends $100 on food, $20 on transportation, $10 on electricity and $30 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy construction material for repairing her house. Now is the rainy season and her house is leaking when it is rainy outside. She just wants to have a proper house to stay in with her family. She wants to extend her career when she can save enough money.

loans.use: to buy construction material for repairing the house.

loans.name: Zenah

texts.en:
Zenah is aged 25 and she is married. She has two school-aged children who attend school. She has a mixed farm in the town of Kitale, in western Kenya. On the farm, she produces milk, maize and beans. She has been in the farming business for 7 years now and employs two farmhands. She earns additional income from her own posho mill in the same location. 

Zenah has made a loan request of 60,000KES in order to purchase a motorcycle. She hopes that the extra cash she will get from this motorcycle transport business will help improve her family's living standards. In the future, she plans to specialize in dairy farming and will use the motorcycle to supply milk to the markets. She faces the challenge of unpredictable weather conditions, which affects her production.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is aged 53 and married. She has 7 children, two of whom are currently attending school. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 28 years in Kitale town, western Kenya. Her mixed farm produces maize, vegetables, eggs and milk, which are all sold locally. She earns additional income from her posho mill in the same location. 

Tabitha has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo, after successfully repaying her fifth loan of 100,000KES. She has made a loan request of 55,000KES in order to purchase additional stock of chickens and chicken feed. The extra income from this project will help to pay for the education of her children and to improve her family's livelihood. 

Her primary challenges have been poor weather conditions and diseases, which affects her production. In the future, she plans to buy a tractor to help improve her production.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Marilyn has a shop that sells candies, canned goods, breads & snacks. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy beverages, breads & canned goods. The picture shows Marilyn and her 2 daughters (one is inside the shop).

Marilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Marilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, breads & canned goods.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is married and has 4 children. She is 45 years old and lives in Plaridel.

Wilma sells to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3000 for doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 15000 to purchase more inventory for her general store.

Wilma has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beverages, canned goods & biscuits

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 32 years old, married and blessed with two children.  He operates a butchery to earn a living.  He also does dairy farming to generate more income for his family.  Francis says that he is a hardworking man and he is determined to open other butcheries in the future. Francis joined Faulu Kenya so that he could easily access financial resources.  He has also learned to manage his finances by saving his money.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy meat.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell

loans.name: Rodelia

texts.en: Rodelia is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Rodelia has a shop that sells canned goods, breads, biscuits & candies. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & breads. Rodelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rodelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & breads

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is married and has a one-year-old child. She lives in the town of Baclayon, Bohol with her family.

Imelda used to sell fish in her town, but now she sells soft drinks and mobile prepaid load cards to the people in her community. Some stores in her area buy cases of soft drinks from her.

Imelda plans to use her loan to buy more mobile prepaid load cards and soft drinks to sell. She hopes to prosper in her business and be able to save for her child's future.

loans.use: to buy more mobile prepaid load cards and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where he has been farming for six years now. His mixed farm produces milk, eggs and maize which are all sold at the local market. He earns additional income from his motorcycle transport business in the same region. He is age 36 and married with four children who all attend school.

Francis has made his third loan request through Juhudi Kilimo for 60,000 Kenyan shillings. He plans to use this loan to purchase additional stock of chicken and chicken feeds. The proceeds from the sale of eggs and chicken will help improve his family's livelihood. He faces the challenge of diseases which cause massive death of poultry and this has affected his production. He hopes that in the next five years, he will have increased his poultry to 500 and acquired at least three quality dairy cows.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of chicken and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 53 years old, married with three children and lives in the Philippines.

For the past ten years Lucresia has had a shop where she sells tasty dishes such as pancit bihon and chicken adobo. She also sell snacks and beverages.

Lucresia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 PHP to buy the ingredients to make her dishes to sell.

In the future, Lucresia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients to make her dishes to sell.

loans.name: Rosamie

texts.en: Rosamie is 21 years old and lives in Plaridel. She is married with two children. Rosamie works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. Rosamie has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Jocelyn has a shop that sells candies, snacks & biscuits. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & breads. Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & breads

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine has been practicing mixed farming for the last eight years in Kitale town in western Kenya. Her mixed farm produces eggs, vegetables, mangoes and tomatoes, which she sells at the local market. She earns additional income from her motorcycle transport business in the same location. She is 42 years old and married with three school-aged children who all attend school.

She has made a loan request of 60,000 KES to purchase additional stock of chickens. The extra income from this project will help improve her family's livelihood. She faces the challenges of diseases and insufficient poultry feed, which affects her production. She plans to acquire at least 1,000 chickens and an incubator in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase additional chickens.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en: Suzette has a shop that sells biscuits, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She is married, 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. Suzette has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She requested a loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos to buy snacks and beverages, and for the education of the children. In the future, Suzette hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks and beverages, and for the education of her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open another retail shop.

loans.name: Recsalde

texts.en: Recsalde is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. Recsalde provides motorela or habal-habal services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the service. Recsalde has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Recsalde hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for a motorela service.

loans.name: Junbert

texts.en: Junbert is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. He has been doing this for 3 years. Junbert is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has no children. Junbert has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. He has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to purchase feed for his pigs.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Teresita has a shop that sells breads, beverages and canned goods. She has had this business for five years. Teresita has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more products for her store.  For the future, she hopes to improve her business.

Teresita became a member of HSPFI this year.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is 36 years old.  She is married and with four children.  She runs a retail store to earn a living.  She works hard in her business to help pay for her children's education.  Being a member of Faulu Kenya, she has been trained on savings and business management.  This has helped her to grow her business hence improving her financial status.

Veronicah hopes to grow her business into wholesale in the future.  She has requested for 60 000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize flour, soda, sugar and rice.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, soda, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Airen

texts.en:
Airen is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. \

Airen has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. Airen has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more products for her shop.  

Airen became a member of HSPFI in 2011. In the future, Airen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy breads, canned goods and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay labor for farmland clearing

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon has a mixed farm in the outskirts of Kitale town in western Kenya that is currently producing maize and beans. He has been in the farming business for four years now and employs two farmhands. He earns additional income from his butchery shop, and is also managing his own pool and video center.

Simon has made his third loan request of 60,000 Kenyan shillings in order to purchase chicken and chicken feeds. The proceeds from this loan will help improve his family's living standards. He faces the challenge of a lack of enough capital to expand his farming activities, and this has made him not be able to enjoy the economies of scale. He plans to expand his poultry farm in the near future in order to start selling his poultry products on a large scale.

Simon is aged 26 and married with two children, one of whom is currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming tools and supplies

loans.name: Lun

texts.en: From Baray district of Kompong Tom Province, Mr. Lun is a 39-year-old man who has been spending most of his lifetime in the farming business. He and his wife always plant various crops to earn a living and typically generate an income of $8.75 per day. They have been married for many years and are blessed with two single children. One of the children assists them in the crop-planting business when they have time from their studies. Since the rainy season is coming, Mr. Lun will be using the loan that he requested to buy fertilizers and seed for planting. With the rest of the loan, he will buy some fish paste to stock up for future sales. Note: Mr. Lun, his wife and their young son were taken in a photo under their house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and fish paste

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 34 years old, married and has two children. She has been tailoring for 10 years. She works hard in her business so as to educate her children so that they can have a bright future.  

She is very thankful to Faulu Kenya because she has managed to expand her business.

Serah dreams of owning a boutique in the future. She has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy fabric for making clothes.

loans.use: To buy fabric for making clothes.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 46 years old and lives in Lopez Jaena. She is married with two children.  Lucy sells ripe mangoes. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more big and wide wicker baskets of mangoes for her mango retail business. Lucy has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.

loans.use: to purchase baskets of mangoes for her mango retail business

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en: Nestor is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. Nestor provides motorola or habal-habal (motor cycle taxi) services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the service. Nestor is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the utilities needed for the service

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, aged 42, is a farmer who is married with six children and two dependants. He lives in his own house in Kiryandongo, Uganda. David's goal is to educate his children to university level. He operates a wholesale shop and a bar, and has been doing business for four years now. 

David started with a small bar which has grown to a big bar and has also added a wholesale shop. He has a problem with power as it is always off thus forcing him on some days to close his business early. David wants to install solar power in future. The purpose of the loan facility is to purchase crates of sodas and beers to sell at his pub.

loans.use: To purchase crates of sodas and beers to sell at his pub.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Jocelyn has a retail shop that sells breads, biscuits and snacks. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, breads and beverages. Jocelyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, breads and beverages to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional poultry and poultry feed.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is currently in the business of selling food, like bread, biscuits, etc. and is requesting a loan to start a small business.  She is 40 years old and married. She has five children all of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to more smoothly meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to start a small business which sells food like bread, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina earns a living through making and selling polvoron. Polvoron is powdered milk candy, made of flour, sugar, butter and powdered milk. It is a famous sweet all over the Philippines. Josefina makes a bucket of polvoron daily. She makes packs of 25 and 90 pieces that she sells to store owners.

Josefina is requesting a loan of 16,000 PHP to purchase wrappers and raw ingredients such as flour and sugar for polvoron. She hopes for her business to be stable. She said that although her 24-year-old child is already married, she still wants to support her and someday her grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase wrappers and raw ingredients such as flour and sugar for polvoron

loans.name: St Theresa Girls Ss Credit Scheme Group

texts.en: Julius is a 29-year-old married man with two children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has operated a retail shop for two years which he started with 400,000 shillings and now has 1,000,000 shillings. His hardship is debtors and his low capital base and his vision is a wholesale business plus educating his children. Julius needs the loan to buy soap, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.use: To buy rice, soap and sugar to sell

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Trinidad has a retail shop that sells candies, biscuits, snacks and canned goods. She has had this business for five years. Trinidad has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy breads, canned goods and snacks.
Trinidad is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy breads, canned goods and snacks to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is 53 years old, married with four children aged 8 to 24 years living in her own house in Hoima, Uganda. For 10 years, she has been running a school which started with a nursery school but she now owns a primary school and from this she has been able to pay fees for her children. She faces the challenge of inadequate finance due to late payment of school dues by parents. For now, her school is in semi-permanent structures: she has the desire to build permanent structures in the future and to upgrade her school to secondary level. Catherine needs a loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 36 years old, married with two children.  He operates a barber shop to earn a living.  He has operated the business for 10 years and employs two people.  He says that he gets a good number of customers in a day.

Victor has benefited from Faulu Kenya because he has grown his business and managed to acquire some business assets.  He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy disinfectants and hair products.

loans.use: To buy disinfectants and hair products.

loans.name: Azizeh

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 51-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and one child. 

She has owned a clothes and shoes shop since 2008. She always presents the new trends and collections to her customers in order to satisfy their demands. She is well known in this type of business due to her extended experience in this field. 

She has already had her first Kiva loan and has been a very good client with prompt repayments. Today, she is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand her store's inventory. She notes that the diversity of her merchandise selection will help her attract more clients and therefore increase her sales. In the future, she is planning to add women's bags and accessories to her shop.

loans.use: to expand her store’s inventory

loans.name: Sichan

texts.en: Sichan, aged 36, is a motorcycle taxi driver with income of $7 per day. He lives with his parents and is not yet married. He is in charge of supporting his family because his brothers and sisters did not stay with his parents; they married and stay with their own families. He responds by paying all expenses of approximately $85 per month. He would like to request a loan of $400 to buy a new motorbike for his taxi service; his current motorbike is very old and needs a lot of repairs.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for his taxi service

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Emily has a retail shop that sells biscuits, canned goods, snacks and noodles. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Emily is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Sokmeng

texts.en: Sokmeng, aged 25, is an animal feeder. Her husband is a soldier; their income is $6 per day. She has one child and he is one year old. Every month, she has to spend $80 on food and $15 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a plot of land with a small house in which to stay. That property will cost more than she has borrowed; she already has some money but needs a bit more to complete the purchase. She wants to feed more animals to sell and to be able to save money to repair her house so it stays in better condition. In addition, she will work harder to send her child to study to at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land with a small house in which to stay

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Perla has a retail shop that sells breads, canned goods and biscuits. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, breads and beverages. Perla is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, breads and beverages to sell

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is aged 33 and married with two children, one of whom is currently attending school. He has a mixed farm in Kitale town that produces maize, milk, beans and eggs which are all sold locally. He has been in the farming business for seven years now and employs three farmhands. He earns additional income from his motorcycle transport business in the same town. 

Martin has requested a loan of 60,000 Kes to purchase additional stock of poultry. He plans to use the extra income from this project to improve his family's livelihood. His primary challenges have been diseases and fluctuation in the market prices of farm produce. He plans to expand his poultry farm in future.

He further comments that Juhudi loans cater for the low income farmers and this they do appreciate.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of poultry.

loans.name: Leonides

texts.en:
Leonides is 44 years old and is a married woman with three children aged 19, 16 and 8. Her oldest child is in college now. Her husband works as a fireman.

Leonides runs a tailoring business at her home. She has been making uniforms, providing alterations to clothing, and repairing torn fabrics for nine years. She usually earns 500 PHP per day from her business.

Leonides has requested a loan to purchase cloth, threads, needles, buttons and other tailoring materials. She hopes for her business to grow and to be able to send her two younger children to college.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, threads, needles, buttons and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus is 26 years old, married and has a three-year-old child who goes to school.  He has been operating a retail shop for five years and has employed two people.  He also does motorbike (bodaboda) transport business to earn a living. 
 
Onesmus testifies that he has improved his business through the seminars held by Faulu Kenya where he was trained in business management.  He has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, rice, baking powder and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, baking powder and maize flour.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is 35 years old has eight children. Four of them are getting their education while the youngest one has not started her education yet. Her eldest son has completed his graduation and started making boots. Her second and third sons also work with their eldest brother in making boots. 

In order to pay the education fees of her children, Allah Rakhi sews clothes for her neighboring clients and also sells clothes. She buys these clothes from the clothes markets and resells them to her local clients. The income she earns also enables her to pay her utility bills and other household expenses. 

Her husband operates a lathe machine. He is an expert at this work and has a good number of clients who trust in his work and give him good money for it. 

Allah Rakhi has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah because she wants to expand her business of selling clothes. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk that will allow her to offer more variety to her clients and also minimize her cost of purchasing and traveling. 

She has eight years of experience in her business and is confident that an investment will bring positive changes to it and improve the financial condition of her family.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is currently in the business of selling fruit, like tomatoes, pineapple, apples, etc. and is requesting a loan to expand her small business.  She is 35 years old and married. Lucy has five children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to more smoothly run her family.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is a married woman with four children. She is 57 years old and has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for nine years. 

Lita sells items like eggs, canned goods, shampoo and other daily use products to the people in her community. She plans to raise pigs in her backyard to augment her income. She wants to earn more and sustain her children's education.

Lita is requesting a loan of 16,000 PHP to buy piglets to rear and more items such as canned goods, vinegar, soy sauce and detergent soap to sell. She hopes to have a bigger store and be successful with her pig-raising business.

loans.use: to buy piglets to rear and items such as canned goods, vinegar, soy sauce and detergent soap to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet, a 41-year-old resident of Plaridel, is married and the mother of three children. For five years, she has sold fish to earn a living. A member of PMPC for four years, Janet  is requesting a loan for 5000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: A 43-year-old resident of  Plaridel, Mercedita is married and the mother of three children. For the past 23 years, Mercedita has worked in the fish industry selling fish for a living. A member of PMPC for 11 years, she has requested a loan for 5000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and three school-aged children. 

She has owned a candy shop since 1993. She sells large quantities of sweets, chocolates, etc, as well as baby clothes. She also works upon request of the clients who ask for special orders designed for exceptional events and occasions such as weddings, baby showers, etc. 

Today, she is asking to borrow $1300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to strengthen her business operation by increasing her store's inventory and adding shelves to better display her merchandise. This will be her second loan and she's certain that it will allow her to further develop her business.

loans.use: to strengthen her business operation by increasing her store’s inventory and adding shelves to better display her merchandise

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is 41 years old and has three children. All of them are young and stay at home. Parveen is unable to send them to school due to financial constraints. 

She is a housewife, staying at home and taking care of her household responsibilities. She is very active and performs her duties very well. Besides her housework, she also sews clothes for neighboring clients and is very skillful. She operates her business on part-time basis. 

Her husband operates a shop in the market from which he sells pan (betel leaves) and cigarettes. He offers good cigarette brands to his clients which earns him a reasonably good income. 

Parveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband's business. He will use it to purchase different brands of cigarettes; he also wants to buy drinks like Pepsi, Coca-Cola etc. to increase his sales. 

He has been operating his business for many years. Parveen is confident that her husband's business will be improved further after the loan is invested in it. 

She is a new loan applicant to Asasah and very hopeful about her family's bright future.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes & cold drinks

loans.name: Metodia

texts.en:
Metodia, a 61-year-old married woman from Baclayon, Bohol, has had a sari-sari store business for eight years. She sells items such as softdrinks, chips, sugar, shampoo and other daily-use products to the people in her community. She is also sometimes hired to cook for parties and other events.

Metodia is requesting a loan of 13000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as noodles, canned goods, sugar and soft drinks. She hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as noodles, canned goods, sugar and soft drinks.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel, a 27-year-old married father of one child who attends school, has a mixed farm in the town of Kitale that produces vegetables, onions and tomatoes. He earns additional income from his businesses of selling milk and operating his butchery shop in the same location.

Gabriel is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kes in order to purchase an additional stock of poultry. The extra income arising from this loan will help him improve his family's livelihood. Although he faces the challenges of diseases, insufficient poultry feeds and insufficient capital to expand his farming activities, he hopes that his poultry farm will have expanded in the next five years.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of poultry.

loans.name: Neema Kimara Group

texts.en:
In her late 20's, Rehema is married and has two children who are going to school. She has been running a grocery store for five years now, operating from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily, earning a good monthly profit.

This will be Rehema's fourth Motish loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. She used the previous loans to buy a cow and increase her grocery inventory, and has repaid all of her loans. Rehema hopes for a loan to pay school fees and increase her store inventory. Her dream is to one day build a rental house.

She will share this loan with her group "Neema Kimara," which has a total of 20 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase grocery inventory and pay school fees.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is quite known for cooking delicious food. She makes viands that she sells to the people in her community. She is also sometimes hired to cook for events and parties in her town. 

Natividad works hard to improve her business and earnings. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

She plans to use her loan to buy raw ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, vegetables and spices.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients such as pork and chicken meat, vegetables and spices.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
She is 28 years old and married. She has five children and her children go to school. 

She is currently in the business of selling fruit, like tomatoes, pineapples and apples. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her small business. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to smoothly run her family.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 42 years old and lives in Plaridel. She is married and has six children. 

Elvie works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for four years. 

Elvie has been a member of PMPC for six years. She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 38-year-old married man living with his wife and one school-aged child in Lebanon.  

He has owned a cattle farm in his town since 2006. He works independently in his business. His farm produces dairy products all sold to local customers and markets. His is the only income source of the family.  

Today, he is asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase fodder for his cattle so that he can ensure a good quality and quantity of milk. He aims to increase his business productivity and earn higher income in order to better support his family.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for his cattle

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, 51, is married and has four children. Two of them are in school.

Teresita is in the business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed six loans in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita is a married woman with three children. She is 54 years old and has had a sari-sari store business for 25 years.

Pedrita sells items like eggs, chips and soft drinks to the people in her community. She also cooks viands that she sells at her town's public school. She rents a stall there where she displays her cooked food. Pedrita earns about 8,000 PHP per month with her businesses.

Pedrita is requesting a loan of 16,000 PHP to buy more items to sell like noodles and canned goods and to buy raw ingredients such as meat and vegetables for viands.

In the future, Pedrita hopes to prosper in her business and be able to uplift her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like noodles and canned goods and to buy raw ingredients for viands such as meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Night

texts.en:
She is 22 years old and married. Her husband is a student. She has one child. 

She is currently in the business of selling fruit, like tomatoes, pineapples and apples and is requesting a loan to expand her small business.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her husband's university fee.

loans.use: to expand her small business.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 28 years old and lives in Lopez Jaena. She is married and has two children.
 
Mary Jean works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Mary Jean has been a member of PMPC for three years. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 36-year-old married man from Lebanon living with his wife and three young children who are still attending school. He started working in the construction field almost 15 years ago. He is specialized in completing wall-covering work. He also makes original wall designs and modern ones on the inside of the buildings. With his business income, he is hardly able to satisfy his family needs. So, today he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy additional tools and products for his work. He will also purchase wood to further expand his business and be able to earn superior income. In the future, he looks forward to working on bigger projects in his community.

loans.use: to buy additional tools and wood

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 64 years old and married. She has four children.

Cecelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested an PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items like sardines, groceries, etc., for her sari sari store.

Cecelia has been running the sari-sari store for 35 years and also earns an income from fish vending. She has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan.

Cecelia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Elfa

texts.en:
Elfa is 43 years old and married. She has one child. Elfa works very hard to provide for her family.

Elfa runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, chips, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Elfa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is 27 years old and is married. 

He sells shoes. He has a year of experience and he currently employs two people to help him. He works from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day except Saturday. 

Pascal has requested his first loan from Kiva partner via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more shoes for resale. With his profits, Pascal will reinvest in his business and save for his future.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for resale.

loans.name: Naziran's Group

texts.en:
Naziran is a midwife by profession. She provides her services to village women who don’t have access to doctors. Her husband operates a business  selling wheat and rice to afford the living expenses of his family. Naziran has given birth to three children. Two of the children are studying. Her middle daughter is illiterate and helps Naziran with her daily routine work. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy wheat and rice in bulk quantity that will allow him to fulfill his client's orders on time and earn more profits. He has been doing this business for the past 12 years and Naziran is hopeful that her husband will bring more profits from his business after the loan investment. 

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and very hopeful about her family’s better financial future.

loans.use: To buy wheat & rice to sell

loans.name: Cristelene

texts.en:
Cristelene is 36 years old, married and has two children who are in school.

Cristelene is in the business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 12 years now and has borrowed one loan in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Cristelene requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets and feed for her business.

In the future, Cristelene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets and feed for her business.

loans.name: Ashford

texts.en:
Ashford is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya, where he has been farming for five years. He has a mixed farm that is currently producing milk and vegetables. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to meet the basic needs of his family. He is 33, married and has two children who both attend school.

Ashford has requested a loan of 31,200 KES in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes that this loan will enable him to acquire a high-quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The proceeds from the sale of milk will help him improve his family's livelihood and expand his farming activities.

His major challenge has been diseases and lack of enough capital to expand his farm. He hopes to acquire at least three high-quality dairy cows in the next five years and also venture into poultry farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Meregen

texts.en:
Meregen is 39 years old and married. She has two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Meregen has been raising pigs for six years and also earns an additional income from food vending.

Meregen is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 31 years old and has two school aged children. 

She is a farmer working in the Philippines and she earns PHP 8,000 per month. Myrna grows rice at their farm and has been doing it for almost six years.

Myrna is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase the needed agricultural inputs like fertilizers and pesticides. 

In the future, Myrna hopes to have a plenty of harvest in order to have more income to be used in financing the education of their children and satisfying their daily basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs like fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
She is 35 years old and married. She has five children and her children go to school.

She is currently in the business of selling goods like rice, sugar and oil.

She is requesting a loan to expand her business. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to smoothly run her family.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Willis

texts.en:
Willis is 33 years old. He is married with a 2-year-old child. He sells shoes to earn a living, and has employed two people. He has been in the business for eight years. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been empowered economically and has grown his business.  

Willis hopes to become a well-established businessman in the future. He has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy shoes.

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Donatille

texts.en:
Donatille is 44 years old and married with five children between the ages of 2 and 26 years old. Donatille sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, soap and so on. Her business is well organized. She employs one person to help her. Her business hours are from 6 am until 7 pm every day except on Saturday and she has 10 years of experience.

Donatille has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more products like juice, rice, sugar, cooking oil, soap and so on to sell. With the profits, Donatille will reinvest in her business and save for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more products like juice,soap,rice,sugar,cooking oil,and so on to sell

loans.name: Endalicia

texts.en:
Endalicia is 48 years old and married with three children.

Endalicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines, and has requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store.

Endalicia has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for four years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Endalicia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Mammadgasan

texts.ru:
Mammadgasan jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Yemu 50 let. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychasprojivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. 
Uje 11 let kak Mammadgasan zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit ovec. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u starshego brata kotoriy toje razvodit ovec. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit ovec dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya prodaji.
texts.en:
Mammadgasan is married and has two children.  He is fifty years old.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family.  
 
Mammadgasan has been a shepherd and sheep breeder for eleven years.  He started this business with his brother who breeds sheep.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to increase the number of sheep he can sell.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Ezira

texts.en:
Ezira is aged 25 and single. He is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya, where he has been farming for three years now. His mixed farm produces milk and eggs, which are sold to the local market. He earns additional income from his battery-charging business in the same town.

Ezira has made a loan request of 31,200 Kenyan shillings in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will help him expand his farming activities and improve his livelihood. He faces the challenge of insufficient animal feeds, which affects affects his production. He plans to acquire five quality dairy cows in the next five years that will improve his milk production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Carolina works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fruits and vegetables. Carolina is borrowing 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP)  through NWTF to purchase more stock of charcoal to sell.

Carolina has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could rent a space at the public market.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 49-year-old mother who has three school-aged children. She is a farmer working in the Philippines, and earns 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month. 

Elena is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase additional breeding livestock and feeds. Elena grows hogs, and has been doing this for almost six years.

In the future, Elena hopes to raise more pigs in order to help her husband in gaining income. She hopes that she can be able to improve and maintain this business in order to also improve their status of living.

loans.use: to purchase additional breeding livestock and feeds.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran is a housewife who stays at her home and does her household responsibilities. She is still very active at the age of 56 and performs her duties very efficiently. 

Her husband is a retired government employee.  She has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Her eldest child is a driver and operates a motor workshop. The second child is an electrician by profession and her daughter stays at home and helps Nazeeran in her routine tasks. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son who wants to expand his motor workshop business. With the loan, he will buy car batteries and some repair tools. He started this business five years ago and it is working well for him. 
 
Nazeeran hopes that an investment will help her son improve his business and that she will be able to collect some dowry for the marriage of her daughter with the increased profits.

loans.use: To buy car batteries and some repair tools

loans.name: Huy

texts.en: Prey Chor is a district of Kompong Cham Province. Most people live there to be able to make an income by farming. Huy, age 49, is a widow and the mother of three children. One of them is a sewing worker who is employed in a garment factory in Phnom Penh City, while the other two still depend on their mother's income. Huy has inherited a piece of farmland from her grandparents. She hopes to grow various crops on her  land. Due to lack of capital, Huy has decided to seek a loan to purchase farming materials such as seeds, fertilizer and other supplies to begin farming.

loans.use: to purchase farming materials such as seeds, fertilizer and other supplies.

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a coconut wine and vinegar business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy more stock of coconut wine to sell.

Fedelina has been in this business for 2 years. Fedelina earns additional income from raising pigs.

Fedelina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en:
Loyce is 28 years old and a single-mother of two.  She runs a boutique to earn a living.  She has been in the business for two years.  She is also employed and she earns 10, 000 Kenyan shillings. Through Faulu Kenya, she has been empowered economically and she has boosted her business.
Loyce hopes to become financially stable in the future.  She has requested a loan of 20, 000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes and sandal for her boutique.

loans.use: To buy clothes and sandals for her boutique

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. Gemma is married and has a ready to wear business in the Philippines.

Gemma has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of clothes to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for 6 years, and also earns additional income from manicure services.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 35 years old and single. She is a farmer working in the Philippines and earns PHP 6,000 per month. 

Grace is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to purchase additional piglets to raise and feed for them. She has been in the hog raising business  for almost 3 years.

In the future, Grace hopes to improve and strengthen this business in order to have stable source of income to satisfy her daily needs and save for their future.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets to raise and feed for them

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is aged 27 and single. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last four years in Kitale town, western Kenya. His farm produces milk, eggs, vegetables and maize, which he sells to middlemen. He solely depends on the income from his farm to cater for his basic needs. 

Walter has made a loan request of 31,200 Kenyan shillings in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. With the dairy cow he will acquire, his family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable him to expand his farming activities and improve his livelihood. 

His primary challenges have been the high cost of animal feeds and diseases, which are too costly to treat. In the future, he plans to acquire six quality dairy cows and a motorcycle for transporting his produce to the market.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen, a 41-year-old married mother of six children, three of whom are in school, has been raising pigs in the Philippines for 5 years now. Having borrowed twice from NWTF in the past to sustain her business, she is now requesting a PHP 15000 loan to buy additional pigs and feeds.  In the future, Helen would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feeds.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years old and married with seven children. Five of her children go to school. She is currently in the business of selling fruit and vegetables such as tomatoes, apples, and pineapples. 

Mary is requesting a loan to expand her business. With the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to support her family and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to increase her business

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man living with his parents and two siblings. He is from Lebanon. He has owned a barber shop since 2007, with 5 years of previous experience working in the same field. He learned this occupation when he was very young. As with the majority of Lebanese guys, he helps his family with his income. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase needed tools and supplies in order to improve his shop and be able to offer better services to his clients. In the future, he is planning to purchase a laser machine to attract more customers and earn higher income.

loans.use: to purchase needed tools and supplies.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Stellah is a 30-year-old businesswoman. She is married and has two children in school. Stellah sells clothes to earn a living and she employs one person. She works hard in her business to be able to educate her children so that they can have a bright future. 

Stellah is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy clothing to sell. She hopes to become financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Jaques

texts.en:
Jaques is 35 years old and has three children between the ages of eight and 12. He sells food items such as beans and his wife works in a hospital. Jaques has been selling foodstuff for the past three years, and his business is doing well. It has enabled him to send his children to school and to have some savings as well.

Jaques is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuff to sell and increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Bethy

texts.en:
Bethy is 32 years old and married with five children, one of whom goes to school. Her husband is a farmer. 

Bethy is currently working in another person’s salon. She is requesting a loan to establish her own salon business. She hopes to support her family with the extra profit from her loan.

loans.use: to establish her own beauty salon

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is very skillful. She weaves carpets in order to financially contribute to her family. Her husband runs a grocery store. His store is adjacent to the home and he sells daily household items like spices, sugar, cooking oil, rice, etc., to his customers. His prices are very reasonable and that’s why he makes good sales. 

Nasreen also carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. She has given birth to six children. All of them are enrolled in a local school except the youngest one who is not of school-going age yet. 

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With this loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to be able to provide more variety of groceries to his customers. He has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Nasreen is very confident that after the loan investment he will be able to earn better profits. 

Nasreen is a new client and this is her first loan application to Asasah. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries for a grocery store business.

loans.name: Jannette

texts.en: Jannette is 23 years old and has three children who are ages 1 to 6 years old. Her husband is a farmer. Jeannette has been selling food stuffs for the past six years and her business is going well. This business has enabled Jannette to educate her eldest child. Jannette needs a loan to buy more food stuffs such as beans in order to make more profits. She plans to continue paying her child’s school fees and make some savings.

loans.use: to buy beans and other food stuffs for sale.

loans.name: Aytakin

texts.ru:
Aytakin 34 qoda. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Ona zamujem i imeyet odnogo rebonka.
Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya molochnogo produkta iz kotorogo ona gotovit Sir. Ona uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Etomu biznessu ona nuchias u svoyey mami.
texts.en:
Aytakin is 34 years old.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her family.  She is married with one child.  

Now she needs 2000 AZN to buy cows to increase her milk production.  She makes cheese from the milk.  She has been working as a herdsman and cattle breeder for seven years.  She learned the business from her mother.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man with a two-year-old child. He does carpentry to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years and employs one person. John also runs a grocery store with the assistance of his wife.

John is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy timber and nails. He is hardworking and is looking forward to opening other business outlets in the future to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy timber and nails

loans.name: Ramy

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 27-year-old engaged man from Lebanon who is living alone. He has owned an animal husbandry business since 2006. He works hard to get the work done. He is responsible for completing the tough tasks such as cleaning the ranch and feeding the cows well to produce enough milk to sell. This allows him to earn a satisfactory income and live in proper conditions. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added fodder for the cattle. He is willing to increase his business productivity and earn greater income to make the needed savings since he is planning to get married soon and has to be capable of handling all the weddings expenses.

loans.use: to purchase added fodder for the cattle

loans.name: Allah Kan Dèmè Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames, avec en moyenne 33 ans et 2 enfants, les quatre membres du groupe Allah Kan Dèmè sont des femmes qui habitent le quartier Hamdallaye dans la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des relations de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché Château de Ségou. Les membres du groupe font le  commerce  d’articles tels  les fruits (melon, banane et mangue), les condiments alimentaires (sel de cuisine, fève, gombo) et les habits  pour enfants avec Sitan, qui est assise. 
Dans le besoin d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce pour pouvoir se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont  décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui ils sont à leur 5ème  prêt solidaire.
Sitan  a une grande renommée dans la vente d’habits  pour enfants de qualité au marché Château de Ségou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 15 douzaines d’habits pour enfants constituées de slips, robes, jupes et culottes. Elle se ravitaille en marchandises au grand marché de Bamako en gros et vend au comptant et à crédit à domicile et au marché Château de Ségou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Sitan  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être, épargné, réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer. Tout comme les autres membres du groupe, elle a pour objectif de construire une maison à usage d’habitation dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four members of the Allah Kan Dèmè group are married women who live for the most part in monogamous families. They average 33 years of age and two children each, and they live in the district of Hamdallaye, in the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali).

They know one another as neighbors and through their income-generating activities conducted at the Chateau market of Ségou. They sell various items such as fruits (melon, bananas, mangoes) and condiments (salt, beans, okra). Sitan, seated in the photo, sells children’s clothing. 

When the group members needed to increase their working capital so as to have the necessary cash to replenish their stock, they turned to the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with whom they are now on their fifth group loan cycle.

Sitan has a great reputation as a retailer of quality clothing for children at the Chateau market of Ségou. She will use her loan to buy 15 dozen outfits for children consisting of underwear, dresses, skirts and pants. She buys her stock wholesale at the Grand market of Bamako and sells for cash or credit, at home and at the Château market, to a clientele composed mainly of women.

With this loan, Sitan hopes to earn on average 30,000 FCFA per month, which will go towards her savings, reinvestment in her business, and payment of various household expenses. Like the other members of the group, her goal is to build a dwelling house through her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en:
Marie Grace 31 years old and is the mother of four children between the ages of four and nine. All of her children are in school. Marie Grace’s husband works in a hotel. For the past three years, she has run a stall where she sells foodstuff. Her business is going well and has enabled her to pay school fees for her children and save money.

Marie Grace is requesting a loan to buy more food items to sell and increase her profits. She hopes to be able to save money in the future.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: She is currently in the business of selling fruit on the side of the road. She sells tomato, pineapple, apple and other fruits. She is requesting a loan to expand her small business. She is 31 years old and married . She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan she hopes to be able to easily pay her school fees.

loans.use: to expand her small business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Balel Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Balel est composé de deux femmes monogames et deux veuves. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans, 6 enfants  et habitent toutes le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenus au marché Château de Ségou. Les membres du groupe font le  commerce d’articles tels,  les céréales avec Baya qui est la première debout à gauche, en main le riz dans une tasse en plastique, les draps de lits,  les fruits (banane et mangue) et le bois de chauffe. 
Dans le besoin d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont adhéré au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui ils sont à leur 7ème prêt solidaire.
Baya est connue à Hamdallaye pour sa vente de céréales de bonne qualité au marché Château de Ségou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs de riz au grand marché de Ségou avec les forains de Niono. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile et au marché Château de Ségou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Baya espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les petits nécessaires du foyer. Elle a pour ambition de devenir grossiste dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Balel group is made up of two monogamous women and two widows. They average 45 years of age with six children each and all live in the Hamdallaye district of Ségou (Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other through their income generating activities at the Château market in Ségou. The group members sell products such as cereals (this is the case for Baya who is standing on the far left of the photo with a plastic bowl of rice in her hand), bed sheets, fruits (bananas and mangos) and firewood.
