loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Nunufar

texts.en: Nunufar works in a kindergarten. Most of the family’s income comes from the farm and beehives. To increase their income Nunufar would like to buy two head of cattle and forage for winter. The additional income will greatly assist Nunufar’s and her husband’s very modest living.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and forage.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Essohanam Badagnaki

texts.fr: Revendeuse de charbon de bois depuis 2007 à domicile, Essohanam est mariée à un commerçant et mère  d’un enfant. Elle s’approvisionne à Mango, une localité située au nord du pays. Ce crédit va lui permettre de mieux s’approvisionner  pour répondre aux besoins des consommateurs en quantité souhaité et aider son mari dans l’éducation de leur enfant.
texts.en: Essohanam has sold charcoal out of her home since 2007. She is married to a merchant and is the mother of one child. She gets her supplies in Mango, a village in northern Togo. This loan will enable her to get more supplies in order to have sufficient quantities of charcoal at her disposal to meet the demand of her customers, and to help her husband with the education of their child.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kotognogontala  Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA IV sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans, 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à SOGODOGOLA, un des quartiers de la commune de KAI dans la préfecture  de Kadiolo,  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec  MARIAM accroupie au milieu.
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et la semence pour entretenir : 2hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de LOULOUNI et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 165.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The seven members of the KOTOGNOGONTALA IV group are married women with an average age of 27 and an average of two children.  Most of them live in polygamous families in Sogodogola, a neighborhood in Kaï in the Kadiolo prefecture in the 3rd administrative region of Mali.  They are working with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.  They are on their fourth loan with the organization, their past loans having been paid back.

Mariam, squatting in the center of the photo, raises peanuts.  With her loan, she plans to pay for labor costs and buy fertilizer and seeds for two hectares.  The crop is sold in the village, in the Loulouni market, and in the Sikasso market after harvest to a client base made up of both men and women.  She expects to earn an average profit of 165,500 FCFA per growing season.  This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with daily expenses.  She wishes to maintain this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to cultivate a larger area and make a bigger profit.

loans.use: to pay agricultural labor costs and buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Washington

texts.en:
Washington, a resident of Muranga in central Kenya, is married with four adult children. The youngest is still undergoing post secondary education. Washington has raised chickens for over ten years with their eggs being sold in the local market. He gets additional income from his monthly pension.

Washington has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him to purchase additional chickens and construct a poultry unit for them. He says the high cost of poultry feed and their treatment are the challenges he experiences.

Washington says he intends to expand his business into breeding and supplying chicks to local farmers. He says the income will help him take his last-born child through college.

loans.use: to purchase additional chickens and construct a poultry unit for them.

loans.name: Kotognontala  Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA IV sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  OUELENI FIEBALA, un des villages de la commune de KAI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution et tous les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec NAMINATA au milieu position debout.
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et de la semence pour entretenir : 1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de LOULOUNI et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of the KOTOGNOGONTALA IV group are married women with an average age of 34 and an average of three children, living in polygamous families in living in polygamous families in Ouéléni Fièbala, a village in the commune of Kaï in the sub-prefecture of Loulouni, in the 3rd administrative region of Mali.  They work with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.  They are on their fourth loan with the organization, their former loans having been paid back.  

Naminata, standing at center in the photo, cultivates peanuts.  With her loan she plans to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer and seeds to maintain one hectare.  The crop is sold in the village, at the Loulouni market and in the Sikasso market after harvest to a customer base of both men and women.  She expects to make an average profit of 145,500 FCFA per growing season.  This profit will allow her to pay her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.  She wishes to maintain this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to cultivate a larger area and make a bigger profit.

loans.use: to pay agricultural labor costs and buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Lena

texts.en: Lena is a school teacher. She has a large family and their low salaries cannot sustain the family. Together with her family members she takes care of the cattle and an orchard of walnut, apple and pear trees. Lena has applied for this loan to buy forage for the cattle. Having the cattle fed properly through the winter will assist Lena’s family’s sustainability. Lena lives together with her husband, two sons and a daughter-in-law.

loans.use: to buy forage for the cattle.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Ama est à son troisième crédit  dans notre institution  et est une bonne revendeuse de céréales et de charbon de bois car elle maîtrise bien son activité. Elle s’approvisionne à Anié(Atakpamé) puis revend  à domicile. Ama est mariée  à un commerçant et mère de deux(02) enfants.
texts.en: Ama is currently applying for her third loan with the microfinance institution WAGES. She is a successful seller of cereals and charcoal, because she fully masters her activity. She gets her supplies in Anié (Atakpamé) and resells out of her home. Ama is married to a merchant and is the mother of two children.

loans.use: to buy cereals and charcoal.

loans.name: Lamees

texts.en:
Lamees is a 28-year-old married woman, living in Jabalia Refugee Camp in Gaza Strip. Lamees took out a $1,000 loan from FATEN to improve her poor home furniture. Her husband, who is a Palestinian National Authority employee, has a decent salary but it doesn't help him improve the home furniture by paying in cash. By having a loan from FATEN to be repaid on a monthly basis, Lamees and the family can afford to improve their home furniture. Obtaining this loan is a priority for Lamees, so she can live with her family in better conditions. 

Lamees is a conservative woman; therefore, her husband is photographed instead of her.

loans.use: to improve her old poor home furniture.

loans.name: Nurkan's Group

texts.en:
Nurkan is 41 and married to a construction worker. Her husband and she have two sons and two daughters. The sons and the first daughter go to school, while the second daughter does not, as she is of preschool age (under seven). Nurkan is the leader of this group.

Nurkan works as a nurse; she provides medical services at home. Eleven years ago her husband’s parents presented the family with a calf and two goats. Since then Nurkan has been breeding livestock. With money received from the loan she will purchase more livestock to breed, fatten and sell.

In the future with the profits gained from selling livestock, Nurkan wants to purchase a vehicle. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a pump and a water tank.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is engaged in agriculture together with her husband. Because of the high rate of unemployment in the city, she and her husband failed to find stable work. Her husband takes up seasonal work, caring for the neighbors’ cattle. It is very hard for them to cover the family’s daily costs, especially during non-seasonal periods. 

Armine would like to keep her own livestock. With the loan’s help she will purchase calves, which will bring more stability to the family’s income and insure a brighter future for her family. She lives together with her husband and two children.

loans.use: to pay for calves.

loans.name: C4715 Abahujumugambi Group

texts.en:
Thaciana is 28 years old and is married with three children. Her business is well-organized and is well known in the business of selling products like rice, sugar, beans, sorghum, bananas and so on. Thaciana is the team leader of this group which is called "Abahujumugambi". In the picture, Thaciana has raised her hand.

Her business hours are from 7am until 5pm every day except on the weekend, and she currently employs one person to help her.  She has five years of experience in this business.

Thaciana and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase their businesses by cultivating more products (rice, sugar, beans, sorghum, bananas and so on) for sale. They will reinvest the profits in their businesses and save for their futures.

loans.use: To cultivate more products.

loans.name: Salimakan's Group

texts.en:
Salimakan is the leader of this group. She is 55 years old and married to a farmer. Together, she and her husband have raised seven children: four daughters and three sons. Their youngest son is a student and the other children are married and live separately with their own families. 

In order to earn money to provide for her family, Salimakan breeds livestock. She resells her animals after fattening them and earns 5,000 KGS a month. Salimakan is requesting a loan to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future, with the money gained from her business, she wants to improve her family’s living conditions.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is married with four children, all adults. She has been in farming for over 30 years, producing milk and maize and selling her products in the local market. She is helped by one farm hand.

Beatrice has made a request for 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank for her farm. She says her farming production and income will increase, and that the tank will save her much time in fetching water for the animals.

Beatrice reiterates that Juhudi's financial services are of great help to farmers.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nurcholpon's Group

texts.en:
Nurcholpon is the treasurer of this group. She is 32 and married to a construction worker. Together with her husband she is raising three sons and a daughter. In order to meet the family's needs, Nurcholpon takes orders for dressmaking supplies and sews Kyrgyz national clothing. She started this activity four years ago with an initial investment of 1000 soms. Her business runs well, and as a result she earns about 10 000 soms per month. With the money from this loan, Nurcholpon wants to buy the fabrics and materials she needs for sewing. In the future she wants to buy a house with the profits from her business.

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Baptiste

texts.en:
Baptiste is 27 years old and is married with two children who are between 3 and 5 years old. He sells local drinks. Baptiste has one year of experience.

Baptiste has requested his first loan from Kiva partner via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more sorghum to make a local drink. With these profits, Baptiste will reinvest in his business and pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more sorghum to make local drinks.

loans.name: Jarkynbubu's Group

texts.en:
Jarkynbubu is the leader of this group. She is 37 and married to a driver. Together with her husband she is raising three sons, who are all at school. Four years ago, with an initial investment of 3000 soms, Jarkynbubu started providing sewing services. At the moment her business runs well, and she earns about 18,000 soms per month. Jarkynbubu applied for a loan because she needs additional funds to expand the business. She wants to buy fabrics and a new sewing machine. In the future she wants to buy a big house.

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Aiymkul's Group

texts.en:
Aiymkul is the treasurer of this group. She is 44 and married to a driver. Four years ago, with an initial investment of 5000 soms, Aiymkul bought five goats and since then the family has been breeding livestock. By reselling livestock after fattening, Aiymkul earns an additional 7000 soms for the family budget. With the money received from this loan she wants to buy more livestock for breeding. In the future Aiymkul wants to use the profits gained from the business to buy a vehicle and improve the family’s living conditions.

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Qubuhlu Group

texts.en:
Ntanga is 57 years old and single, with six children, one of whom attends school. For the last six years, she has been selling fabric and other materials to make handicrafts out of her home. She also receives a grant from the South African government to support her children. In the photo she is raising her hand.

Eventually, Ntanga would like to open a fabric store. The biggest challenge that she faces is that her customers take her stock on credit but do not pay, which causes her to be late on making loan repayments. With the profits from this loan, she believes that she will be able to build a house for her family.

Ntaga says that WDB has helped her a lot and is the first company that has offered to help a poor person like her.

loans.use: to buy fabric, paint, and other materials for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more domestic items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a farmer in the Nyamira area of the Rift Valley province, Kenya. She has been in farming for over 30 years, producing and selling bananas, maize, beans, and coffee in the the local market. She is married with six children, of whom the last born is the only one still in school. She has two farm hands in her farm.

Jane has requested a loan of 46,800 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the dairy cow will improve her income and her family's standard of living. Jane is optimistic that the business will continue to grow and she will be able to buy a motor vehicle to help her deliver her produce as well as enable her to venture into the transportation business for more income.

Jane sees finances as the limitation in the farming business, especially for the purchase of farming supplies like fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is 35 years old and married. For the past 11 years, he has been working as a barber and he works hard to expand his business. That’s why he is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary hair and beauty products for his shop. He will also use his loan to buy new furniture for his home. 

Hasan works hard to fulfill all his family’s needs and desires and to accomplish the best. In the future, he hopes to become one of the most famous barbers in his area. Hasan is working hard to make extra space to add new products, such as gel and perfume, to his shop to increase his income and cover most of his expenses.

loans.use: to buy hair and beauty products for his shop and furniture for his home

loans.name: Inaya

texts.en:
Inaya, 27, has been a hair dresser for 10 years and always works hard to improve her business by purchasing products with special offers most of the time and providing her customers, who are relatives, neighbors, and friends, with car service. Inaya works from her house because she couldn't afford shop rent when she began this enterprise; since that time, customers have gotten used to and enjoy visiting her at home, so she has kept the business there.

Inaya is now requesting a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva in order to do necessary painting in her business-home and increase her beauty cosmetics capital. She will also help her fiance in their wedding expenses. An honest woman who provides good customer service, Inaya hopes to expand her business and continue providing beauty services to her customers.

loans.use: to do  decorations necessary for her business.

loans.name: Landouard

texts.fr: Landouard  est un commerçant, il est âgée de 47 ans, il est marié, est il est né au Burundi.  Il a 4 enfants  entre 4 et 14 ans, 3 vont à l’école,il vit avec son petit frère et sa petite soeur.Son niveau d’éducation est  primaire. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB.  Il va acheter  50sacs de riz, 20 cartons du jus ,10 jerricans  d’huile d’arachides et autre marchandises pour  son commerce et payer la main d’œuvre. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est  l’amélioration de l’accueille pour attire la clientèle et faire le marketing de son boutique pour conquérir le marché. Dans l’avenir il veut devenir le grand commerçant, et le grand  distributeur dans  la région de grand lac, pour sa famille il veut éduquer ses enfants jusqu’au niveau de l’université.
texts.en:
Landouard is a merchant, 47 years old and married. He was born in Burundi. He is the father of four children aged between 4 and 14, with three of them attending school. He lives with his younger brother and his younger sister. He finished elementary education.

This is his first loan cycle with the microfinance institution ACB. He will buy 50 sacks of rice, 20 boxes of juice, 10 jerrycans of groundnut oil and some other goods for his store, as well as pay for labor. His growth strategy for his business consists in giving a warmer welcome to customers and doing some marketing for his store to increase his market share. In future he wants to become an important merchant and wholesaler in the area of the great lake for the benefit of his family. He wants to provide his children with education until university level.

loans.use: to buy 50 sacks of rice, 20 boxes of juice, 10 jerrycans of groundnut oil and some other goods for his store, as well as pay for labor.

loans.name: Janviere

texts.en:
Janviere is 36 years old and is married with four children between the ages of four and twelve years old. Janviere owns a small shop selling cassava flour, sugar, salt, etc. She has been in this business for about one year; her business is open from 7am until 6pm every day.

Janviere has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more cassava flour, sugar, salt and so on for resale. With her profits, Janviere will reinvest in her business and save for her family's future.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava flour, sugar, salt, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Kimya Plus Group

texts.en:
Chantal is the leader of the community bank named “Kimya Plus.” It is composed of 13 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their individual businesses.

Chantal is 41 years old and the married mother of six children between the ages of five and 5 and 19. Two of her children go to school. Chantal sells second-hand clothing west of Kinshasa and has been active in her business since 2006. She began her business selling peanuts. Chantal joined one of Hope’s groups (a DRCongo microfinance program) in 2010 to expand her business, and has previously received four loans that she has successfully repaid. Thanks to Hope’s loans, Chantal’s business has prospered and generates a weekly profit of 60 USD. 

Chantal is requesting a loan to buy a bundle of second-hand clothing to resell at a profit to increase her capital. Her ambition is to someday open a drugstore due to the high demand for medicine in her community.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of second-hand clothing to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Youth Tukore Associates Group

texts.en:
Thirty-five-year-old Robert operates a general merchandise retail business in Ntungamo Town. This happily married man's business has been in existence for the past four years. Robert is a father of two, and he says it was the persuasion of one of his closest friends that gave him the motivation to try his hand at this business. Before that, Robert was living only within the means of his low-paying teaching job. He still does teach, notwithstanding the low remuneration.

Robert is a stickler for diligence, and he says the hard work he has put into everything he does has been showing in his success. Weekly he says this retail business generates him profits totaling up to 520,000 Ugandan shillings. This Kiva loan's purpose, he says, is for the purchase of more retail commodities like sugar, salt, plastics, dry beans, rice, maize flour, toothpaste, etc., to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities like sugar, salt, rice, dry beans, etc., to resell.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es: Concepción D. 38 años D. edad, habita en casa propia con su compañero D. vida y tres hijas que se encuentran estudiando. Ella es una mujer ejemplar la cual trabaja duramente para sacar adelante a su querida familia. Hace muchos años y gracias a muchos esfuerzos ha logrado establecer una  pequeña tienda en la cual ofrece todo tipo D. producto D. primera necesidad como: granos básicos, detergente, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. Además posee un molino eléctrico en el que muele variedad D. productos como: maíz, frijoles, arroz, etc. Muchas personas la buscan ya que en el mismo lugar pueden hacer sus compras y al mismo tiempo moler su maíz para hacer sus ricas tortillas. Concepción es una mujer emprendedora y gracias a su creatividad  ha logrado mantener activo su negocio. Ella no se rinD.,  quiere mejorar su servicio y hacer que su negocio crezca cada día más. Es por esta razón que ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para cumplir su sueño y mejorar el servicio que ofrece y al mismo tiempo mejorar su condición D. vida y la D. su familia. Con el crédito espera comprar variedad D. artículos D. tienda como: arroz, maíz, frijoles, azúcar, pan dulce, golosinas, etc. y seguir dando mantenimiento a su molino que por años les ha generado una gran parte D. sus ingresos.
texts.en: Concepcion is 38 years old and she live sin her own home together with her life partner and three daughters, who are all in school. She is an exemplary woman who works hard to proviD. for her beloved family. Many years ago, and thanks to great efforts, she managed to establish a small store from where she sells all types of essential products, such as: basic grains, detergents, snacks, pastries, etc. In addition, she also has an electric mill and she grinds a variety of products, including: corn, beans, rice, etc. Many people look to her because in the same place where they do their shopping they can also have their corn ground to make delicious tortillas. Concepcion is an enterprising woman and thanks to her creativity she has managed to keep her business active. She will not give up and she wants to improve her service and to keep her business growing more each day. She has maD. the decision to request a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) to accomplish her dream and to improve the service that she offers. She also wants to improve the quality of her life and that of her family. With the loan she hopes to purchase a variety of store merchandise, such as: rice, corn, beans, sugar, pastries, snacks, etc. She also wants to proviD. maintenance to her mill. For years it has generated a large part of her income.

loans.use: to purchase rice, corn, beans, pastries, snacks, etc, and to carry out maintenance on her mill.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José Luis habita en su casa con su compañera de vida. Por años se ha dedicado a los negocios. Posee un puesto en el cual ofrece variedad de hamacas, corbos, etc. En  el Mercado Central del Municipio donde habita. Es una zona muy tranquila, accesible y sobre todo segura. José ha logrado ganarse  la confianza de muchas personas en la zona y mucho prefieren sus productos ya que son de buena calidad y con muy buenos precios. José quiere ver florecer su negocio y ha decidido  solicitar este crédito con la esperanza y fe puesta en Dios que de esta manera su condición económica mejorará. El crédito lo quiere invertir en compra de variedad de estilos y tamaños de hamacas así como diferentes tipos de corvos y otros artículos que los clientes buscan con frecuencia. Espera que los resultados sean positivos para poder aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jose Luis lives at home with his life partner. For many years he has been a businessman. He has a stand from where he sells hammocks, knives, etc, in the central market of the municipality where he lives. It is a tranquil region and it is accessible, and most importantly, safe. Jose has managed to earn the trust of many individuals in the region and they greatly prefer his products. They are of good quality and at very good prices. Jose wants to flourish his business and so he has decided to request this loan and with his hope and faith placed in God he will improve his financial situation. He wants to invest the loan in the purchase of a variety of styles and sizes of hammocks and in various types of knives and other articles that his clients request frequently. He hopes that the results will be positive to be able to aspire towards a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of hammocks in different styles ad sizes and to purchase different types of knives.

loans.name: Sainte Cathérine Plus Group

texts.en:
Mamu is the chairwoman of a community bank named “Sainte Cathérine Plus” composed of 15 small business owners. Bank members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Mamu is 57 years old and married. She is the mother of nine children, ranging in age between 17 and 27. Three of her children attend school. Mamu’s main activity is selling smoked fish from her business located west of the city of Kinshasa. Besides that, she also sells beverages. Currently, her business brings in 30 USD weekly. Mamu has been a micro-entrepreneur since 2007 and is a loyal client of the MFI HOPE RDC. She has received and repaid four previous loans. 

Mamu is requesting a loan to increase her stock of goods by buying packages of smoked fish to meet the high demand of the customers in her community and to make more profits. Her ambition is to become the best smoked fish provider in her area.

loans.use: to purchase smoked fish to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mirian Del Carmen

texts.es: Mirian del Carmen D. 38 años D. edad, vive en casa propia con su compañero D. vida y sus dos hijas D. 10 y 12 años, las cuales se encuentran cursando sus primeros años D. estudio. Para Mirian su familia lo es todo y no se cansa D. luchar por darles lo mejor. Mirian posee un puesto D. tortillas en su hogar D. residencia, el cual, con gran dedicación y amabilidad atienD. día a día. La zona en donD. se encuentra ubicado es muy concurrida y D. muy fácil acceso. Mirian es una mujer emprendedora que gracias a su carisma ha sabido ganarse la confianza D. su vecindario y estos cada día la prefieren mas, ya que siempre encuentran las ricas he higiénicas tortillas cuando ellos las buscan. Mirian ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en el mantenimiento D. su tortillería así como para comprar la materia prima necesaria (maíz, agua, gas propano, etc.) con el objetivo D.  dar a sus clientes el mejor servicio posible y D. esta manera poder aspirar a una mejor condición D. vida.
texts.en: Mirian del Carmen is 38 years old and she lives in her own home together with her life partner and their two daughters, aged 10 and 12. They are in their first years of schooling. For Mirian her family is everything and she does not tire in fighting to proviD. them with the best. Mirian has a tortilla stand located in her own home, which, with a great deal of dedication and kindness, she manages day after day. the region where she is located is very well traveled and access is very easy. Mirian is an enterprising woman who, thanks to her charisma, has been able to earn the trust of her neighborhood. Each day they prefer her more because they always find delicious and hygienic tortillas they look for. Mirian has maD. the decision of request a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) to invest in the maintenance of her tortilla business, which is to purchase necessary ingredients (corn, water, propane gas, etc.). Her objective is to proviD. her clients with the best service possible and to aspire towards a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase corn, water, propane gas, etc.

loans.name: Carmen Consuelo

texts.es: Carmen Consuelo de 50 años de edad, reside en casa propia con su hija Rocío de 21 años, la cual posee un pequeño empleo para colaborar con los gastos de su hogar. Carmen ha hecho de su casa un negocio ya que desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como: desodorantes, variedad de cremas, maquillaje, champo, etc. Este negocio es el que le ha permitido sobrevivir durante muchos años  ya que ha sido su principal fuente  de ingresos. Es por esta razón que desea mantenerlo activo por muchos años más y seguir recibiendo los frutos del mismo. Ella es una mujer arriesgada y sobre todo responsable se pone muchas metas y una de ellas es ampliar su negocio ya que su sueño es verlo florecer y poder obtener mayores ganancias para aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida. Esto la ha motivado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en el mismo y poder comprar variedad de productos de belleza como: cremas para el cabello, cremas para el cuerpo y para manos, champo, lociones, cosméticos, desodorantes, etc. Y poder así mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Carmen Consuelo is 50 years old and lives in her own home together with her 21 year-old daughter Rocío who has a small job in order to contribute towards covering their household expenses.

Carmen has turned her house into a business.  For several years she has been selling beauty products such as deodorants, a range of creams, makeup, shampoo, etc.  This business has enabled her to survive for many years since it has been her main source of income.  For this reason, she would like to keep it running for many more years and continue reaping rewards from it.

Carmen is a brave and responsible woman who has many goals.  One of her goals is to expand her business since her dream is to see it flourish and to make more profits from it so that she can aspire to a better quality of life.  This motivated her to request a loan from Integral so that she could invest in her business and buy a variety of beauty products such as hair creams, body creams, hand creams, shampoo, lotions, cosmetics, deodorants, etc.  This will enable her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beauty products such as hair creams, body creams, hand creams, shampoo, lotions, cosmetics, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Baltazar Vidal

texts.es: Baltazar Vidal de 36 años de edad, reside en su hogar con su esposa, una hija de 6 años y un hijo de 10 meses. Baltazar es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor, ya que con muchos esfuerzos ha hecho crecer una pequeña tiendita en la cual ofrece diversidad de productos de primera necesidad como: huevos, azúcar, arroz, leche, golosinas, etc. para él su familia lo es todo y es la razón por la cual se esfuerza día a día para darles todo lo que se merecen. Su sueño es ver a sus hijas en mejores condiciones y darles el estudio para que logren ser profesionales. Para poder cumplir su sueño necesita seguir manteniendo activo su negocio por mucho más tiempo ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito con la esperanza que de esta manera logrará lo que tanto desea. Con el crédito espera comprar diversidad de productos como: azúcar, huevos, aceite, arroz, leche, golosinas, frijoles, papel, etc. Para poder surtir su tienda y poder ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de productos. De esta manera espera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Baltazar Vidal is 36 years old and lives together with his wife, his 6 year-old daughter and his 10 month-old son.  Baltazar is a hard-working and entrepreneurial man.  With a lot of effort, he has managed to grow his small store where he sells a range of basic household products such as eggs, sugar, rice, milk, candies, etc.  For Baltazar, his family means everything and they are the reason why he works hard every day, so that he can provide them with everything they deserve.  His dream is to provide his children with better living conditions and an education so that they can become professionals.  In order to achieve his dream, he needs to keep his business running for a lot longer since it is his main source of income.

Baltazar took the decision to request this loan with the hope that it will help him to achieve what he wishes for so much.  He hopes to use the loan to buy a variety of products such as sugar, eggs, oil, rice, milk, candies, beans, paper, etc. to stock his store so that he can offer his customers a variety of products.  In this way, he hopes to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sugar, eggs, oil, rice, milk, candies, beans, paper, etc.

loans.name: Elida Albertina

texts.es: Elida Albertina de 51 años de edad, reside con su hija de 21 años en casa propia. Elida es una mujer increíble y ejemplar ya que ha trabajado y sigue trabajando duramente para ayudar un poco con la economía de su hogar y dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Ella posee una pequeña tiendita en donde ofrece diferentes productos de primera necesidad. Los clientes la prefieren por su amabilidad y buen servicio y esto ha hecho que su clientela aumente. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y a pesar de su edad no se da por vencida. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de sus seres queridos y para ello necesita más ingresos  es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL que le permita comprar lo necesario para mantener surtida su tienda con diferentes artículos como: aceite, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, sal, café y de mas artículos para  tener todo lo que el cliente solicita. Con esto espera obtener mayores ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hija.
texts.en:
Elida is 51 years old and resides with her 21-year-old daughter in her own house. Elida is an incredible and exemplary woman who has worked and continues working hard to help her household economy and provide a better quality of life for her family. She has a little store in which she offers different products of primary necessity. 

Her customers prefer her for her amiability and good service, and this has made her clientèle grow. She is an enterprising woman and despite her age, she hasn't grown weary. Her dream is to improve the lives of her loved ones and for that reason, she needs additional income. That's why she decided to request a loan through INTEGRAL that will permit her to buy the necessities to keep her store supplied with different articles: cooking oil, rice, sugar, beans, salt, coffee and all the rest, to have what her customers request.

With this loan, she hopes to obtain greater earnings to improve the quality of life for her and her daughter.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, rice, sugar, beans, salt, coffee, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Rigoberto de 60 años de edad reside solo en su casa ya que todos sus hijos son mayores de edad y ya se encuentran casados. Rigoberto ha trabajado y sigue trabajando duramente para ganarse el pan de cada día. Es un hombre luchador el cual le gusta recibir el fruto de su esfuerzo. Él posee un pequeño puesto en el cual vende variedad de medicinas tales como: vitaminas, jarabes para la tos, alcohol, pastillas para dolores, y todo tipo de medicamento. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en una zona muy estratégica y concurrida en especial su negocio ya que toda la gente de su domicilio lo conoce por ser un hombre honesto y trabajador el cual ofrece calidad en los productos que ofrece. Es un hombre que le gusta tomar riesgos es por eso que ha decidido hacer este crédito a INTEGRAL para abastecer su negocio y comprar mercadería al por mayor como: variedad de pastillas, vitaminas, jarabes, pomadas, alcohol, y de mas productos que ayuden a atraer a más clientes y a mejorar las ventas para lograr obtener mejores ganancias y mejorar su condición de vida. Cabe mencionar que anteriormente ya ha  tenido crédito con INTEGRAL y se clasifica como un cliente responsable, el cual gracias a esta ayuda ha podido hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 60 years old and resides alone in his house, since all his children are grown and married. He has worked and continues to work hard to earn his daily bread. He is a competitive man who likes to receive the fruit of his efforts.

Rigoberto has a small post where he sells a variety of medicines such as: vitamins, cough syrups, alcohol, pain pills, and all kinds of medications. His business is located in a very strategic and much traveled zone. Everyone knows him as an honest and hard-working man who offers quality products.

Rigoberto is an enterprising person. That's why he came to INTEGRAL for a loan to stock his business and buy merchandise at wholesale, including a variety of pills, vitamins, syrups, pomades, alcohol, and other products that can attract more customers, increase sales, better his earnings and improve his condition of life.

It's worth mentioning that he has previously had loans through INTEGRAL and is classified as a responsible client who, thanks to this help, has been able to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at wholesale, such as: a variety of pills, vitamins, syrups, pomades, alcohol, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Dora Elena

texts.es: Dora Elena de 36 años de edad, habita en casa familiar con sus dos hijos de 13 y 16 años, los cuales por el momento se encuentran estudiando. Dora es una mujer trabajadora que lucha día a día para sacar adelante a su querida familia. Se dedica a los negocios ya que vende diversidad de productos como: tortillas, bebidas y almuerzos. Es muy conocida en la zona gracias a su amabilidad, buena e higiénica comida que ofrece. Es una mujer responsable y confiable pero sobre toda con visión emprendedora ya que sueña con ver florecer su negocio y es por esta razón que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito para invertir en su negocio y comprar la materia prima necesaria como: arroz, carne, pollo, verduras, bebidas, maíz, y de mas artículos necesarios para preparar los ricos platillos y tortillas que cada día ofrece a sus clientes. Con esto espera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Dora Elena is 36 years old. She lives in a house with her two children, aged 13 and 16. They are in school. Dora is a hardworking woman who struggles to get her beloved family ahead everyday. She works selling a variety of products, such as: tortillas, drinks and lunches. She is well known in the area thanks to her friendliness and the good and sanitary food she sells. She is a responsible and trustworthy woman who above all has an enterprising vision, since she dreams of making her business flourish. That is why she has decided to ask for this loan to invest in her business and buy ingredients such as: rice, meat, chciken, vegetables, drinks, corn, etc. as well as other necessary items to make the delicious dishes and tortillas that she offers to her customers. With this, she hopes to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as: rice, meat, chicken, vegetables, drinks, corn, etc.

loans.name: Iwale

texts.en: This borrower is currently in the business of selling a weaving bed sheet and she is requesting a loan to expand her business. She is 22 years old and married. Her husband also runs a small business. She has two children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: for buying more bed sheet for weaving,expansion.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 31 years old. He is married with two children in school. He runs a retail shop to earn a living, and has employed one person. He has operated the business for six years. He is also employed separately. He has benefited from Faulu Kenya because he has increased his business stock with his previous loans. He has also learned how to manage his business.

Julius hopes to expand his business into a wholesale one in five years. He has requested 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize flour, rice, soda, detergents and soaps.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, rice, soda, detergents and soaps.

loans.name: Grimanesa

texts.es:
Grimanesa nació en la ciudad del Calca (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 62 años de edad. Actualmente, Grimanesa vive en la misma hermosa ciudad donde nació y tiene un hijo. Grimanesa se dedica a la venta de útiles de escritorio y pasamanería. Ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en el modelo mercado de Calca. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Grimanesa  requiere el préstamo para pagar comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo cuarderno, lapiceros y otros cosas mas. EL sueño de la socia de Grimanesa es abrir una tienda de bazar. 
 
La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Virgen del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Grimanesa was born in the city of Calca (Cusco, Perú), and she is 62 years old.  Grimanesa currently lives in the same beautiful city where she was born, and she has a son.  

Grimanesa sells desk supplies and assorted merchandise.  She has a stand where she sells at the Modelo Mercado (market) in Calca.  She has had this business for 15 years.  It is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

On this occasion Grimanesa needs the loan to pay for more merchandise like notebooks, pens, and other things.  Grimanesa’s dream is to open a bazaar type store.

She is a very responsible and hard-working woman.  These qualities are the reason her colleagues invited her to participate the the Virgen del Carmen Communal Bank with the Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Prudencienne

texts.en:
Prudencienne is 41 years old and is married with 8 children between the ages of 3 and 25 years old. She earns a living by sewing different styles of clothes. Her business is well organized and she is in her twenty-fifth successful year.

Prudencienne has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more materials for her sewing. By expanding her business and adding more equipment and workers, she hopes to increase her profits so she can save for her future and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase new materials for her sewing.

loans.name: Buisson Ardent Plus Group

texts.en: Christine, age 44, is the chairwoman of the community bank named Buisson Ardent Plus, which consists of 19 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through the microfinance institution, HOPE RDC, with the goal of developing their businesses. Christine has been in the microenterprise world for years. She has been running a restaurant located southeast of the city of Kinshasa. She is a loyal client of HOPE RDC, who has already received nine different loans and has repaid them properly. She intends to use the next loan to increase the stock of her restaurant by buying a sack of flour, fish and beans with the aim of increasing her profits. Each week, her business brings in a profit of $70. Her ambition is to open a big restaurant in her area. Christine is married and has three children whose ages are between 6 and 12 years old. Two of them go to school.

loans.use: to increase the stock of her restaurant by buying flour, beans and other goods.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
Eulogia nació en la ciudad del Calca (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 47 años de edad. Actualmente, Eulogia vive en la misma hermosa ciudad donde nació junto con su único hijo. Eulogia tiene un pequeña bazar de venta de ropa en el mercado modelo de Calca, ella vende ropa para niños, damas y caballeros. Ya son nueve años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Eulogia requiere el préstamo para comprar zapatos de bebes, ropa de bebe, vestidos  y otra cosas más.

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Virgen del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Eulogia was born in the city of Calca (Cusco, Perú), and she is 47 years old.  Eulogia currently lives with her only child in the same beautiful city where she was born.  

Eulogia has a small bazaar where she sells clothing at the Modelo Mercado (Market) in Calca.  She sells clothes for children, women, and men.  She has had this business for nine years.  It is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business.

On this occasion Eulogia needs the loan to buy baby shoes, baby clothes, general clothing, and other things.

She is a very responsible and hard-working woman.  These qualities are the reason her colleagues invited her to participate the the Virgen del Carmen Communal Bank with the Asoscicación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy baby shoes, baby clothes, general clothing, and other things.

loans.name: Yeni Mercedes

texts.es: Yeni Mercedes se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos y destace de cerdos. Hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio, con el paso del tiempo ella ha logrado brindarle a su familia el pan de cada día. Inicio con fondos propios pues a pesar de que no tenía mucho capital logro salir adelante. El financiamiento es para la compra de cuajada, cremas, queso, leche entre otros producto productos para ofrecerlos.
texts.en:
Yeni Mercedes sells dairy products and butchers pigs.  She has had this business for over eight years.  With the passage of time she has managed to give her family their daily bread.  

She started with her own funds.  In spite of the fact that she did not have much capital, she managed to get ahead.

The loan is to buy curd, cream, cheese, and milk, among other products to sell.

loans.use: to buy curd, cream, cheese, and milk, among other products to sell.

loans.name: Hardy

texts.en:
Hardy is 33 years old and married with two children, ages 5 and 7. He runs a general store in Lumley, a neighborhood in Freetown. He has one employee. Hardy has been in this business for 10 years and sells provisions, rice, soap and soft drinks in his store. He also earns income from a cinema business. He says that the main challenge to his business is price inflation in provision items.

Hardy requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more provision items like milk, soft drinks and soap. Hardy says that the extra income from this loan will help him increase his savings from the profit he will make. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, soap and tinned milk.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 35 years old and is married with six children. Her business is well-organized and she sells sorghum in sacks.  She has 1 year of experience and her business is open every day. 

With the new loan she has requested, Vestine will be able to purchase more sorghum in sacks for resale, which will help her to earn more profit and to expand her business. With the expansion of her business, she hopes to employ neighbors in the community so that they can send their children to school. She also hopes that once this business grows, people in her community will be able to buy groceries and she will be able to pay school fees for her own children.

loans.use: To increase her business by buying more quantities of sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 45 years old. She is married with four children. She operates St. Luke Academy so as to earn a living. The school has been operating for one and a half years. She has managed to grow the school because of the support from Faulu Kenya.  

Esther hopes to grow the school and add more classes in the future. She has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy the school compound.

loans.use: to buy the school compound.
